Reviews.Title: “Decent location”
Reviews.Author: mkbk1234
Reviews.Content: If location is what you are looking for then this is the place. We could see LAX from our room. We did an overnight stop when travelling form LA to Chicago, The rooms are quite small and unfortunatley our room had cigarette smell ( smoke free hotel!) The bed is soft and comfortable however the linen had stains on it. It is quite old and could do with a bit of TLC but overall as a stopover hotel this is pretty good. Would stay here again if need be. Also the A/C is quite noisy, you may need ear plugs. Staff are polite.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent stay close to the airport LAX”
Reviews.Author: schey3
Reviews.Content: The business hotel close to LAX airport is a good place in the case you arrive late or you fly with a red eye on the next morning. The hotel offers a free shuttle transfer to the airport. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean and sound proof. The TV program was poor. The looby bar offers coffee and snacks. The restaurant is pleasant, the barkeeper nows his business.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed!”
Reviews.Author: toniakay
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised by this place. We picked it because it was cheap and close to the airport. We just needed a place to crash for 24 hours between International flights. They offered a great late check out rate and had everything we needed. The in hotel Restaurant was delicious! Juan was a wonderful host. Couldn't ask for better service or attention from the wait staff. Concierge Phillip was helpful and every one of his suggestions were perfect! I love that they are so eco-friendly and generally friendly. The shuttle took awhile to come, but it was obviously due to traffic - not the fault of the hotel. The view out our room made me feel like we were sitting on the LAX tarmac. Incredible! But it was absolutely quiet - didn't hear a peep from inside or out. The bad? Well, the in-room coffee pot did not want to wake up and the sleep number bed would not function. Since I expected neither one of these, it wasn't an issue for me. I would have loved to use both, though. Everything else I needed or wanted exceeded expectations and made this stop over into a mini-vacation for my mother and I. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is good apart from distance to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: RK070511
Reviews.Content: Was there during thanksgiving last year. Hotel had nothing special to talk about. Parking was Unbelievably high. Rooms were ok but could have been better. A/C took longer than expected to cool the room. Overall average hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment -- You have a choice -- Avoid this one!”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: I was returning from a business trip in the Philippines and needed a hotel for layover to catch my domestic flight back home. All I can say is, if you are business person looking for a place to stay -- Avoid this one totally. Here is what happened to me: 1. Shuttle service from this hotel is horrid. I think they must have only one shuttle (maybe two). Traffic around the LAX airport loop is always full, so the smart hotels send out like two or three shuttles at the same time to continue to pick up customers around the clock. I counted the Hilton and Westin Shuttles pass me by no less then 6 times while I waited for the Radisson shuttle -- which took 40 mins to reach me. It took me no less then 30 mins to de-plane, go through immigration, and collect my bags.....only to be left to wait 40 mins by my hotel. 2. Room Service - Here is a good one -- The hotel will tell you that they have 24 hour room service. But when you get to the room and read the menu you see that there are all kinds of conditions around when you can order items. Makes it confusing and is clearly oriented toward meeting the needs of the staff, not the customer. 3. I ordered breakfast and asked that it be delivered at 5am so that I could get to the airport in time for my flight. I am a diabetic and cannot take my medication without food. Knowing from the complicated menu that I would not be allowed to order an egg before 5:30am, I called and made a special request that it be delivered at 5am. I was put on "hold" by the operator to verify that this could be done and was told "yes." Guess what....it never showed up. No food for a diabetic on medication going to an airport terminal with very limited food services. I should sue these people. My company is expanding and will be doing business in the Philippines over the next two years. We will need a base hotel at LAX to support us. Radisson was our first choice to see if they would work out for us over the next couple of years. My company leadership will want my report next week on recommendations for this hotel. Needless to say, we will not be signing any long term contracts with Radisson. What is clear from this situation is that you have a very poor leadership structure at this hotel. It does not employ the kind of quality improvement systems that keep mistakes from happening. LAX has numerous choices for places to stay -- if you are in Business -- Avoid the Radisson -- they are not designed to support your needs. A hotel that is not designed to support a business person is basically not supporting YOUR BUSINESS -- then what purpose do they actually serve?

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: hummergirlTempe_Az
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip w/ 7 other people. VERY close to the airport. The rooms look nice, are clean, and the restaurant was good. Good beds, nice linens. They remodeling the parking garage, so you have to park about a block away and pay $12 a day, OR valet for $25 a day. The A/C in my room did NOT work properly. Day 1 I notified the manager. They said they would fix it and comped the buffet breakfast ($20). Day 2 it still didn't work. Said they would look at it again (they paid half of the valet parking), Day 3 they admitted the A/C was screwed up (they paid all of my valet parking). They were putting in a new TV (digital) system on our floor, and every day there were MANY men, ladders, wires and equipment in our hallway. Got this on Hotwire for about $70, so when you add in the free parking and breakfast, it was a good value. If you are paying rack rates, NOT so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great for One Night”
Reviews.Author: ThemaceSomerset
Reviews.Content: Arrived quite late at night. Very quick and efficient service. Rooms very large and comfortable but a real oddity in a modern hotel was a very old and poor quality TV - seemed really out of place with everything else there. Breakfast was very nice - lots of choice and pretty good value for money although the hot plate was more a 'warm plate'. Staff very helpful - I had a problem with a rental car and they were very good in helping me sort it out. Bus service to and from airport very good.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller255100
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here, we had booked 2 nights at the hotel to ensure we could check in early the morning of our arrival. Upon checking in we were informed that there were no rooms available. After sometime at reception we were offered a complimentary buffet breakfast to enjoy whilst they cleaned a room for us which we were very grateful for after our long flight. Later on we were given a room key only to find the room had not been cleaned, another trip to reception for another room, eventually we checked into our room. It was fairly basic but had all that we needed except for an in room safe and when we called reception for a safety depost box we were told there weren't any left, so we had to take the risk of leaving valuables in the room. Beds were a little strange, you change the comfort to suit you with a button which inflates air or deflates air to the mattress. Above all it was ok, we walked from the airport with our luggage and were only charged 1 nights accommodation in the end.

Reviews.Title: “good stop over for jet lagged travellers”
Reviews.Author: sandra b
Reviews.Content: We flew from Heathrow to LA on the 14th April and needed a one night stay before picking up a car and travelling on to Las Vegas (affordable direct flights unavailable). We have done this trip once before 2 years ago, it worked out well so booked with Radisson LAX again. We had a problem with the shuttlebus this time. The first sign you see on coming out of the airport after 18hrs travelling is a red one saying hotel shuttle buses, makes sense to wait there! After 30mins we gave up and got a taxi. Mr Grumpy, the taxi driver reckoned we could have walked it. Not with all our luggage and a 77 year old mother-in-law! Apparently the Radisson bus stops futher to the left under a green sign, though we did'nt see their bus at all. Anyway, the staff as always at a Radisson, were patient and very helpful. This is appreciated as our brains are still halfway over the Atlantic by this time and we are exhausted, especially, the mother-in-law. Good reasonably priced food is easily available, a must for stomach's on UK time. The rooms are big, quiet and clean with a coffee maker. The beds are very comfortable with a remote to alter the hardness of the mattress. We were awake very early as we were keen to get on the road. There were plenty of staff to help us on our way. There was complimentary breakfast (offered because having to get a taxi) at 5.30 am, someone to look after the luggage and someone else to sort out the taxi to pick up car from Alamo rental at Aviation Blvd. The hotel is not suitable for a holiday stay. It's an airport hotel and does the job of taking care of travellers very well. We arrived exhausted, a bit confused and stressed. We got fed, rested, fed again and helped on our way with smooth efficiency. If we do this trip again we will book The Radisson LAX.

Reviews.Title: “"Simple rooms, close to Airport, average place to stay"”
Reviews.Author: Bhushan-Singh
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is close to airport and that was the reason for selecting it. Rates are ok. Free Shuttle connects this hotel with airport. You can walk to bus stand which is near the hotel for travelling to various places at Los Angeles, specially to visit beaches Santa Monica & Venice beaches. The rooms are average & we had taken room facing airport and could see planes landing. But inspite of room facing airport there was no noise/disturbance which was good. The Hotel lobby has nice open restaurant for having breakfast. I would recommend this hotel only if you have come to see/explore Los Angeles & need place to spend night/keep luggage or you are in transit & need accomodation close to airport. Staff at reception & travel desk were nice & helpful. All tourist buses which you may have booked for seeing Los Angeles comes to hotel for pickup.

Reviews.Title: “close to airport but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: bekafaith
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because we needed something close to the airport and the pictures looked great, not my best decision. The pictures do not look like the rooms provided, the windows were filthy the shower bath had the linoleum half missing from the bottom of the bath so there was no way i was getting in it and it looked dirty. The service was also poor. We waited at the shuttle pick up spot for 45 mins and the hotel driver drove past us TWICE even tho we were waving and pointing and jumping up and down- just rude. After walking to the hotel we were greeted at reception with a friendly "Welcome Mr and Mrs Last name, your room is ready for your and it has 2 single beds " I laughed because it was so dumb and from seeing the look on my fast she replied with "How about a king bed?" considering that is what I requested in the first place it seemed the appropriate response. The concierge staff were rude and completely unhelpful when we asked for directions and were more interested in talking to their friends and looking at their mobiles and I would never ever stay here again even if you paid me too.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, right next to LAX”
Reviews.Author: CanTravel106
Reviews.Content: This is THE closest hotel to LAX (literally right at the beginning of the ramp to departures level). Was easy to get to, and easy to navigate to other LA spots too. Only parking is valet at $22/day.' Very quiet inside - even though my room overlooked the airport there was no airport noise in my room. Comfortable hotel and room. Good overall quality. Nice bedding and great pillows. Bathroom showing a bit of age (wallpaper edge starting to lift, some chips, cracked sink). Staff are the real gem here - always greet you, very pleasant and very attentive to assist. I was 30 minutes from leaving to catch my flight, with a wet head of long hair when discovered room hair dryer not working. Housekeeping got maintenance up fast and within 10 minutes a new dryer was installed. Excellent breakfast in restaurant. One note for improvement - they don't have card access controls in elevators, so all floors fully open at all hours. This needs to change, especially with how busy it is, where it is located, and large numbers of people around. Floors should only be accessible with a guest room access card as is the case in most better hotels, and even in other Radisson hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sugarcube20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights & everything was fine. There was some confusion with my booking but the staff dealt with it quickly & professionaly. The room was very clean with 2 double beds. The bathroom was a tad small but had everything i needed. The only downside is that you can hear everything from neighbouring rooms. With it being so close to the airport there can be a lot of coming and going for early flights. I had earplugs with me so I was able to get around that. There is no aircraft noise whatsoever. I would have no problem staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay next to airport”
Reviews.Author: GobClan
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel during a standby situation at LAX. The hotel is located RIGHT at the entrance of LAX...in fact our hotel room overlooked the big LAX letters! Unfortunately, we waited 1.5 hours for the shuttle. This hotel now runs independently from the rest of the blue shuttles - which LAX did not know. Once we learned they ran their own shuttle we had to call the hotel two times to get the pick up....not a good start. But the rooms were clean, and soundproofed. I The pool is located outside the hotel doors, around the corner and down the side of the hotel. It's kind of spooky how you arrive to this pool (no jacuzzi), but once you arrive. OM Goodness! Kids paradise! I stayed with three kids and no joke, this pool is 3x the size of most hotel pools and is heated like a jacuzzi! My kids were hoping for another standby situation so they could stay here again just for the pool. The grille/bar is good for apps and drinks...not too pricey. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant is too pricey for what you get. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a quick stay over that is close to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel2u
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and found the location to be great, especially since we were departing from LAX, can't get any closer : ) The Staff was wonderful! EVERY employee greeted you with a smile and a 'hello' . The rooms were nice and clean. Loved being close to the beach ! Easy freeway access was nice to get to our fav. locations

Reviews.Title: “Very well kept - less than 5 mins from Airport”
Reviews.Author: W A
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay to catch an early morning flight or if u come in late from a flight. The beds were incredible (they actually had sleep number beds). Breakfast was very decent, and so were the amentites. The airpirt shuttle picked us up after waiting for approx 15-20mins (again very reasonable, considering it's free), and hotel staff are very helpful and deliver fast service.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of 2 visits”
Reviews.Author: CuthbertK
Reviews.Content: We recently made 2 layover trips to this hotel, which we booked for price reasons & had stayed here happily before. The price is a good £30-40 cheaper than many other LAX hotels and nothing was drastically awful, but they were certainly 2 different experiences Trip 1 - great. Lovely big room, no noise, free wifi, sleep temper beds ( don't quite know how it works but you can change it from hard to soft mattress), nice toiletries, good shower, room service breakfast looked so tempting we nearly ordered it; free shuttle great; check in and out great friendly and efficient. Trip 2 - not so great. Had paid for deluxe room, didn't get it, so had to go back and be re-allocated ( which was done efficiently by the front desk). We had had to wait a really long time for the shuttle - though a tip, the Courtyard at Marriott is just opposite this hotel, so you could always grab their shuttle too. Room stifling hot, and we just couldn't get the air-con to work to make it colder. We had looked forward to booking a breakfast, but there was no details of any of the room service food in the room at all. In fact the only details of any services were in a very shabby brochure that was falling to pieces in the room. And I couldn't find out any information, apart from my bill, on the guest services part of the TV menu. Of course I'm sure I could have called the front desk to ask for one, but, us being tired and it being late, I just couldn't face it. Room size, wifi, and bed was good as before, but a series of little niggles really made this stay a disappointment when we were looking forward to enjoying the hotel a bit more as we had a longer time to spend there. Maybe we should have taken a tip from the pilots and crew who we shared the shuttle with - they were all staying at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: FunFrugalTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights this week and I had rented a car. As we prepared to depart, I tried to rub off a mark that looked like a scratch on my rental car. Luckily it wasn't an actual scratch, but it took some effort to rub the mark off the car. Nelson and Aida grabbbed towels and actually spent 5-10 minutes trying to help me so I wouldn't get charged a fee by the rental car company. They were so sweet to help me--a departing guest. All the folks at the front desk were wonderful in helping with a quick and smooth check-in and check-out, and other questions/requests I had during my stay, the food in their restaurant was great, and housekeeping did a fantastic job for us. We will definitely return given its proximity to the airport, spacious & comfortable accommodations, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: coharahawk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night after arriving late to LAX. We had no problem finding a parking spot on the street behind the hotel (free), as I was feeling to cheap to pay for valet. Check-in was a breeze. I requested a room facing south, which was accommodated. The room had plenty of space and was clean, and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The coffee shop downstairs left a little to be desired with very minimal options for "grab and go" breakfast. I got a great deal on Priceline and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: Needing another one night stay near LAX, we gave the Radisson a try, having previously stayed at the nearby Sheraton and Four Points and both much more expensive on this occasion. Like the Sheraton next door it's not very modern but it has everything you need for a stopover. The bathroom was quite small but everything was clean and worked. The staff were friendly and helpful and one nice feature is that you can check the progress of the shuttles on a screen which tracks them using GPS. You also get free WiFi throughout, something the Sheraton doesn't offer. I would normally rate this place as 3 stars but we got a very cheap rate for one night so I've raised it to 4 stars. Out of the three LAX hotels we've tried, the Sheraton is probably slightly nicer than the other two, but there's very little in it. The cost would probably decide it the next time we transit through LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vejohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way home from Australia. We had a 14 hour layover and decided to check into a hotel, rest, shower and have a bite to eat. Check in was easy and quick. The room and the washroom were both spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. We checked in before the usual check in time and this was great because we were very tired after the long flight. Had supper in the hotel restaurant. My husband and I shared an appetizer, main course and a dessert. Everything from the wait staff to the meal itself was excellent. Would definitely recommend staying and eating here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: kk430
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 min drive to the airport with free shuttles running every 20 min so it's very convenient. We were able to book 2 rooms at the last minute and they were average. It's in a tight area with other buildings so the room views weren't anything to write home about. No complimentary coffee in lobby which is something that should be offered in all hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “My room was a sauna!”
Reviews.Author: Givemesnow212
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must say the hotel was really clean. The staff was very friendly. I ordered room service and it was super quick and delicious (pepperoni pizza). However, our room was like a sauna to me! I'm from Chicago and I'm used to iceberg settings on my thermostat. It was set at 73' and I could not get it any lower than that. I tried googling the darn machine to try to figure it out and still nothing. I called the desk to see if I was missing something obvious, but they offered to send up a mechanic. By this time it was 0230 and my Mom was fast asleep and I didn't want to wake her. She's been super sick and is on sleep medication so the temp didn't bother her. I appreciate the staff trying to help. I just wish I would have been able to make it cold enough in my room so I could fall asleep for even 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant bar”
Reviews.Author: Australian_Manhattan
Reviews.Content: Ask for Norma Garcia at the bar and order a Manhattan. Best I've had in years, and I've had plenty.

Reviews.Title: “convenient stop to Australia”
Reviews.Author: gladned
Reviews.Content: We bid on priceline and got this hotel near the airport as a stop on the way from NY state to Australia and then also on the way back. We found staff to be very helpful and especially enjoyed the two guys who attend bar. They made good inexpensive snack suugestions and had a good sense of humor. Room was clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated that they let us in at 9:00am, since they had a clean room available.

Reviews.Title: “March madness at lax!”
Reviews.Author: Arndts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel before flying out, and Antonio valeriano made our stay wonderful. Service at the concord lounge was outstanding and making sure we were comfortable while watching our Jayhawks game was superb... Thank you Antonio!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect end to a long trip”
Reviews.Author: Nancy F
Reviews.Content: After a long trip to northern and southern California I was so happy to get to the Radisson LAX late but to find a most comfortable room, great service, and all the information I needed about the airport shuttle - plus the fruit and cheese plate that was waiting for me in my room with a welcome card from the General Manager was wonderful. This location is the best place to stay for that early morning flight out of LAX. Cheers to the staff of the Radisson you almost made me not want to fly back home. N Fournier

Reviews.Title: “Honesty and Service”
Reviews.Author: Bigone77
Reviews.Content: On the way to Beijing, China, me, my wife, her sister and her niece had an overnight stop in Los Angeles. We had two rooms at the LAX Raddison Hotel. The free shuttle bus made it easy to get to and from the hotel. The shuttle runs continuously between the terminals and the hotel @ every 15 minutes. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy. Both rooms were clean and comfortable. However, one room did not have a coffeemaker and coffee. Two relatives met us and we all had dinner at the hotel restaurant. The food and the service was excellent. Our wait person was Juan and he deserves a special compliment for his service and honesty. A cousin inadvertently attempted to overpay the bill by a considerable amount. Juan caught the mistake and had her correct the error before he charged her credit card. He could have easily charged the card and put the money in his pocket as a tip but he did not. The next morning, two of us had the buffet breakfast and two of us ate light in the cafe. Both venues were satisfying. If you don't desire hotel food, we saw a subway restaurant on the same street @ 100 meters from the hotel. Overall, the hotel is very convenient for an overnight stay. For extended stays, you can find rooms that are less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: chrchgrlmis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night due to a long layover from HNL to ABQ. The room was just OK. What really disappointed me is that there were room service plates all over the place. The plates we saw when we arrived were still sitting in the same place when we left in the morning. There was certainly more than enough time to get those picked up overnight. It left an impression of a dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best -- very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: stevio99
Reviews.Content: And that's taking into account that it's nearly spitting distance to the air terminal at LAX. The decor, furnishings and finishes are terribly dated. The air ducts are dusty. The place smells old. The televisions are old, and the bathroom is small. It's also in a very inconvenient location in terms of driving in/out. I've never stayed in a Radisson, but was hoping that Sheriff Marge Gunderson was right in FARGO when she said it was a "good outfit." Not so much...at least as to this one. I haven't finished my stay here, and already I know that I will want to stay somewhere else on a future visit. The front desk staff was charming when I checked in, but other staff totall disinterested in doing much for you. I often stay here in the LAX area. I'd highly recommend the Sheraton and the Westin, and have heard good things about the Renaissance. The Radisson will no longer be on my list of hotels to use. Happy travels, all!

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access to LAX and Bus Interchange Stop”
Reviews.Author: fairushariri
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stay before heading to Reno from LA. i guess most of the customers here are on transit due to its great location nearby LAX airport. Apart from that, being a part time tourist, the location is 2 blocks away from the public bus interchange so it was handy to catch a bus for a hollywood blvd trip. Rooms are standard and decently decorated and the breakfast is plentiful. Wifi signal is commendable. Other than that, the free shuttle to and fro hotel/airport is a plus point. We are not in time to utilize most of its facilities as the turnaround time for the next flight is transitory.

Reviews.Title: “LAX airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: cooper1
Reviews.Content: The room was nicely appointed - there was a mini fridge in the room, which we really appreciated as we were there two days (we bought some milk, cheese and a salad - was nice to be able to store) Parking is an additional $22 a day - please remember to add that to your budget if you have a vehicle you are parking. We looked at the pool and it looked great even though we didn't actually get in it. The staff was very friendly and helpful when we needed anything. Great service. We pricelined the hotel as we didn't book one prior to going. We overlooked the landing strip and were not bothered by the sound of the jets landing - many panes of glass must help with that. It's not soundproof - but muted enough we weren't bothered. We were very happy with the Radisson Hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Easy Access to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Al S
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very helpful and professional during our overnight stay. In addition, the food at the Palmira Restaurant completely exceeded my expectations. Our waiter, Felipe, provided excellent service to us.

Reviews.Title: “Typical hotel close to terminal”
Reviews.Author: S35owl
Reviews.Content: On arrival has valet parking at 22 USD (seems only option), check in was fine, room was ok if not a little tired. Location is perfect for the terminal, i think it is the closest hotel. This is exactly kind of hotel you expect next to a major airport terminal, it cators for high turnaround of customers so dont expect the nice personal touches, it's not designed for that. I was happy enough with the place.Not much choice for local bars but i found one very close to the hotel, 5 mins in a taxi or 15 minutes walk (about 7 USD i think). I forgot the name but the hotel staff and guys on the door knew it and reccommended it

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: cgunny
Reviews.Content: I got the hotel for $72/night through Priceline for two days stay. I really wanted to stay in downtown but didn't want to spend more $100. This is pretty decent hotel for one or two nights. I was not looking for any special amenities in the hotel and was looking for a safe/quiet/less-expensive/convenient place to stay and I got all with this hotel. Only complaint is that the hotel room was too hot (74F) and it took a while to bring down comfortable temperature (70F). You need to have a car for mobility and you can part it for cheap behind the hotel for $11 (hotel $22).

Reviews.Title: “Peeling Wallpaper”
Reviews.Author: WorkingHorse
Reviews.Content: We found it hard to believe -- walking into our room and finding a 2 foot by 2 foot piece of wallpaper peeled off and hanging down. A scene from the movie "Barton Fink" flashed before our eyes. The rest of the general impressions of the hotel to that point -- tired and slightly dirty -- paled in light of this. To their credit, the front desk staff responded with an apology and gave us what was probably a slightly better room (with wallpaper intact). Still, it was a little dirty, the windows didn't open, and the amenities were substandard. Overall, not a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner fan rattled so I had to leave it off. Even though it was February the room was a little too warm. The TV reception was terrible, very snowy. The staff told me they are in the process of updating the TV's to flat screen. They gave me $7 off my parking as compensation, otherwise parking would have been $20. It was obvious the place hadn't been updated in years. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: TheChairmanMeow
Reviews.Content: Older hotel that could do with a bit of a renovation. But this is not a bad thing if you're just off a long flight and want a bath instead of a shower. My room had a real bath and it was delightful to find after a long flight from Australia. Comfortable bed, prompt room service, & very friendly helpful staff. Room was clean & could not hear any airport noise despite close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the early morning shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: GWHstratford
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week for a night before an early morning flight. The place couldn't be closer to the airport. It's the last building on Century Blvd before entering the airport. Mater of fact, the giant illuminated LAX sign and the ramps into the airport are in front of the hotel! Hotel was in extremely nice condition, room very, very comfortable and clean. As close as it was to LAX, not a sound could be heard! Their airport shuttle is shared with the Sheraton. At 5:20am, a lot of people couldn't get on since it was already full from it's previous stop!!! Thankfully, another shuttle came in a couple of minutes. You can't make a shuttle reservation, so keep that in mind if you plan to cut it close!!!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expetations”
Reviews.Author: dan_davis0
Reviews.Content: Service was quick and efficient. Very clean, a must with me. The location is the best at the airport, within walking distance of gate one. No need to walk because the shuttle service is quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: bludaizie
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning flight combined w/jet lag so the no hassle 10 minute shuttle ride to the airport was key and went off w/out a hitch for us. This made the hotel obtain the average score and not a terrible score. I hate giving bad reviews but I can't see any way around it. The hotel staff although friendly did not follow through with request. We had to have our room service meal taken back twice and food brought up that we were charged for but did not receive. We never got what we actually ordered but decided to let it go. This happened to us on two different occasions, once for dinner and again for breakfast. It was pretty ridiculous. The food was good but getting what you ordered was the battle. We also ordered a crib for our baby and this took us calling down a few times before it was brought to our room and when we asked for an extra blanket to pad the extremely hard crib with they looked at us crazy and it never arrived. The bathroom was dirty and very rundown, the room as a whole needed some tlc. The location is extremely close to the airport and the view from our window was pretty cool but all and all I do not believe we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: wendys9
Reviews.Content: It gives me no pleasure to have to write such a negative review of any hotel but my husband is staying at this hotel for the second time in 10 days en route to Mexico- never again. He admits he should have cancelled after the first nightmare experience but took a chance that things may improve second time round. No chance. I have just cancelled his return booking in favor of the much cleaner, modern, upmarket HILTON LAX. Very tired and shabby hotel. Filthy swimming pool (didn't dare use it) Very long queues at reception for exhausted passengers Very very noisy Completely unacceptable I would recommend anybody considering this hotel to look at other airport hotels in preference or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: VegasHotel80
Reviews.Content: After getting the hotel via a priceline bid and then reading the reviews, I was a little worried on how my stay would be. Fortunately, the Radisson turned out to be pretty good. I walked to the hotel from terminal 1 and was there within 10 mins. I arrived about noon which was too early to check-in so I went for a walk to the in and out and watched some airplanes :). I came back within an hour and the room was ready. I asked for a non-smoking king with an airport view and was assigned a great room on the 11th floor with an awesome view of the runways and pool. The sleep number bed was very comfortable and the room had a nice flat screen tv (though not many channels and no HD), a good size fridge, work desk and a coffee maker. The bathroom was small but clean and functional. I was really surprised at the quality of the room given the reviews on here. They did a good job with the update and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Choice”
Reviews.Author: Bob P
Reviews.Content: Very good choice for an airport stay. Convenient. and comfortable. Courteous and friendly staff. Clean and well appointed. Large clean heated pool. (Could use a few lounge chairs.) Good restaurant. Felipe on the wait staff is particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: DeeThunder
Reviews.Content: Thankfully my husband and I only needed to stay here one night. The room was rundown. The bathroom deperately needed upgrading. I was worried I would find bugs in the room, it just looked dirty. The hotel was booked, we couldn't upgrade our room. The beds were not comfortable, I do not enjoy sleep number beds. We were unable to park at the hotel and had to use a lot a few blocks away. And there was a car sitting in front of the hotel that had recently been on fire. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted To Like This Place, I Really Did...”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: The benefits? Closest hotel to LAX - awesome! They have a Foursquare deal where if you check in and leave a comment, you get a 1,000 Club Carlson points - awesome! The downfalls? Small rooms, poorly appointed bathrooms, stuffy lobby and distracted front desk staff. Plus, parking is EXTREMELY limited...we had to park in a self-park lot 2.5 blocks away. At 1am, this isn't the most comforting experience. Oh, and all Radisson properties have Sleep Number beds. Our room had two full-size beds. One was an upgraded bed (let my wife sleep on that one), mine was an older one...was like a glorified air mattress. Not the best quality of sleep. Overall, this could be a great hotel...but during our stay, it was merely average.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Andrea D
Reviews.Content: EVERYONE from the valet parking, to the restaurant service, to the cleaning service were so unbelievably friendly, personable, knowledgeable, and accomadating! It was truly an enjoyable stay- I will recommend to everyone and will definitely choose to stay there again! THANK YOU! -Andrea PS- I also want to give a special shout out to Joyce Alvarado and Norma Garcia, servers in the restaurant/lounge area- extremely lovely ladies!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay with a layover”
Reviews.Author: flyfishmt
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Quiet, great beds, great restaurant and bar. Very close to the airport. Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Only for one night”
Reviews.Author: XenonNewton
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the afternoon after driving up the coast and planned to meet family for dinner before taking an early flight in the morning. Since it was only for the one night, we weren't too fussy. As long as the place was clean and had an airport shuttle, it would be fine. I certainly wouldn't want to stay any longer than that. The room looked large, because there was little furniture in it. The bed was a double, but it had only one night stand. The only other seating was a straight chair in a corner where there should have been an arm chair. If you wanted to sit at the desk, you'd have to carry the chair across the room. But, surprisingly, the bathroom had small bottles of shampoo and body lotion and the towels were large and absorbent.

Reviews.Title: “Poor services”
Reviews.Author: Seyed V
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel by bidding in priceline. I was there with my wife but first they assigned a room with two full size bedroom. I came back and asked for another room. The reception said that you found the hotel in priceline and as a term and condition part we assign you based on the available. I answered that but you have some queen size-bed room available and finally she accepted to change the room. It is medium clean, they charge you 22$ for parking and not any free parking space around. The free internet is terrible!! 512 K. you need to wait 20 min to see a video of 4 min in you tube. So crowded in lobby and if you need to talk with reception you need to wait for 5 min. our coffee maker was not functioning properly. I called to get someone to change it. I emphasized that it should be replaced for tomorrow, but that wasn't working tomorrow!!!! Nobody did take care about it!! The windows are packed enough to feel relax from the airplane noise. don't worry about this. the bed stuffs are clean but not very clean, shinny and excellent!! it's good when your flight has a delay. other than that you'd better of finding another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Front Desk, Rooms in various states of disrepair.”
Reviews.Author: microsciences
Reviews.Content: After a day of delayed flights, you want the room you booked ready and in good repair. If you order and pay for a King size bed you don't expect to be told by the front desk that only 2 doubles are available, especially when another guest comes to the desk and complains that she requested 2 doubles and got a King. When you finally get the room you want 9 it may take a few tries), it's their eco friendly room with non functional A/C, continually leaking toilet tank and broken desk chair. Radisson's idea of an the eco room of the future? Fortunately the maintenance staff is good and fixed everything even though it was 1 am. Riding the hotel shuttle I was wondering why the flight crews bypassed this place. I always trust their judgement.

Reviews.Title: “Good serice and perfect location for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: sivilingeniloren
Reviews.Content: I used the valet parking. I forgot my cell in the car and on of the staff sprinted down to my car to get it. When I was leaving, it only took about 5 minute to retrieve the car. Excellent service. My room was clean and big, as I would expect from a Radisson hotel. Even though I had a nice view of the runway, the noise was not too bad, and the air-traffic is stopped in night time. Excellent restaurant for both dinner and breakfast. I had salmon for dinner and it was good (a compliment from a Norwegian!). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for arrival/departure from LAX”
Reviews.Author: The_Griswalds_MK
Reviews.Content: A well equipped Radisson with everything you need for either a few hours or a few days. We stayed here at the end of a trip to California. Reception can get very busy with a lot of Airport custom - including flight staff etc. The communal areas are great with a decent bar and coffee counter. Facilties are excellent - a great pool/gym and the free wireless is appreciated. Our room had a great view of the runway so if you like to plane spot, you'll love this (just ask reception for the right room) The beds are strange and need some fine tuning to get the firmness just right. The rooms are very well soundproofed and no problem with flight noise overnight. Staff is efficient and used to dealing with fast turn around. Check in/out is swift, as is the room service. The valet parking is expensive with no practical alternative - this will put me off staying there again for a few nights as after a tip, it adds to the cost of the stay considerably. If you're there for a few days or have an evening to spare then make your way to Manhattan Beach - no more than 15mins by cab. MB is stunning!...great beaches and a superb choice of bars and restaurants. For the coolest vibe and great sun-downers, head to the Side Door in MB - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I do not care HOW close this place is to the airport...”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: My room was a dump. In my opinion, this hotel has GIVEN UP. First thing I saw when I opened the door: A HOLE IN THE CARPET! A dirty, nasty looking hole in the carpet, right by the door. How could they not fix this before selling the room! There is NO WAY that the hotel did not notice this hole, it was THAT bad. This room, with a nasty hole in the carpet and paint and or wall paper peeling right off the walls should NOT be sold as anything other than a 1 star. The faucet in the bathroom was crooked and off center. Strange. There was no working clock in the room. The TV was straight out of the 80's. Weird smell in the room. The closet doors would NOT open. The walls are THIN. Do yourself a favor and do NOT worry about the airplane noises. Worry more about the noise from the hallway and the rooms next door! (There is a good inch between the floor and the actual bottom of the door.) When I called for a wake up call, the person at the front desk did not even know my room number. Normally, when I call the desk, the know right away who is calling. That made me nervous, so I set my iPhone to wake me. The ceiling had patched areas. Not sure what happened, but for some reason, they had to patch the ceiling. Bathroom: SMALL. When you open the bathroom door, you practically hit the toilet with the door. THAT is small. Scuff marks all over the walls as well. This room was just not good. I am a nice guy. Super cordial to the front desk. No attitude and VERY polite. Why did the front desk guy do this to me? What did I do to deserve this room? Are all the rooms this bad or was I just being punished? Did I remind the front desk guy of someone who stole his girlfriend in High School? He seemed nice enough, or are all the rooms this bad? If all the rooms are this bad, I am shocked they are still in business. If all the rooms are NOT this bad, then I was ripped off. The lobby actually looked nice so I was very surprised to be put into a 1 star room. Oh, but they have free WIFI! This is the first time I have added pictures. These pictures were taken very late at night. Sorry about the quality. Trust me when I say the photos make it look better than it actually was....

Reviews.Title: “12-day stay”
Reviews.Author: OurBabymoonRoadTrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 12 days and were pleased overall. It was inexpensive and very conveniently located, and the majority of the staff were incredibly accommodating. On the downside: The only way to park your car is via the valet, and that's $20 per day. The housekeeping staff was a little spotty. For example, they use SleepNumber beds, and at one point the lady who made up our room changed the bed settings! (I know, it sounds ridiculous until it happens and then you wake up several times in the middle of the night and can't figure out why you're uncomfortable.) Also, we booked 2 separate but consecutive stays, and at 9:30 pm on the night before our first stay ended, housekeeping came to the door, ignored the do not disturb sign, and then attempted to enter the room after we didn't respond to the knock. Sadly, the supervisor couldn't provide a reasonable explanation as to why anyone would do this.... At least we had the latch on! Overall, though, would reccommend, but only if you're using a discounter to purchase your room nights. (I wouldn't pay the rack rate for this.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value; Good service”
Reviews.Author: cal77
Reviews.Content: Good value for LAX. Avoid the below average overpriced restaurant. Order a pizza from room service instead.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TScates
Reviews.Content: I was flying out early from LAX so I decided to book a room at the airport. The price was very good, which made me a little skeptical. However, I enjoyed my brief stay and will do it again. Pros: - shuttle from the rental cars and to the airport - if you don't want to shuttle to the airport it's about a 15 minute walk to the Delta terminal (much closer to other terminals) - room was very large and bed was comfortable - lobby was nice and people friendly Cons: - air conditioner was a little noisy but not enough to keep me awake, also the vent was a little dingy

Reviews.Title: “Nothing so special...”
Reviews.Author: Chef t
Reviews.Content: Radisson in a great hotel to LAX for one night, but I found nothing special ... I gave un'imprerssione cold and unwelcoming. Restaurant, the waiter at the restaurant has been very kind even though I ordered the potato all'entrecote fries near me, and instead served the spicy potatoes embossed ... The room was pretty large, but they felt too much noise and clamor of the corridor, the phone in the room had the keys that are blocked. I think that the structure can also improve a lot because it has a fabulous location. I hope the next time I go back I find some positive changes ... good luck to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, quiet rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Deal_H0und
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the Radisson LAX. Before my stay, I sent room preferences by email. Ms Lundquist was kind enough to promptly take care of them for me & everything at check-in was as she stated (not a given for other places I've stayed). Having Gold status, we were placed on the 12th floor and a nice cheese & cracker plate was waiting for us in the room upon arrival. The room itself was spacious and had good views north and more importantly, despite its close proximity to the airport, the double-paned glass absorbed nearly all of the noise from landing airplanes. It was so quiet that we did not need to run the room fan overnight to drown out any noises. The continental breakfast was good and the servers were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is one of the closest to the LAX terminals so you could walk to the airport from it but there were also shuttles available. One nice thing about the LAX area is that there's free street parking on W 98th St and surrounding areas (I'm not aware of many other airports which have free parking so close to the airport itself). However, be sure to read signs to know what the restrictions are for a particular part of the street (some are 2 hr, some are enforced 8am-6pm while others 8am-midnight, some areas do not allow overnight parking, etc). Wifi was free & there was bottled water in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property despite location”
Reviews.Author: fozziedoggie
Reviews.Content: Flight to Madrid, Spain cancelled, so the airline put us here for one night stay. On-site restaurant was tasty and priced modestly, although we received $25 voucher each from airline for dinner ($15 for breakfast). Rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet, despite being one block from the airport. Staff was professional and courteous. However, due to the time of night and the cancellation, the one person working the check-in counter had to deal with over 150 stranded airline passengers. I was the first one to check in, so I don't know how angry/rude the later passengers got? Certainly not the hotel's fault. Overall, a nice stay for one night, BUT BEING A NATIVE LOS ANGELENO, DO NOT WALK AROUND THIS AREA AT NIGHT. Stay in the hotel and enjoy the bar, or watch T.V. in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Aisle_Walker
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nearest hotel to the LAX airport and it seems you can't get any closer than that. However, you still need to get a shuttle bus. Most shuttle busses for LAX airport hotels have the same light blue colour and operated by the same company. The nearest shopping area is a walking distance away from the hotel. Good place to stock up on necessities (i.e. US mobile phone) before venturing further into the US. ;-) The sound proofing against airport noise was good. The property itself has definitely seen better days. The room was clean, but I'd expect a newer (or at least recently renovated) hotel from a brand like Radisson. The hotel provides good wireless Internet access in the lobby (free) and free basic access in rooms. I have tried buffet breakfast and it was OK. All hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for layover”
Reviews.Author: RoseHong-88
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for the night due to a missed connection and needed a good night sleep. The rooms were to so quiet and I couldn't hear a thing, so needless to say I accomplish my goal. The beds were pretty cool, because you can adjust the comfort level to you desire. Sheets were high end and didnt' have dirty duvet. So a great stay if you are looking for a reasonable layover. Staff was great. The buffet breakfast is typical, nothing special, but that is an extra costs. Overall, I wasn't looking for extravagant, just clean and well maintained hotel and I got that from Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russell S
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Hotel at Los Angeles Airport was very convenient as it was immediately next to the airport. The room was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was exceptionally good. The swimming pool was larger than I had expected and heated. The hotel was my first night of a 2 week holiday and business trip and was a great way to begin my time in California. Surprisingly, my room was very quiet considering a major airport was next door.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand all the great reviews - it's a dump”
Reviews.Author: kawoh
Reviews.Content: Arrived 1030pm, waited till 1230am to checkin. Hotel was ill equipped to handle the overflow from a cancelled flight. I had a reservation as did around 50 other people in the queue. There was another queue of about 100-150 people. If you want to spend your time waiting to checkin late at night, great, if you don't AVOID THIS HOTEL! The hotel is OLD and falling to bits - the wallpaper was falling off in the bathroom, individual tiny sheets stuck on a wall very 1970s. The carpet stank, the bed sank, the internet (which was free) was VERY slow, or pay to get a faster connection. Staff unapologetic and indifferent. No apologies, nothing, this hotel is a complete joke. I stayed the night earlier at the Courtyard Marriott LAX which was amazing, these two places are worlds apart. Don't waste your money and choose a different LAX property.... i mean this place was like a Super 8 motel NOT a Radisson. Radisson should be ashamed to put their name on this property. I stay well over 100 nights a year and this is probably the worst airport hotel i've styaed in. Location and regularity of the bus service is great, the problem is you ALWAYS have to wait at least 60 minutes to checkin... AVOID!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicer hotels near the airport. But you cannot escape the plane noise.”
Reviews.Author: blondewithdogs
Reviews.Content: This is out first stay at the Radisson at LAX, and it was a very nice hotel. Large clean lobby, spacious rooms with comfortable beds... But terribly flat pillows. The bathroom, although clean was very small, and only one person could fit in comfortably. TV was a flat panel with great clarity- but lacked a good number of channels. The room also had a large refrigerator. The free shuttle from the airport was a great added bonus. However, being so close to the airport and within the flight path, we heard every plane landing up to 11pm and starting at 5 am. That was the only bad part about staying here. We have stayed at other hotels nearby, and do not remember the noise.

Reviews.Title: “This is just PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Schwartzkopf_Reiser
Reviews.Content: If you've heard about a noisy hotel because it's located VERY near the airport, I have one word: NONENSE! The hotel is VERY clean, spacious and comfortable rooms and incredibly quiet at night (there are double windows to prevent noises)! Only if you're looking for some touristic-near-hot-spots hotel, this is not the place, because LA isn't well served of public transportation. Even though, there's a complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport , many ways to get the city center or wherever you want. If you have ways to move around by yourself, or you don't care paying $45 for a cab ride, then you definitely might choose this hotel! Plus:free high-speed Internet access. Thinking about grades: Cleanliness of rooms:10.0 Welcoming:8.0 Quietness of rooms10.0 Spaciousness of rooms:8.0 Public areas: 8.0 Staff competence:10.0 Quality of service provided:10.0 Hotel surroundings:8.0 rating the relationship between price and quality:10.0

Reviews.Title: “Very average.”
Reviews.Author: germatt2
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at LAX, but overall a below average hotel. The room is in significant need of refurbishing and there is a definite unpleasant "hotel odor" in the room. Very quiet, though and I didn't hear any airport noise whatsoever, despite looking directly at two of the runways. The WiFI has two options -- a painfully slow free option, and a slightly faster paid option. Parking is valet on-property or off-property independently-owned garage: the price difference doesn't make the walk to the garage worth the minimal savings.

Reviews.Title: “The only terrible rating I have given”
Reviews.Author: karl024
Reviews.Content: My main complaint as regards this hotel was the pool facilities and the hotel guarantee that does not appear to be worth the paper it is written on. The hotel advertises a heated outdoor pool. (Ideal to laze around to get over a bit of jet lag we thought). At the time of our stay in late November there was no heating to the pool and it was too cold to use. Further to this there were no sun beds. We spoke to reception and explained that we had wanted to use the pool facilities and asked if there were any sun beds that had been put away. We further took issue with the fact that the heated pool was not working and pointed out the hotel guarantee that if you present a problem that they cant fix then you don’t pay for your stay. The only answer we got to that was a shrug of the receptionist’s shoulders. We took up the issue with the holiday company we had booked with in the UK and pointed out the hotel guarantee. The answer we got is you should have complained at the time. Obviously this guarantee counts for nothing. I find it incredible that a hotel of this size lacks such basic facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Over Promise and Under Deliver”
Reviews.Author: DiverRN
Reviews.Content: First, we had to request that the heater be changed to a/c and the room smelled like old cigarette smoke. We used Febreeze and had them change the a/c filter, but after 2 nights requested another room. The next room was missing the smoke detector and with the speed with which it was replaced, I suspect there is another room that is now missing one. Back to the first room and the sleep number beds. I have one at home and LOVE it! The one the first room would not deflate and I slept on a hard mattress when I would rather have had a soft one. In the second room, the beds worked after a bunch of manipulating and then figuring out that the remotes were mixed up. (By the way, it felt like the controls hadn't been wiped down since they were installed.) In the second room, maintenance again had to come and switch the heat to a/c, but after an hour, the room was still hot. Finally, in the third room, we had working a/c that did not stink and beds that worked, BUT since I was out at night and sleeping during the day, and I used the Do Not Disturb sign, my room did not get serviced. Even after two consecutive requests to have the room done by 9am (so I could sleep all day undistrubed), I still never got fresh sheets, towels or soap. I also discovered that up on the 8th floor where I ended up, the wireless internet was so slow that I quit trying to use my computer. BUT it sure was quiet inside, even though we were so close to the airport. And there is a trolly that for $5 will take you to the mall or Manhattan Beach.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Be aware - and check you credit card”
Reviews.Author: jkamerer
Reviews.Content: We booked this "3.5 star" hotel through Hotwire - and we got a 2-star (and that is being kind) room at the Radisson. Please note that it was 1 o'clock in the morning, with a 4-month old who needed formula, and we only had 4 hours to sleep so it was not worth the effort in talking with the front desk and "trying" to resolve the situation. Immediately after booking through Hotwire I attempted to call the hotel and confirm if they have a shuttle. After 25 frustrating minutes of dealing in telephone limbo world I was finally able to ask the concierge if they had a shuttle. He assured me that it ran every 10-15 minutes and that we need to wait under the hotel shuttle sign. We watched the Marriot shuttle, the Travelodge shuttle, the etc. etc. shuttle drive pass twice before the Sheraton/Radisson shuttle finally picked us up after 25 minutes. The hotel looked nice and I am sure worth the 3.5 stars, but at 1am how much would you pay attention when all you want is a nice clean room to lay your head. The room overlooked the beautiful BRIGHT lights of the LAX entry signs. The carpet was damp and mildew around the in-room refrigerator. The sleep number bed displayed an error message when trying to adjust - therefore it was like sleeping on a deflated air bed. The window valiance was dirty and looked as if it came right out of an 80's movie. One of the photos above the bed was missing. The worst part, we paid through Hotwire and I just checked my credit card and the Radisson "mistakenly" (by thier own ommsion) charged by credit card. Overall I was very disappointed in our Hotwire / Radisson experience at LAX and would not recommend that anyone go through what we had.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - Norma is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: NadiaGavan
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute, unexpected stay that we booked through a discount website. We were looking for something close to the airport and not outrageously priced. We were overlooking the runway, but we couldn't hear the planes - something that was a very pleasant surprise. The rooms were clean and came with a fridge (something hard to come by, it seems). There was nothing fancy, but we weren't looking for fancy. We ate there - the chicken pot pie at the bar was to die for! I could have eaten that for every meal every day. Norma at the bar was also amazing. She was always smiling, always happy, even remembered our names whenever we went there, even made me up a cocktail that I had the recipe for. She made our stay there go from "good" to "awesome". I was sad to not have the chance to say goodbye to her. We asked the valet to call us a cab to take us to a restaurant, we ended up with a lovely chauffeur who drove us there, waited for us and drove us back to the hotel. The next time we asked the valet to call us a cab to take us to a mall, we ended up being put in the hotel's limousine. We were made to feel like royalty the whole time we were there by all of the staff. If we passed some of the cleaners in the hall, they all had big smiles and would call out a greeting. It was amazing! You better believe we will stay there again. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of airport, but they have a shuttle”
Reviews.Author: hctravelers
Reviews.Content: Shuttle comes around about every half hr. or so. Make sure you get on the one for the Radisson as there are several hotel shuttles and they all look the same except for the name on the front on a sign. The lobby is nice, and there is a bar and a restaurant on site. Ate once at the bar, and had a very good chicken pot pie, and soda. Service was unbelievably slow though. Tried to eat there again, but after 15 minutes of waiting for someone to take our order, we decided to eat elsewhere down the road. The rooms were nice and having a corner room gave us extra room. There was a nice big comfortable lounge chair, and a small refrigerator as well as a desk.The bathroom was small but with a nice shower and large sink area. Great water pressure. My complaints were we couldn't get the sleep number beds to adjust to our "sleep numbers" and after 3 calls to the front desk someone from maintenance finally come up to assist us. We both had a great nights sleep that night. But the next day, the maid changed the number back to the higher setting and after trying several times again to change the sleep number to a lower setting, we finally gave up and tried sleeping. My friend slept like a baby, but my bed was too firm and the planes landing and taking off kept me awake. I slept maybe 3 hrs. Probably wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Lyn49006
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a great value and was extremely pleasant. We were coming back from New Zealand and wanted a place to crash and recover from the jet lag. We found this hotel at a good price. There was not a room available when we arrived at noon, but we were able to store our luggage, get a bite of lunch and then proceed to our room. The concierge was very helpful with recommendations for dinner and made our reservations. It was perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Stay Here Was Even Better Than The First”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: About two and a half years ago, I stayed at this property before making a connecting flight to Australia. This time, I had an overnight layover between my flight from home and my flight to Auckland via Tahiti. I booked my stay through Hotwire, same as last time, and was happy with the low rate. The hotel is great if you are using terminal one (Southwest, USAirways) as it is just across Sepulveda Blvd. from the terminal. Shuttles run every twenty minutes or so and can be crowded, but are a great convienence. The lobby is clean and nice, with sitting areas,a bar, restaurant, and gift shop. There are a number of conventions held here. The sleeping areas were quiet, and the room I received clean and comfortable. The double glazed windows are a bit dirty, but I was OK since I was more interested in the blackout curtains. I had lunch in the bar area. The prices a bit high for what you get, but the food tasted great, and the service was excellent. I reminded myself how much I saved through using Hotwire and enjoyed my lunch. I walked down Century Blvd. in the night. It was alright, but a bit dark. There is a Subway restaurant a block or so to the east, a Denny's and a Carl's Jr. about a mile east, past the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Other nearby options would likely be better”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust48
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Radisson between flights. The shuttle was very convenient; the hotel room was not great. The carpet had a big orange stain in the middle of the room, the air conditioning didn't work and the windows didn't open so the room was too warm, and the furniture was all beat up and falling apart. The beds themselves were not bad as far as comfort. The exact same shuttle bus swings by other hotels that are no more than 1-2 blocks farther from the airport, so check those out before picking this one if your requirement is a hotel close to the aiport.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: deutschediva65
Reviews.Content: Due to delayed flights we did not arrive at this hotel until 2 a.m. The night manager was very nice and helped us with our bags up to the room because there were no bellman on duty at that time of the night. The room was clean with the exception of some scary looking markings on the wall. I couldn't tell what it was, but I was too tired to bother with it. Only spent one night there and we at breakfast at the restaurant in the morning which was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson LAX December 2011!”
Reviews.Author: Keebz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night in December 2011. There are too many hotels to choose from in the LAX area, however, as an 'airport' hotel we found it fine, and would stay again. The hotel corridors looked a bit 'tired', but other than that we were very pleased with our stay, clean rooms, clean bathrooms and most importantly a BIG clean bed, much needed after a 13hr flight from Brisbane, followed immediately by a Disneyland day, all whilst jet lagged! We used www.hotwire.com for even greater value!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Oussama B
Reviews.Content: ideal location because even if you get lost anywhere it won't be difficult finding your way to Lax the bathrooms need some fixings but it is a good value for the money to chose this hotel if visiting Los Angeles and if you dont mind having a view on the airport

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I've EVER slept in”
Reviews.Author: UKX
Reviews.Content: After an 11 hr flight from the UK and with only 3hrs sleep the night before, i couldn't believe my luck when i found out we had a free shuttle bus to our hotel AND the bed was amazingly comfortable. Quite a cool view from our hotel window as we saw the aeroplanes landing, and they were our height (couldnt hear them as all soundproofed). Good room service, food served 24hrs. Only thing is the breakfast was a buffet which was $17 EACH (obviously tax not included haha)!!!! But we decided to get breakfast from Starbucks in the airport and it turned out to be the same price, so its just airport prices. A comforting hotel for our first night ever in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfy beds, incredible food!”
Reviews.Author: DoveyNicole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson at the airport LAX. We were pleasantly surprised at the value. The rooms we're very clean, updated and sleep number beds.... So comfy! now the best part is the restaurant. I would come here just for the amazing food! I heard a man at the next table tell the waiter that he drove all day just to eat there because he knew the salmon was going to be good. I raised my eyebrows, but after a spectacular meal, I know what he means... we had the king salmon, asparagus, salad and the appleblossom with cinnamon gelato. We will be back! I also have to mention the fantastic service by Martin Ruiz. He attended every need. two thumbs way up!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel with free shuttle to/from the airport”
Reviews.Author: ExciteMe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night here, waiting for an onward flight. The room was clean, but somewhat old and it was separated from the next room only with a locked wooden door, which was a bit creepy and you could also hear everything that was being said in the next room. Minibar in the room, but nothing in it. Apart from that, the beds were nice and the staff were friendly, so it's not a bad choice for a stopover. I would NOT recommend the hotel restaurant for dinner, it was expensive and the food was horrible! But the breakfast buffet was surprisingly good, we couldn't believe it was the same restaurant as the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Transit”
Reviews.Author: Jeffreybarker2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on the way to Asia from S. America. It was super comfortable, super convenient, great value, and breakfast was great before the flight. Definitely recommend this to anyone needing to stay close to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nelliep186299
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel close to LAX, then you can do no better than stay at the Raddison. Service is impecable, and whilst you would not expect an airport hotel to have fine dining this is not the case. The food in the Palmyra restaurant is excellent, and value for money. To get the service to match, ask for a table serviced by Felipe, and you will not be disappointed. I can assure you I will use again when next in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated facility”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly and courteous, the bed was comfortable, and the location is ideal, but those are the only good points to this hotel. This facility is very old and it shows. The carpet in our room was buckled and had humps. The mini-bar had nothing in it. The pictures had been removed from the walls, leaving only the picture hangers. The TV was an old CRT set from about 15 years ago. In summary, this hotel is not up to modern standards, and is only worth considering if you need a basic place to sleep and can get a good price on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “great service at the palmyra bar and grill”
Reviews.Author: marc t
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Radisson LAX Hotel on many occasions over the past 3 years and have always found our stay there a pleasure. Especially the service we always receive from Abel in the Palmyra bar and grill, we have always found him most helpful and friendly. I can honestly say value for money this Hotel is a good stop over between flights. Truida & Marc Trevere

Reviews.Title: “Very happy - don't understand the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: momoftripp
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at this hotel after we Pre-paid with an amazing rate without knowing the hotel name. I was happy to have learned it was the Radisson but soon after reading the reviews, I regret the decision of booking my husband and I at this hotel. The only thing I learned after reading the complaints was the cost of the valet. I would have been extremely upset if we weren't prepared financially that this was basically the only option (the other having parking about a mile away). But since we prepared ourselves, the valet actually was one of our favorite parts of the trip. The room was very nice and clean. Our room didn't come with a sleep number bed but we found the bed very comfortable. The entire staff was very professional. I have no complaints about any of them. The only minor problem in the room was the water in the bathroom sink didn't warm up fast enough. It took about 3 minutes before the hot water cane through. That's a lot of water wasted. But like I said, that's a minor problem and easy to fix. Oh, the room we were in did have a refrigerator but not a microwave. That would have been great to have had a microwave. Again, I'm not sure why so many bad reviews. My only conclusion is that only the guests who didn't have good experiences are writing the reviews. So I encourage other guest to write about their positive stay.

Reviews.Title: “It needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: chioi1922_2
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here in mid-Dec as we were on our return leg back in Asia. Although the room comes with those numbered-bed that sleeper can adjust the firmness of the bed. We don't find it useful. The room has open closet and bath room door can't close properly. I guess the hotel is under some kind of renovation; perhaps floor by floor as we bumped into some technicians carrying ladder and tools using the guest elevator. The hotel really needs an upgrade. The buffet breakfast which we paid for was not impressive at all. Very limited choice of selection of food but service was acceptable. As there was no fast food joints nearby (need to walk more than 15 minutes to reach some) so we opted for the hotel breakfast as we have 2 young children. I can't compare it with other hotels available at LAX as we have not stayed there before. The only reason we chose Radisson LAX is that I can make use of the membership points to redeem to stay near LAX so that we don't have to travel from LA town to take the flight back home.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: SmplyYes
Reviews.Content: The room are outdated, the toilet runs all night, when the person in the next room showers it sounds like they are in your bed. 1. Prices for room services are outrageous 2. I ordered my order was wrong 2 nights straight. The waiter took my credit card and was gone for 30 mins. I had to call about bringing it back. This process to 2 hours order at 9p finally went to bed 11p. 3. The person taking the order kept calling me by the wrong name. 4. Upon check in empty room service tray sat outside the door until the next morning after i complain 3 times. 5. I came in one day the bed was made but no pillow cases on pillows. 6. Remote stop working 7. Went to bar wanted pineapple juice..quoted a $3.26 price The RAGEDY RADISSON is what my co-workers and I named it. This place is substandard! Do not waist your good hard earn money.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: dosumd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night. At checkin we were offered an upgrade to a suite, but it faced the city and we wanted an airport view...so we kindly said no. Our room seemed clean, but the windows looking at the runway were dirty...smudged from many people leaning on it as they looked out at planes taking off and landing. That being said, we found the rest of the room quiet and clean with a comfortable bed. The bell hop named Dewayne came quickly to get our suitcases the next morning, waited on a cold rainy morning to get all our luggage on the airport bus and was VERY friendly. I do wish the hotel had sent me a follow up survey so we could mention him. There was a big breakfast included in our room rate that was very good.Best of all was the view...you feel like you are on the runway...but there is no plane noise.

Reviews.Title: “A very quiet airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Allgoodonesgone
Reviews.Content: I was able to bag a $76 rate on Priceline for this hotel. We got in to LAX at 11 PM and needed to start bright and early towards Arizona. This is a fairly old hotel with stains on the floor and outdated rooms, but it was surprisingly quiet. In the morning when we looked outside our window, we could see planes getting ready to takeoff. WE HEARD NOTHING ALL NIGHT! It was great. Cudos, also for the great shower. The only negative part of our stay was the $22 valet parking fee. There is not a place on the entire property to park your car yourself. It is all valet. However, even at $98 it was still a pretty good deal in my opinion and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: wombat18
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels get a lot of traffic and tend to show their wear. This Radisson is perfectly comfortable, but clearly needs refurbishing. The rooms are big, the TV is big, and the king size bed is big. But, the curtains have stains, the carpets have holes and the wallpaper is marked. Strangely, the desk chair is too low for the office desk so it is hard to get work done. Although expensive ($18 before tax, coffee included), the breakfast buffet was good - fresh pastries, fluffy eggs,good quality coffee and even miso soup (although I don't think that really qualifies to suggest japanese items are available). I was surprised how difficult it was to request late checkout. I have an evening flight and the airline check-in doesn't open until 3.30pm. I had to haggle to get a late checkout - first the clerk offered 1pm, I suggested 3, we agreed on 2pm. Sigh. Dunno what I'm going to do from then until 3 - do they really want me hanging out in the lobby area with all my stuff?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, not-so-great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jess_RGS
Reviews.Content: To be fair, my husband and I were only at this hotel for less than 8 hours. We arrived late at night, got a few hours of sleep, and checked out at 5 a.m. to catch our flight. To its benefit, it is literally across the street from the airport, which was perfectly convenient. But, that's where the positives ended for us. The floor we were on smelled of cigarette smoke, which I was surprised by since it is supposed to be a non-smoking hotel. Our room didn't smell of smoke but smelled musty and moldy, like there had been a leak that hadn't been taken care of. The coffee provided in the rooms was terrible. It tasted like grounds had been moldy or rotten or something. Both my husband and I agreed that it was the worst coffee we had ever tasted. Not a deal-breaker, but pretty disappointing when you have to get up at 4 in the morning. The shuttle taking people to the airport was supposed to run every 10-15 minutes starting at 5 a.m.. That's what the front desk and the signs across the pickup area said multiple times. We got downstairs at 5:12 and didn't get a shuttle until 5:45.
