Check in / check out were quick and painless. I suppose it just depends on the day / time and the person you spoke with.

Reviews.Title: “A backward hotel with unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: maziDeniliquin
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here, arrived early around 9.30 am, told maid service only started at 9 am and I had asked for early check in, receptionists rude and uncooperative. Woman at tour desk lovely and helpful. No offer of assistance with luggage at any time, I carried in my own bags as the porters were all busy with a large no of departing guests. Breakfast poor and over priced. The worst part was the lack of modern internet. Computers were very old, very slow, and at $7.50 for a quarter of an hr, very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: Oztravels7
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a long flight from Sydney and on arrival went to checkin and was told "no rooms until 1.30 when housekeeping release them to us". I had arrived as the same time as another gentleman on the free shuttle from the aiport but was behind me in the queue to checkin and so watched what happnened to him. Low and behold they gave him a room in 30 minutes and after confronting staff about this, they had a room for me. Anything you aked the staff was too hard to answer throughout the stay. The worst hotel staff attitude I have ever experienced!!!! Avoid this hotel at all costs if you are looking for service at all! The rooms are ok and clean and it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card Bill carefully!!”
Reviews.Author: FairfaxVaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Look, this isn't a review about their ammenities. As far as bed, and facilities go, this is a decent hotel, but the jerks who run the billing and accounting for this hotel should be fired. I booked the hotel for a stay in April - it was a regular booking, no special discounts or conditions - they charged my credit card immediately and in full more than a month before I had the reservation scheduled. I had to cancel.....weeks before the arrival date and in full compliance with their cancellation policy - I have still not receieved my refund to my credit card and dealing with their accounting department amounts to leaving a message on their voicemail and never receiving a call back - these people are total incompetents and I'm now pursuing a refund providing all the relevant documentation through my credit card company because these idiots at Radisson are incapable of providing the assistance and customer support ANY other hotel could - their accounting department at this hotel is staffed by a bunch of incompetent screw ups - be very careful booking at this hotel and watch your credit card statement very, very carefully. These people are not to be trusted.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for one night only”
Reviews.Author: RatsBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We arrived late into LA and wanted to be out early the next day with the minimum of fuss and the Radisson enabled us to do it. The hotel is pretty dark , dingy and tired looking which gives the appearance of not being particularly clean but our bed and bathroom were spotless and for an airport hotel it was very quiet. No problems with staff, everyone was courteous. Would I choose to go here again. Probably not, would definitely check other hotels first but if the price fits for you - it's ok, nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all cost”
Reviews.Author: jsaylor18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived last night at the American Airlines terminal and phoned the Radisson (where we had a reservation) for transportation. The operator told us the van would be there in 20 minutes, and we stayed at the Red Hotel loading zone. The van took 20 minutes, and when it arrived, it stayed in the third lane away from the loading area and did not stop. I ran out in the road and waved, he waved back, and indicated he was full. I called the Radisson again, and 3 times got the message "the operator is not avaialble - call later". When I finally reached the operator, she did not apologize, just said, "The van comes every 20 - 25 minutes". When I pointed out that it could be full again and asked if she would reimburse for a cab, she said, "No". When I complained again, she said "We are close to terminal 1 and you can walk". When I asked her how to get from Terminal 4 to Terminal 1, she said, "The van comes every 20 - 25 minutes". I am 65 years old, my wife is 60, and we decided to walk the 1.2 miles with our luggage. When we got to the hotel, the staff apologized, and told us to complain to the van service if we wanted to complain. It was after 8 PM (10 PM at our home in Texas), and we said we were hungry - we were pointed to your restaurant (which was quite good). I know mistakes happen, but the hotel has a "100% Guarentee", and no one offered to comp the room, upgrade the room, or even a voucher toward the cost of a meal. The staff supevisor on duty when contacted by desk staff offered nothing. The manager on duty had gone home sick for the night. The room has a great bed, an old 27" TV, very cheap furniture and plastic glasses. This is hardly a 3 star hotel, and even making allowances for its great airport location, is not a place we would ever stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A relic from the 70s”
Reviews.Author: ronaldo123
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I could say about this hotel was our check in and out was hassle free, plus the shuttle to the terminal is fast. The only reason we stayed here was for an early flight (check out my other review for preferred place to stay in LA). Opening the door to our room was going through a time warp into a tired motel from decades long gone. The bed (a small double not a queen!) was disappointing. The TV was ancient. Bathroom was small and poorly equipped (just two towels). The aircon/heater was incredibly noisy and I just ran it while showering before bed - it would have been impossible to sleep with it on. As we'd arrived late and only had about 6 hours to sleep before our flight I didn't want to waste time asking for a better room. The view from our upper-level room would have been good (of the runways) if it wasn't for a dodgy tinting film that was bubbling and peeling. No aircraft noise, external sound insulation good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't arrive late, you will wait forever!”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadnonstop
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 9:45pm, in a hurry to check in because i had a 6:00am flight the next morning. I was amazed that there was a long check in line, and only one clerk. After waiting 15 minutes, with no acknowledgement, I actually called the hotel on my cellphone and asked if they might get some more help at the front desk (you would think the staff would be paying attention). I ended up waiting about 30 minutes to check in, and the line was very long behind me as i headed to the elevator

Reviews.Title: “Does everything an Airport Hotel should!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorFeelgoodDorset
Reviews.Content: The LAX Radisson does everything it should - fast check in, fast check out, facilities, free airport shuttle and reasonable restaurant. The rooms are comfortable with free WiFi but sadly no room safe. I could not work out the electric adjustable softness bed and the bathroom was small by US standards but I thought the restaurant was good enough so for one night you would be happy to stay in. Airport Shuttle needed as its too far to try and walk esepcially with bags! Parking is limited but I guess a lot of guests are dropping hire cars off or arrive by taxi in transit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: tntrvlngrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the LAX airport, but didn't find anything else special about this hotel. The decor is dark, but It is clean and the staff is courteous. In the past 2 months we have stayed at the Hilton in Glendale, the Radisson in Santa Ana and the Grand Vista in Simi Valley, all at comparable prices and their rooms and bathrooms were more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay, thanks in large part to great staff”
Reviews.Author: poetrypartners
Reviews.Content: Loads of All-Star Game basketball fans, a sorority conference, a biker gathering, a wedding, and a large contigent of Japanese tourists. That's not the punchline to a bad joke. It's what was at the Radisson during my stay, and it made for an unforgettable weekend (in a good way!). The fact that the Radisson staff dealt professionally with a full house of such diverse clientele and did so with a smile says a lot about this hotel. Every staffer I encountered, from the valet to the front desk to the waiter to the housekeeper, was very pleasant and seemed to really care that every guest had an enjoyable stay. Requests for extra towels or retrieval of my car from valet were met promptly and with courtesy that one might not expect from a highly trafficked airport hotel. Check-in and check-out were smooth and painless. My hotel room faced the south runway, and at first, I was concerned about airplane noise, but noise wasn't a problem at all -- I heard NO airplanes at all! The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. My roomie and I enjoyed the free wi-fi and the availability of an in-room refrigerator. The only drawback was the bed, which was one of those Sleep Number outfits. I'd never slept on one, and after two nights of fiddling with settings, I'm not in a hurry to sleep in one again. The bed seemed very squishy, even on a "firm" setting. Thankfully, the hotel provided plenty of pillows, so I was able to arrange them in a way that provided my back with sufficient support. I enjoyed my weekend at the Radisson and would have no qualms about returning. The staff there is really great, and they deserve kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Better to walk than take the airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: imac4444
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel for an overnight while awaiting a flight. The shuttle from the terminal is a bit slow and stops at several other hotels first, so, you're in for a long ride. In the morning, the shuttle to the airport was full and looked like it would be for several more rides. Coming every 20 minutes, this was not acceptable, and wouldn't allow me to catch my flight in time, so I walked. Yep, dragging your luggage from the airport to the terminal is faster thatn taking the shuttle. If you book on an aggregator, like Expedia, your room price will not include breakfast. Room was fine, staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Shaftlewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at end of round the world trip, had one night booked and had e-mailed the hotel to say that I was landing at 6am. On arrival at hotel was told off for arriving early, advised to go and wait at the airport until 3pm when check in officially opened. I politely explained that the landing time was not my fault and after much huffing from receptionist was told that there was a room available. Room was ok but dusty, not well kept and fridge was unplugged. However rest of staff seemed helpful and willing. For some reason huge number of porters who were almost pushing me into taxis when I fancied a walk. The hotel have a deal on a $5 trip to manhatton beach, I wouldn't bother it is a pretty boring area, again rude bus drivers as well. Overall the hotel is ok for one night but the staff really need to look in the mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Mom traveling with 13 year old Daughter”
Reviews.Author: dkmorales
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay that was simi close to UCLA Medical Center. It was about 15 minutes drive time and that was close enough for me. I was traveling alone with my daughter so I wanted a place that I felt safe. I found that here. The valets were super friendly and my car was always ready for me. The only down fall was no on site parking and you pretty much had to valet for $20.00/ day plus tip. but since I pricelined my room for $65.00 I still felt it was a reasonable. The hotel itself was definately 3.5 stars it is rated and the rooms are plenty big and the beds were super comfy. We stayed for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Fine When You Have to Overnight at LAX”
Reviews.Author: paulie47
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my stay was to get a night's sleep between a flight into LAX in the evening and a flight out in the morning. It worked, and the hotel served its purpose. The good is that I couldn't hear the airport noise, and that it is really close. The hotel restaurant was decent for breakfast. The bad included the shuttle: it took about 45 minutes waiting for plus the ride around the airport plus it stopped at another hotel first. A rule of thumb is that the shuttle to the hotel shouldn't take longer than your flight did. A better option would have been to walk, it looked as if it only would have taken 10 minutes. The room was small, the bathroom incredibly small. The TV was an antique. The furniture was old, the rug worn through in a couple of places. The drinking glasses were disposable plastic and wrapped like you get in motels. However the room was clean and the bed reasonably comfortable. I wouldn't want to stay here as the base for a trip to LA, however all I needed was a place to sleep near the airport and I got that.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 stars on Priceline-zero stars from me.”
Reviews.Author: DirectorInDTW
Reviews.Content: No parking, no parking, no parking-5 story parking structure is CLOSED, and you have to walk nearly 2 blocks down Sepulveda, past a dark, empty, abandoned office complex from the one parking lot that's closest (or you have to valet at $20 a day plus tips plus wait time). Don't accept a 3.5 star hotel from Priceline at LAX. This is it, and you don't want to be here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: theplane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson at LAX during an overnight stay, as my flight arrived into LAX at midnight, and my connection did not leave until the following afternoon. The shuttle was the only negative point, as it took a while to arrive. Aside from that, the hotel was comfortable, clean, and the breakfast served had a decent amount of variety. I will definitely be looking to stay again in future trips through LA.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Skater2259
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. The room was large, but the outdated furniture was misplaced – everything squeezed into one corner. The desk/table was pushed up against the TV armoire and you had to crawl under it to plug your computer in. The doors of the armoire wouldn't open all the way as they banged into the desk on one side and the suitcase table on the other This meant when opened they projected straight out. The only way to see the TV, which looked like it is a remnant from the 1980s, was by lying on the bed. There was a huge, ugly, uncomfortable office chair which barely fits into the space. When I asked about the schedule for the airport shuttle I was told there was no schedule and that it ran around every 20 to 30 minutes. This meant I had to show up 45 minutes before the time I needed to be at the airport, even though the hotel is less than 10 minutes away. The air conditioning didn’t work– it took 4 hours to drop 5 degrees. I’m guessing it dropped because the temperature outside dropped. I used a computer near the lobby to print my ticket and it was filthy – looked like no one dusted it in 10 years. The hallways and room smelled musty. Very few TV channels (guess you make more on movies that way). On the positive side -- you didn't hear the airplanes.

Reviews.Title: “Great LAX transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexMundo
Reviews.Content: This is my go to hotel when I have to layover. Good rates and great 24 hour roomservice. Friendly well trained staff. The lobby restaurant serves the best Huevo Rancheros on the Planet Earth. Hey, I have traveled the world and this is a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, comfortable rooms close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: 2000AtlanticGT
Reviews.Content: I needed a place close to the airport to make my noting flight out of LAX less stressfully avoiding the wonderful LA traffic. Very nice hotel, restaurant, and a little bar just off the lobby. Only parking is valet so add that to the price of the room when deciding where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: aliasrlm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson at LAX for one reason only - because our flight arrived late and the Radisson has a car rental (Midway) on-site. And that remains the ONLY reason we would ever return. The only saving grace was that we spent so little time here, since we arrived late (10 p.m.) and checked out early (8 a.m.). Could not wait to get our car and leave, to be honest. I felt a bit sorry for the families I saw checking in for what seemed to be like a long stay. I really do hope that their rooms were nicer than ours and their experience was better. While this property may look fine from the lobby and from the exterior, we were disappointed to discover that our room was outdated with worn/old fixtures, stains on the walls and most certainly not worth the money we paid ($100+). A decent price for the room we had is probably closer to $70. We paid extra for a "renovated" (when - in 1985?) room on a higher floor and "spectacular views" (um - what?) of the airport and the city. The room was very warm, so we turned on the AC fan - which whirred and clunked loudly all night and did absolutely nothing to cool the room. The temperature control in the room is quite old-school - just a dial for heat or cold. Very motel-like. The wall area around the air vent was dark and dirty; sorta' gross. We thought we'd leave the fan on high while we ate something downstairs...but even when we returned, the room was still stuffy, warm and slightly musty. (Upon checkout, I told a woman at the front desk about the loud fan and she didn't seem all that surprised, although she said she was sorry. If this was a nicer room at the hotel, I'd hate to see the conditions of the basic rooms.) I'm not sure if the windows opened or not, but there were two layers of window, one of which was covered in some kind of tinted film that made it hard to actually see out. I'm sure the double-layered window has something to do with the noise from the airport, so I totally understand that. But that aforementioned "spectacular view" was a wrinkly, blurry mess, thanks to the tinted film. And to be fair, it would've been sorta' cool, since the room was perched high above the famous "LAX" sign. On to the Sleep Number bed...which totally reminded me of a Reebok Pump shoe from the 80s (remember those?). You're supposed to be able to control the firmness of both sides of the mattress by pressing a button, which in turns "pumps up" the air on that side of the mattress. I was initally excited about this prospect since I like a softer bed than my husband...but this bed seemed like just a novelty. The noise the bed made when we increased the mattress firmness was crazy loud; I'm not sure if our bed was defective or if all of these beds sound like this. The bathroom seemed like it had been updated at some point. While your typical low-end hotel small bathroom setup remained the same - complete with flourescent lighting above (why oh why do hotels still do this?), it looked like the countertop had been replaced in recent years. The good news is that if you arrive late (which many do), the restaurant on-site (Palmira?) is still open. We ate at the bar at 10:30ish. The bartender was certainly very nice and the food was decent. There were some flies buzzing about at the bar, which was a bit distracting. The best thing about this hotel is that Midway car rental is located on-site and opens at 8 a.m...this company has great rates and friendly staff and we spent only $92 for a intermediate rental for four days. Really a positive experience with them. So there was a convenience factor in staying at the Radisson. The airport shuttle service was fine. All the hotel staff I encountered were friendly. This hotel could be nice if Radisson just spent some money on updating the rooms. I truly felt like I was in a time warp staying at this property. It's almost like Radisson has let this hotel go because they're guaranteed to get customers due to airport proximity. We probably won't return unless the rooms are updated...or the price is lower.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with old facilities”
Reviews.Author: globeseller
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a old olympic swimming pool that is not lighted at night and its located closer to the parking lot. You have to walk outside the main hotel and around the corner to get to it. The rooms are ok but very ordinary with TV not even a flat screen looks dated from the early 1980's. The beds are good because it is a sleep number type. The room has little ammenities and the food are expensive. its a mundane hotel good for a lay over and nothing more. The surrounding area has no restaurant by waking distance and the customer service is practically non existence.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and poor service”
Reviews.Author: dumesnil-laurent
Reviews.Content: Went there with my wife and my 2 boys (6 and 2y.o) and was very dispointed. it took ages to see the hotel shuttle arriving. and as it was very windy and cold, the kids were freezing. Finaly arrived there and the bell man took our luggages. he told us he was following us but 30 minutes later we were still waiting in the room. tried to call the receptionist but the phone was not working. Finally, went to the lobby and asked where the hell were my luggages. they called many people to see where he was and i finally got them. Room was not that clean. Found a pair of socks and an old room card on the floor. wondering if they really clean the rooms. lady at the lobby in always stressed even with only one or 2 persons to handle. on the departure, in the morning, no hot water... Well, this hotel does not deserve 3.5 stars. the only good thing was the breakfast buffet were we had a good service most of the time (depending on the waiter). And the beds are really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, but maintenance need to be improve...”
Reviews.Author: CSLUI
Reviews.Content: As most other mentioned, it's conveniently located and about the closest hotel from LAX. Hotel shuttles operate at 24x7 hours with about every 20 - 30 minutes per shuttle. Their maintenance need to be improve. The bathroom tub faucet handle was stuck so we can not take shower (except to change room, but we have been so tired that night so we didn't change room). We have a little hard time looking for an electric outlet from the bathroom. We end up found that's hiding behind the vanity mirror and there is an extension out from the mirror stand (but that does not work). Our beds are Sleep Number Bed, but when I press the remote on my bed, I did not feel any adjustment. (Compare to the Radisson hotel in Flatstaff that we stayed few days later, those from Flatstaff work well) Other than these issues found, other facilities is about average compare to the same rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Everything you need on the inside"”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I was unlucky enough to have picked up some kind of cold or flu over the Labor Day holiday and wound up spending more than a little time indoors. This hotel is a huge infrastructure, and I was glad the desk could muster me through quickly. I bought a couple of bottles of chilled spring water from the hotel gift shop. Then I headed to my 6th floor room with my rollerbag. I jumped on top of one of the double beds and dozed until 7pm. I had seen a Boston Market in the neighborhood and thought I'd just stick my head out into the fresh air for a minute. At the valet station, one of the guys took a look at me and actually ran to get my car. This turned out to be the case the rest of my visit -- the guys seemed to like me. The next morning at 4am, a relative called me and asked that I fly to Denver. By 4:45am I as back at the valet station asking for my rental car again (I've since been informed the Radisson has an airport shuttle). I was back at 9pm and stopped at an all-night drug store for bath salts and a bath brush and spent the next couple of hours in the bath tub. As a matter of fact, during the rest of my visit, I saw very little of the hotel but the inside of my room and the valet station at the front door. I can vouch for the valets -- they are the nicest people I have ever met. The front desk people were efficient and treated me well. The 6th floor had recently been renovated, and the rooms there were cozy and comfortable. I will return here when I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “If you like cold water for showers and shaves, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: dtravOKT
Reviews.Content: Never got an explanation, but had cold water for shower and shaving--did get a room discount because of it, but would have rather had hot water! Business center (and that's being generous with the title) had no signage, had to ask for help to find it, and had no capabilities other than printing boarding passes. FedEx/UPS services were handled by a sort of concierge desk, and the attendant couldn't find shipping labels, but maybe thats because she was on phone with her friend talking about her new iPhone. Check-in/out was slow, only 2 people behind this massive counter and at least one was always on the phone. In sum: definitely NOT business-traveler friendly, except as a close-to-airport stayover, but then, there are many other hotels at the airport, and I'll be staying at another next time......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: JohannaGuerrero
Reviews.Content: We went to LA for an event and since we started to look for an accommodation a bit late, there weren't any decent hotels left in downtown. That is why we chose this. When we arrived we understood that it was a really good choice: the rent-a-car offices were in the same area and we could reach any by a shuttle bus, there were plenty of parking lots in the surroundings, it took us only 20 minutes to go to the downtown even with heavy traffic of LA, the food in the restaurant was very good, the staff helpful and professional, the room spacious, comfortable and clean. So, if you don't mind to go by car, this hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quick location and a bar!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean - missing convenient power outlets. Not all rooms have coffee pots. Need to go outside Lobby to smoke. Free wifi in room, ask front desk for free lobby wifi code. DO NOT take taxi from LAX! $17.50 mandatory charge for 4 minute drive. Curtusy shuttle runs wert 15 minutes :) Terrific and helpful staff - also NO airport noise (maids on the other hand - we had a late checkout, peeps kept calling our room at 10 am and hanging up) left room to have a smoke and noticed someone took do not disturb sign from door) they were also yelling at each other in the hallway. Other than that - Daniel at the front desk was wonderful at checking - restaurant and bar staff excellent (as was food). Don't use sleep number beds if you are not used to them! Takes more than one night ti figure out "your number" - and waking up was painful. Will return if we are ever stranded by Delta airlines again :)

Reviews.Title: “amazing bed- exactly what you need between long haul flights”
Reviews.Author: DBroadhead
Reviews.Content: Shuttle bus was super- driver was very courteous and helpful- staff were great throughout check in, porters, bar staff etc. We had an excellent sleep- then powerful shower- very pleased overall- thank you Radisson LAX!

Reviews.Title: “usual airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanBotto
Reviews.Content: you got the room, you can go for breakfast and that's all. simply airport hotel to stay overnight and move to another city

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road choice near LAX, no self-parking”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here three times now, an I've seen the good and the bad. Always a loud, crowded hotel. Average business rooms, so-so service. Parking is always tight but right now your only choice is $20 valet; the self-parking garage is completely closed. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A real surprise”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I have to confess that I wasn't expecting much. I was landing late at LAX and needed to book somewhere convenient. I'd stayed before at three or four other LAX airport hotels. Whilst this wasn't up to the standards of the Sheraton next door, it was a real surprise and very comfortable for the money I had paid around $60 on Priceline for the night. I picked up my rental car the following morning, so didn't have to pay for parking. Very good sound insulation, and free wireless in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: This is a good but expensive hotel if someone wants to stay close to the airport. I had to catch a early morning international flight. So, I chose to stay here. The hotel is really very close to the airport. It is even possible to walk to the airport. Otherwise there is a shuttle which will take you there. The rooms were clean and well maintained. However, I did not receive our requested wake up call. And then to hurry up I had to miss my breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “UNDER CONSTRUCTION!!!”
Reviews.Author: stockmktgenius
Reviews.Content: The parking garage is under construction, and has been for some time. Parking costs $20 per night. The first room we were given had been used. The second room, the card key didn't work. So my exhausted wife stayed with our bags outside the room while I got another key. The new key didn't work either. I went down and told the clerk he had to give me something to make up for this, and he gave me free breakfast vouchers. The third key did work. Room was okay, nothing special. Not bad value for the $55 I paid on Priceline, but wouldn't go back as don't like to stay at places under construction.

Reviews.Title: “A sleep factory efficiently run as a cash cow”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: Got the Radisson Lax for US$68 a night, which definitely is value for money. The hotel is efficiently run as a cash cow. Days later there was an extra charge of $14 on my credit card for which no invoice was issued. Several e-mails requesting explanation were left unanswered by Radisson Lax staffs. Its location is fine, close to LAX with a free shuttle bus service. The shuttle is adequate but as it also serves the nearby Crowne Plaza it takes quite some time to get to and from LAX. The bed was comfortable as was the room. Room and bathroom were clean, windows cannot be opened, noise isolation is OK. Complimentary Wi-Fi in the room, no free Wi-Fi in the lobby. At walking distance on W96th Street is LA city bus station. The city bus is the best way to get to the Getty Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Walk to LAX”
Reviews.Author: 13charley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Terminal 1 at LAX. The rooms are large and comfortable, Wireless internet is complimentary, in-house restaurant is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight airport stay”
Reviews.Author: BondFan
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay at this hotel as our connecting flight was not until the next night. Check in was quick and efficient. The rooms and bathroom were clean and fairly modern. We stayed here for one night only and based on this, i would say the hotel was fine for a one night stay, though would not recommend for longer stays in LA simply because i understand there is not much going on around this hotel - other than the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you can get it really cheap!”
Reviews.Author: fsview11
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient at least. Was informed the restaurant was still open and room service was 24 hours as well as the availability of free internet. I asked for a high floor facing the airport and was given 1248. Unfortunately a couple was also given a key packet that said they were in that room and the maid had to call and sort it out. Turns out it was in fact my room. After 30 seconds in the room, the smell and carpet stains were all I needed to see and headed back to the front desk. I told them of the problems and was assigned a room on the 6th floor. This was much better, the a/c was already on and the room was cold, the carpet was different than the other room so I'm not sure if they're in the midst of a renovation or not. The bed and linens were comfortable, however the hotel needs to splurge on hairnets for housekeeping. I pulled several long black hairs of the bed spread. I got this hotel through Priceline for $65, while I was in the Delta baggage service office I saw a flyer for a distressed traveler rate they offered at the Radisson for the same rate of $65. Paying anymore than that for this hotel would be a waste of money. Priceline rated this 3.5 stars, no way it is above 3 and some rooms are 2-2.5

Reviews.Title: “Radisson sliding downhill”
Reviews.Author: kstringer
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the beginning of our L.A. trip. The non-smoking room had been smoked in and stank. The faucet leaked all over the countertop and onto the floor. The sink did not drain. The sleepnumber bed sounded like and 18 wheeler and the bed squealed every time we turned over. We changed rooms. The new room did not smell, but the bed still made horrible noised when you turned over. The housekeeping staff knocked on our door at 8:15 am and woke us up. The elevator stopped an inch and a half short of the floor and I tripped and went sprawling when leaving the elevator. We stayed another night at the end of our trip. We requested the room they had moved us to previously, since it didn't smell smoky. In the 4 days since our last stay the t.v. no longer worked - everything was fuzzy. The tablelamp no longer worked. The housekeeping staff woke us up at 8:15 am by knocking on our door. Radisson used to be a good chain. There is something seriously wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Functional - nothing else”
Reviews.Author: CDinNI
Reviews.Content: I booked this on the last night of a Californian holiday with my wife and adult daughter. We had a wonderful holiday but things were almost derailed when we checked in here before a flight back to London. The room allocated had electrical issues in the en-suite and the carpet was badly stained. We wanted to check a few things out but there was no information in the room. However, when I complained in keeping with their policy they moved us to a different room. This place is fine as an airport stop-over nothing more. On that basis I recommend it but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for post/pre flight night”
Reviews.Author: loumcd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our last night in L.A. Lobby and restaurant are lovely and there are lots of services provided (spa, 24hr room service, wi-fi). The room itself (special pre-booked rate) was of a reasonable size and good quality. The bathroom could do with being updated though - the shower curtain smelled horrible as well as being hideous to look at! Also not enough towels provided - they should be in abundance! We ate in the restaurant and had great service from our waiter - Felipe, and the host - Alejandro (sp?). Food was of reasonable quality albeit somewhat pricey. Some staff not so friendly (woman on reception desk at check out and woman on valet service desk at check out) but overall would stay here again when flying into LAX.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: bisu77
Reviews.Content: If you need to catch a plane early in the morning, it's the place. no more than 5 minutes to the terminal with free shuttle bus. I had a rental car, I returned it the previous night and a driver from Hertz drove me to the hotel for free. This gave me an extra half-hour to sleep the next morning as I only had to go straight to the terminal. Hotel is nice, clean and the stuff is helpful. Car park is quite expensive but in line with other los angeles hotels. I booked through radisson website and I got a deal for 89.00usd. Exellent value!

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: granmapatsy
Reviews.Content: A 3.5* or is it 3*(???) star nightmare. Paid $60 per night and it wasn't worth $25!! We had three different rooms for a 2 night stay. On checkin, the first room had a non working phone and a buzzing loud fan and it was a cracker box with wrinkled linens(bed spread). A $7.00 charge to use a computer kiosk, so I walked right next door to use one of six free computers at the Marriott Courtyard.O, reportedly all the refurbished rooms were on the upper floors which we wanted however they only had sleep number bed.... yuck... like sleeping on an air mattress.... gave me back spasms. Moved to new room. No coffee pot, no bathrobe... had to ask for it .After we got back from out first day out.... the room was stifling hot, the housekeeping had not refreshed the coffee station, didn't empty the ice bucket and leave a new plastic liner. after that the engineer decided the ac was broken and soooooooooo at 9pm we had to pack up and move to another room. It was still hot, smaller room.. i took a sleeping pill and gave up and went to bed. Next day I spoke with the hotel manager. She wrote off the $20 per day valet parking, 2 days... she couldn't do more because it was a "priceline room". Word to the wise... when you read a bad review.... take it to heart (i didn't) and don't even take a chance on getting this property if using bidding. Guess we will stay in Orange County next time and make the drive to LA. At least I know what I am getting into there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away: totally incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: Eklektech
Reviews.Content: Staff is pleasant, courteous, and totally ignorant or incompetent. Front desk staff (2 of them) had never heard of the hotel function room in which I had a meeting scheduled. One bar waitress for 30 tables. Hotel kept at meatlocker temperatures, and even when outside temperatures were in the 60s all day, would not turn up heat nor turn on heat in guest rooms. Multitude of signs about how "green" they are, yet beds and towels changed daily. No quality control on room housekeeping, e.g., room service trays left in hallway floor for a full day. Unless you have car you are trapped here for meals. Restaurant is better run and food not bad, but usual high hotel prices. Caters to large groups who crowd lobby and restaurant. Free low-speed internet, but $5-10 a night for decent speeds! Go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: sportingclays
Reviews.Content: Worst radisson I ever stayed at! Upon arrival, the parking garage which is normally free to park in was under construction and they wanted to charge me $22 to valet my car 5 feet from the door. I could have parked the car myself. The front desk girl ignored my concerns completely and would not transfer me to the buena park radisson where I preferred to stay because radissons are all franchises. I called radisson customer service who told me it was my obligation to check the parking tab before booking my reservation. Even they had an attitude instead of helping me! Customer Service is dead in this country. I will never stay in radissons dirty filthy rooms again. I used to frequent these hotels but will never stay there again. If they don't care about their customers then they don't deserve my hard earned cash. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Booked room 2 months in advance and didn't get what I booked upon checkin! Never again...”
Reviews.Author: HARLEEBB
Reviews.Content: I expect that if I book a particular room 2 months in advance that I will get that room upon check-in. I will never book a room with any Radisson again, EVER. If you give my room away to some "Joe" that walks off the street and checks in earlier than me then you lost my business forever. The room was fine but not what we booked so it stunk as far as I can say. LOST A CUSTOMER RADISSON because you didn't hold the room I reserved.

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: unfancy_guy
Reviews.Content: The TV was so old I thought it would come with rabbit ears. Channel selection of about 3 channels. No cable to speak of. The TV cabinet was chipped and worn. I should have registered under the name of Ratso Rizzo - it was that bad. Air conditioner fan was miuch too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: david4602
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Lobby area very nice, with rooms nice and large. The checkin for Midway rental car is in the hotel, so very convenient if you rent from them (and you should check them out...low prices on basic cars and they also rent exotics). Friendly staff, convenient shuttle. Most of all a very quiet room with no plane noise. Only complaint is that wifi was very slow. Not sure if it was my room location or if they deliberately had it too slow so you upgraded to faster service (which I did not).

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: mgs02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Raddison for 1 night, as we had a flight early the next morning. I pricelined a room, and they gave me this hotel. I called right after the bid was accepted to request a non-smoking king room with the sleep number bed. I also called and confirmed that the day of my check in. Needless to say, we checked in about 11pm and we got a small room with a full size bed and no sleep number. I called to tell them it was not a king bed, and I was told "I'm sorry, but our computer system says it is, so it is." I went down to the lobby and spoke to the manager. Finally, we got the room they promised. The new room smelled. At first I thought it was cigarette smoke smell, but my wife thought it was some sort of cleaning agent. The room and bathroom was run down. You can tell the carpet was old, and the bathroom tub was like an old apartment. I saw lots of dust on the air vent in the bathroom. The sleepnumber bed was weird. We never slept on one before, but there was some sort of big air bubble right in the middle of my side of the bed, I kept rolling towards the middle. We were hit blindsided by the parking situation and charge. When I checked out the website when I booked the room, it said there was self parking and I didn't see anything about a charge. When we got there, they said the self parking is closed and it's $22 for valet. We had no choice. On a good note, the restaurant is open 24 hours, even though they have a limited menu during the overnight hours. I can't tell you how the food was because we weren't able to eat. We were waiting and waiting for someone to take our order. I finally went to the bartender and he said to keep waiting. We left after about 20 minutes of waiting, and went to bed without dinner. (We weren't about to walk around that neighborhood at that time of night.). I would not recommend this hotel. I have never stayed at a Raddison before, so I can't compare it, but I always thought that the Raddison brand was a great name. I can't say that I'll never stay at another Raddison, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment hiding behind the Radisson Name”
Reviews.Author: Allieooooops
Reviews.Content: While the lobby is lovely, it's not representative of the entire hotel. The rooms were alright, the sleep number beds awesome, but the cleanliness and service left a lot to be desired and did not meet expectations of a Radisson. If I had been traveling alone I would have switched hotels. The parking garage is under construction but they're happy to share the deal with some garage down the street. Really? You couldn't tell me this in advance, perhaps with the lovely email you sent reminding me that if I didn't cancel by a certain minute you would charge me for the room. And I'm to be happy about putting my car in a garage down the street and then walking back to the hotel late at night. It's very close to LAX. That and the sleep numbers beds are all this place has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “walking distance to terminal”
Reviews.Author: griswolds09
Reviews.Content: decent airport hotel within walking distance (10min.) to domestic terminal. this is a great advantage, just cross the street and you're almost there. best choice when you have only carry on luggage. no need to wait for shuttle. rooms average with limited views, as windows have never been cleaned from the outside. no fridge nor safe in room. very friendly and accomodating check in staff = 5points. outdoor pool is large = 5points with plenty of towels available. a real downside was room service and what they call signature pizza. don't waste your money on that one. subways next door. overall a good choice for an airport hotel. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very geared to the short stay business visitor”
Reviews.Author: thegrumpys
Reviews.Content: We had a stop for a couple of days - en route from Toronto to Auckland. We chose the hotel for its proximity to LAX. The room was large but looked a bit tired and dated. There was a smell of damp in the corridor but fortunately this did not apply to the room. It's a good base to explore the sitesof Los Angeles and the staff were very helpful in arranging a couple of day trips to Universal Studios (absolutely brilliant) and around Hollywood (my how the other half lives!) We'd recommend the buffet breakfast which is good value and compliment the helpful and attentive staff, particularly the reception and concierge staff who made up for the tired and dated feel of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Bennett_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Radisson overnight between flights. The shuttle service was HORRIBLE. It took me over an hour to get from the airport to the hotel. The room had wet carpet and smelled of mildew, the ceiling tiles were falling off and there were no amenities for a business traveler. I guess that the slow shuttle service was a good thing because I had less time that I had to tolerate the decrepit room and facilities. Look for any other LAX hotel if you have to stay over.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenience overrides perks”
Reviews.Author: akikoko
Reviews.Content: This may be a 3.5 star rated hotel, but the parking here is horrible. Our family has a disabled child and we clearly saw parking spaces designated for disabled persons. The valet here is $22/night and they refused to let us park there without paying the ridiculous price. We ended up having to park in a separate lot that was a couple blocks away through some back streets, which can be dangerous especially when you come back at night. We have three children so this was a big concern. Although the attendants at the front desk were eager to help, they really need to change the parking policy here. We won't be coming back otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Past it's Prime.”
Reviews.Author: silverwings727
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. The Good: Very close to airport, free shuttle from LAX every 15 minutes, nice coffee shop, pool looked nice. Took a 10 minute trolley in front of hotel to the pier for $5/person. Concierge desk was extremely helpful. The Bad: Rooms were old, we were on the 11th floor, and the hallway had moldy smell. Carpet was stained in our room and completely run down in hallway. Bathroom was suspect- ragged towels, run down shower curtain, washcloths were damp!, found hairs on the floor around shower.gross. We were "up graded" to a room with a Sleep Number bed and both of us woke up sore because they were so uncomfortable. We attempted to order room service but there was no menu. We had to call room service twice before a menu was brought up to our room. When menu arrived it was empty so I gave up and just called to get a menu over the phone. We assumed the business room computers would be free (we needed to print boarding passes), but found out you have to pay about $8.00 for 15 minutes and one dollar per print. Ridiculous. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis after a long flight.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingTuatara
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the Radisson LAX. We used this as a stop over to break a long journey form New Zealand to the Midwest USA. We found the long flight a lot easier because we knew LAX was our final destination for the day, rather than boarding another flight for several hours. We found the Radisson exceeded our expectations. The location was perfect, a free shuttle to and from the airport to the hotel, friendly staff and a more than adequate room. The pool was a relief for our 8yr old son too. Hotel staff gave us simple directions to the bus depot, 2 blocks away, to catch a bus to Santa Monica Pier ($2.50, total, for 2 adults and 1 child) where we had a great, relaxing day. We didn't sleep much because of jet lag but I was surprised at how well sound proofed the rooms were. While we could notice the aircraft coming and going through the night, the noise would not have disturbed us if we had have been on the regular sleep patterns. We didn't eat at the hotel, it looked a bit expensive for our budget, we found good restaurants just a few blocks walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Closest hotel to the airport”
Reviews.Author: CyndieTodd
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay close to LAX, this is as close as you can get. Ten minutes by free shuttle to Terminal 1 (Southwest and US Air). Not fancy, and everybody else knows how convenient it is, too, so it's busy all the time with people doing what you want to do at the same time, but good value for the proximity. Room service was not good for us, though. They forgot our order and we were almost asleep by the time we finally got our food. Took 30 minutes just to have beers brought up.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Our bid of $70 for a 4-star hotel through Priceline was accepted and we were set to stay at the Sheraton Gateway, but at the last minute we were informed by Priceline that the Sheraton discovered it was overbooked (certainly they didn't get so many full-fare reservations that they kicked out Priceline customers?), and we were put here (ostensibly a 3 1/2 star hotel) instead. The hotel does show its age, and lacks some amenities such as in-room safes, but the room was okay. We asked for a quiet room and were at first a bit displeased to find we were in a room facing the airport (the hotel is immediatly across from the airport's main entrance), the thick windows did in fact filter out all airplane noise. I heard a little noise only from an occaisonal large jet taking off. Heard no street noise. Housekeeping generally good tough used room service trays did appear to sit in the hallway for an awful long time. The hotel restaurant was good, albeit pricey (on a par with other hotel restaurants). The lobby cafe/bar had limited food items and could get food from the main restaurant. Hotel is within about 3 bloks of the main public bus stop for the area. We used it to get to by bus to Westwood and Santa Monica (one could go to a Green Line light rail station from there). The hotel shuttle to LAX itself is shared with another area hotel. Wireless Internet was free (a bit surprised to read about the $17 connection fee in another review). There are almost no non-hotel restaurant options within walking distance. We walked to Carl's Jr. for breakfast. We did not use the outdoor pool (a bit cool) or small fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but pretty dirty and old"”
Reviews.Author: GOCAT14
Reviews.Content: I was expecting to get the Crowne Plaza on Hotwire but got this property which was already on my crossed off list. Anyway, for $55 a night I wasn't expecting a lot, but it was annoying me because I was here for 5 days whilst in LA and day-tripping on VX/WN. On the plus side I am an avid Plane spotter so the location/view convinced sort of made me feel better. They cleaned the room each day which I wasn't expecting, good start. Beds were not. The linen appeared to be stained in parts and I could make out bed bugs underneath, the mattress was probably ancient and I would hate to vacuum the bed and see what comes off. The carpet also had marks, but care factor was zero. Bathroom is pretty tired looking and has been touched up, but standing over the bath to shower with a old tatty curtain is pretty depressing. There is a nice little cafe downstairs which was handy. Biggest frustration was when I left my laptop adapter back in Australia, the prices was like $17 for 15mins which is the most overpriced internet I have ever come across in my travels, and I presume these prices are to make up for the free wifi. The internet area was very trendy and relaxing, even though I did not use it. It was cheaper to go to Best-Buys and get a $70 cord than pay for their net access. Staff were all fine and friendly, and they if you want a different room, just go and ask them, he didn't care. And for some reason there was all holes in the walls which worry some, plus I could hear my neighbors arguing over the crap TV selection, so not very private. I wont go back to this place again, but good value for $55.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay but BYOBedLinen”
Reviews.Author: IADFlyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before early flight. Check-in takes more than 15 minutes at night. The room was okay but my wife and daughter refused to use bed linen since it was dirty and they used their towels for sleeping. I am not sure whether they used shower.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indra_Mum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel enroute from Vegas to Disneyland & stayed for just a day. The rooms are amazing & very comfortable. The rooms & premises are clean & maintained. Housekeeping is good. They give complimentary free high speed internet. Hotel is situated very close to airport & so travelling to airport is very easy. The view from the room was good. A Nice Hotel where you can have a nice sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: stacirl
Reviews.Content: Checking into the Radisson at night is a bit tricky. The room was very dark and the sleep number bed seemed like it was on it's last legs. The hotel has a great location, was very quiet and the $14 parking fee seemed very reasonable for Los Angeles. This wouldn't be my 1st choice on where to stay in LA but I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: pomonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 after a 13 hour flight from Australia and en route to Seattle. Airport shuttle could not be easier and check in was a dream. We got a spacious room if a little "tired", but these rooms must be worked pretty hard in this location. Beds very comfortable. Bar service and menu were excellent. We suffered no disturbance by aircraft noise.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: VijayGandhi
Reviews.Content: This is just a beautiful modern hotel , we stayed there for 2 nights, good staff, nice ambience. walking distance from airport, best value for money with this kind of luxury. stay in this hotel if you are looking to stay overnight in the hotel or got a flight to catch early in the morning, it is comparatively cheap hotel (cost wise), with no compromise in comfort or luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag - mostly bad.”
Reviews.Author: mew102
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night to see a friend off on a flight out of LAX the next morning. There was a mix-up with the reservation and I have to say the front desk staff was very accommodating and got us situated well. Unfortunately, things went downhill from there. My friend had an early flight and I decided to sleep in before driving home to San Diego. Housekeeping would not leave me alone even though I had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. They called, they knocked on the door - "are you checking out today?". I told them that I would be there until check out time (12 noon). But they came back AGAIN. They wanted me out of that room. When I left at 11:45 a.m., the maid was waiting outside the door with the cart. I felt like I was being kicked out, and they totally ignored the "do not disturb' sign on the door more than once. Very understaffed. Getting car out of valet parking was a nightmare because they do not have enough people on staff to service, so had to wait too long. It's an airport hotel, you know, people are in a hurry! The most disturbing thing was I was joined by a cockroach in the shower. Ugh. Highly recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,, average room”
Reviews.Author: kiwi47
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here as we had an early flight and there is a rental car company( Midway rentals) in the same building. It is a short walk to Terminal 1. The room was quiet. It was tired, but clean. The beds we found incredibly uncomfortable, like sleeping on a cheap airbed. Our requested wakeup call never eventuated. There is a regular shuttle to the airport which we just missed and decided to take an $8 cab ride instead of waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay apart from parking cost!”
Reviews.Author: Ellisd88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights as a base to see the city. The hotel is literally next door to the airport but you don't get any noise from the runways or not that I noticed. Rooms are large and the restaurant here did really nice food. Just down the road is a dennys and maccy d's. Only negative is the valet parking is expensive. They say on their website that you can park yourself but you can't. $20 a day, be warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Very experienced traveller would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGal001
Reviews.Content: Have travelled the world many times over several years, staying in backpackers up to exclusive accommodation - this hotel was a shocking surprise:-( Stayed on 2 occasions in May, each time overnight for flight connections. The first occasion there was a long queue at reception to check in and check out. No assistance offered with luggage, despite it being mid afternoon check in. Reception staff courteous, not overly friendly, unhelpful. The king single room was very small and bathroom shabby. Ordered one meal and hot drink from room service. After 35 mins the meal arrived sans drink. Was told if I wanted it I'd have to wait another 30 mins as the room service attendant was busy with other orders waiting. A hotel of this size with only one room service waiter? Next morning (after flight from Aus) had a Zzzz sign on my door but room attendants didn't take any notice - really noisy out in the hallway with doors slamming regularly. The fitness centre had no towels provided and only 1 of the treadmills was working. The second occasion (prebooked which is why I went there a 2nd time) there was again a long queue at check in (midnight), the lobby bar was being used for a function so it was packed with people, again no assistance offered with luggage/no trolley provided. I asked for a quiet room. Got a larger room this time with 2 beds, but the bathroom was a shocker. Had to hold the sink taps when using them as the whole mechanism was loose in the vanity casing. There was pubic hair on the toilet when I arrived and hair in the shower. No paper cups let alone glasses in the bathroom, and the coffee cups in the room are paper. Neither of the beds had an operational sleep system (which Radisson so heavily promotes). Could hear the TV next door and doors slamming until the early hours of the morning. The wallpaper was very marked and the old aircon unit had water stains on the ceiling next to it. The concierge didn't know how to get to the the nearest shopping centre by public transport and made a big deal of having to look it up on the internet. Huge queue for check out and the shuttle bus was late going to the airport - the staff basically couldn't give a toss and told me that it was a 3 minute walk to the airport! (if you look at Google maps you'll see that you have to cross freeways etc - great with suitcases - not!). That 3 minute walk, mind you, would've cost me US$20 in the hotel "limousine" (a regular sedan). Overall this hotel needs a massive refurbish and the staff need to be trained in basic hospitality etiquette. They're either lazy or understaffed - can't work out which. The only plus is that despite it being so close to the airport you can't hear the planes - however the noise in adjacent rooms/hallways will make up for it!! There are better value hotels close to LAX airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain GROSS!!! Stay ANYWHERE else!!”
Reviews.Author: trvldog
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel May 29th - We arrived after being in Mexico for 7 nights and had a forced overnight in LA before returning to Seattle. We arrived at hotel at 10p - to welcome sign of Salsa convention- Oh Yippee after a ful day of travel to arrive to a huge group - They played Salsa music so dam loud till least 3A than we got to hear the rude people screaming in the halls and slamming doors till 5A- Hotel staff did not care! The room- just plain GROSS!! room 559- STAINS all over floor, wore my socks all night, phone by bed broken, toilet ran off and on all night, room service available 24 hours but no room service menu. We ordered room service -WRONG MISTAKE-$73.99 for 2 cheeseburgers and 4 beers TOTAL RIP OFF! I am a Travel agent & I will NEVER make any of my customers stay here . I book a lot of Radissons all over the world. Radisson should be embarassed to have this hotel as part of there chain..

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 3.5 Star!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElGordo727
Reviews.Content: Great Location Nice Lobby Rooms were SUB-Par at best Water pressure was unusable Bed (sleep number) was LOUD and creaked on every move Shuttle was late late! Too many other options at same or less cost Hotwire booking so I rolled the dice and came up craps!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, rooms were good, parking's a sore”
Reviews.Author: Joel C
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent! Joy @ front desk, Mitzka helpdesk, Dwayne bell captain was excellent. they truly made my stay a difference. took care of everything for me and even special request was made to the fullest extend. Room was comfy and cozy, bed's was good but i slept on better ones before. sleep number advertised was not working. Two things i dislike though One was definitely was the parking arrangements. Parking here's a sore point. limited space for self parking. if you can't find any, they are plenty available for valet parking.. was not able to park even though there were empty spaces. 15 dollar is for 24 hour pass + taxes is 16.50 it could also charge to your room but only it could be done at the front desk. if you're on the way out you can't do it at the exit. Two: business center, even though internet was available at your rooms, if you wanted to use the business center it seems like a internet cafe. no privacy and definitely limited space to work on. 6.95 for 15 minutes on internet and a printed page cost 0.50 cents or a quarter can't remember on that. however boarding pass print are free if you can't find your airline like i did. you could go to mytzkia and she'll take care of everything for you!

Reviews.Title: “Prefer Hilton LAX, it's cheaper, cleaner and a lot more luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Elsie_travel
Reviews.Content: Paint was peeling from the ceiling in the bathroom, towel rack was rusty, room design was very outdated. They have a Business center where you can print out your boarding pass, but you only get 5min per session and the internet speed is so slow that 1 session just isn't enough! Stayed at the Hilton LAX 14days before staying at Radisson, I choose Radisson because it was a bit closer to the airport but I wished I sticked with the Hilton. It's only 1km further down the road, they also have a shuttle, it's 50 us dollars cheaper and by far more updated and modern than the Radisson. Will never stay at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont rely on shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Jodestar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as an overnight stop from the East Coast before an early morning flight. My husband arrived at LAX at 9.30pm and had to wait 40mins for the shuttle, and that was after another disgruntled guest called reception asking where the shuttle was. I arrived at 12.30am. Waited waited waited. nothing. tried to phone the Radisson. Phone would ring out or put you back to the welcome message all over again, no one answered. I could see the hotel so started walking and had to turn back, there is no path to get to the hotel, or easily viewable way to cross roads/scrub etc. Woke husband who rang the front desk, they said that they would send the shuttle. After 10 minutes, a carpark delivery van asked where I was going (it was now 1.30am) and dropped me off. While I felt guilty for leaving when a shuttle was on the way, I was tired and not turning down a ride. When I approached reception to let them know that I was at the hotel, I was told they couldnt get a hold of the shuttle driver, ie THERE WAS NO ONE ON THE WAY TO PICK ME UP. If the Radisson communciated this, that would be one thing, I would have happily jumped in a cab as soon as I landed. Waiting 1 hr at a deserted airport at that hour of the morning is not amusing.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty carpet, very expensive food, needs upgrading in the worst way.”
Reviews.Author: bruisercruiser
Reviews.Content: Walking in, the walls are old, ugly, and wooden. All carpet is badly in need of cleaning and replacing. When I checked in, I was given a room that was already occupied. Dirty towels on the bathroom floor, used kleenex in the trash, and luckily the person staying there was out at the moment I walked in. Halls are dingy and narrow and need paint desparately. Only one restaurant, not two as shown on their signs in the hotel. Food is very expensive, and they do not have a Starbucks as advertised... they serve Starbucks coffee at the bar in the morning. Lots of other very nice hotels in the same block. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff, great restaurants, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ltomte
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best value I could find in the LAX areaAll the staff members we encountered were incredibly nice and helpful. The panoramic restaurant on the top floor has a great view, and the breakfast buffet downstairs was amazing. It is the third year we go to this hotel, and the quality is just there !

Reviews.Title: “No soap or air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: bedfordmom2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson LAX last night and I was dismayed to find no airconditioning, few lights, no phone service and no soap in my room. I complained and was upgraded to another room; given a queen for four people and finally switched to the appropriate room. I was shocked again to find no soap or airconditioning in that room. The duty engineer came in and "fixed " it but said if we adjusted it we would have to call him again. He said that they have chronic air conditioning problems. Being from New England, I had read this on trip advisor and said how bad could it be. It was hot. The check in desk said that they had no soap and to call housekeeping; and they finally delivered one small bar of soap. I have gotten better amenities at a Motel 6. Although we were there less than nine hours for a early am flight, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one day trip”
Reviews.Author: nubnone
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not as bad as hwat I had revioucly read about. It met my needs for the wuick turnaround that i needed. I did not park so that did not bother me, but when I have stayed at other LAX propertied I paid way more to park so this was in line with waht i would expect to pay. The staff was very friendly and Marland at check-in made me feel at home. Other people that I came in contact with were also nice as well and very accommodating. I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you need for just one night”
Reviews.Author: sharksfansd
Reviews.Content: This was a very last minute reservation, as I was stuck in LA and could not get a flight to my final destination until the next day. The hotel is quite dated and the room even more so. With that being said, I was happy that the bed was a Sleep Number bed, so getting that great night sleep was no problem at all. It helped for the hectic day at LAX the next morning as well. The hotel is right next to the airport and a free shuttle runs every 15 min or so during peak hours to get you to and from. This is not a place to stay if you are planning a LA/Southern California visit, but go for this property if you need a last minute room for a night at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: canadianbelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. The shuttle service was convenient. We enjoyed taking the trolley ($3 round trip) to see some of the local sights. Too bad we didn't have more time, or we would have liked to get off at more of the stops. The room was clean and served it's purpose for the night (although it could use a little TLC). The staff was friendly and helpful, especially one of the housekeeping staff. We were about to board the cruise ship when I realized that I had forgotten my jacket in the room. I called the hotel once we got on the ship and the wonderful employee gave me his e-mail to contact him. We e-mailed back and forth a couple of times during the week, and arranged for my jacket to be put on the airport shuttle so I didn't have to return back to the hotel. It was truely superb customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you have to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Zorro98
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal there. It's a bit faded, clean with the exception of the dirty vents on the HVAC. My room had a great view of the airport and there wasn't much airport noise. They've got a large outdoor heated pool, great for lap swimming. The lobby bar was OK. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “We used this hotel as a rest between...”
Reviews.Author: Elliemacmac
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a rest between southeast Asia and a flight home. It is fortunate we were asleep most of the time! Wallpaper peeling, air vents not properly attached, no door on closet, bathroom looks like either a college dorm or a prison. Ok for just sleeping but if you are looking for somewhere to enjoy, keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “An overnight stay convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Gomac
Reviews.Content: I had to spend a night close to LAX for a flight the next day. We have stayed at the Radisson LAX before but that was because they have the 7 day sleep and fly. This time I only needed a bed. I booked on Expedia and got what I felt was a decent price. The shuttle from LAX is shared with the Crown Plaza and was packed but it was 10 in the morning on a Monday. It had been 2 years since we last stayed and my general impression this time was it was looking tired. I didn't expect to be able to get into a room for hours and was greatly impressed and pleased when the deskclerk-her name was Betsy- said she could check me in! That was quite a surprise. I had a basic no smoking room with a double bed. Again the room looked tired and had a Motel 6 feeling. The furniture was dinged, the bathroom didn't have the normal 2 bars of soap...just one. There were no glasses in the bathroom and just one in the armoir. Some of the wallpaper was torn. I guess shabby describes it best. It is need of a rehab. It appears they are economizing a lot. However the room was super quiet and overlooked the airport and the sheets were clean. I ate lunch in the restaurant, again it appeared they were economizing and the room was pretty much empty. In the morning I had a bagel and coffee in the bar and the staff there was quite friendly. If I had to stay near LAX again I would probably pick another hotel, as there are several to pick from, especially if I didn't need the sleep and fly.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little TLC...”
Reviews.Author: Olaysha
Reviews.Content: This was not a bad place based on what I paid via bidding on Priceline. I would not pay the regular rate to stay here more than one night. I was there for several nights. Lobby was clean but I did not explore any other areas of the hotel other than my room. Room was adequately clean but there are lots of things that simply need sprucing up to take this hotel from just good for one night to a great place to stay. For instance, there was tile in the shower - time for an update. Crunchy towels - improve laundry methods. Little things that are merely a nuisance but keep you from giving this place a great review. The only available parking was valet parking. They were quick and reasonably courteous but I'd like the option to self park. I was told the parking was under construction. I'm not sure why others had to pay for their wireless connection. I used my laptop with their free wi-fi connection during my entire stay. There are 2 options for wifi - a free, slower connection ( good for surfing, checking email, etc.). And a paid, fast connection for quicker downloads and uploads. I actually posted pictures to Facebook via the slow connection. It took a while but it worked and I did not have to pay. Overall, this hotel would get a B- from me. Sometimes the staff was accomodating and sometimes they completely ignored my prescense. The roms are adequate but for a lenghty stay I would have preferred something along the lines of a Marriott. Housekeeping needs to take a little extra care with this one and some minor renovations would not hurt.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: millon9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a single overnight. It's very close to the airport, with shuttle service. I didn't use the shuttle service as a friend picked me up, according to him the traffic holds up the shuttle at LAX, which is understandable. Lobby is very nice, great view if you have the right room. LAX sign is literally next to the hotel and visible out the windows on the even number side, better if your in the rooms under 40 (440, 540, etc..). Shuttle is timely and does a pretty good job at getting around the crazy drivers at the airport. Rooms were a bit snug, however nice and clean. AC didn't work well, actually at all, but it kept the room around 72 or 74, a bit warm for my sleeping taste. Airport noise is not an issue, I could only hear planes when I was actually listening for them and I was on the 8th floor facing the airport. Only about 15 mins from Hermosa Beach, which by the way I recommend the Lighthouse bar, good atmosphere and live music, with very low priced draft beers (Bud light was 3 bucks). Get the breakfast buffet not the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “On your own”
Reviews.Author: beverltpence
Reviews.Content: I booked an overnight at LAX Radisson, for our return from Fiji. Feb 14, we arrived around 1pm after a long flight, we could not check in it was too early. They told us we could sit in the lobby and wait. One of the employees suggested we might want to get on the trolley and go to the beach, have lunch. He gave us a schedule we went out to wait for the trolley. The schedule time and the arrival time of the trolley was about 40+minutes different. We waited, not having anything else to do. Had a great meal returned to the hotel about 4pm. We collected our luggage from the front desk, they placed it on a dolley and had the nerve to ask if we could get it, or "do you need any help". By this time I was ready to go to my room and collapse, and I wasn't about to tip anyone for their help at this point. Next time I will go for the trip straight home forget the overnight to relax. I thought the room was nice but the service was so poor it overshadowed everything else. BGP

Reviews.Title: “Will never visit again”
Reviews.Author: MrsTaylor1980
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was rude and stuffy. We asked for a room facing North and twice was put facing south. The desk staff proceeded to argue with me and it took a very nice bellman to tell the desk which room to put us in. We chose this hotel for 3 reasons, #1 was to view the plane when they were in air (facing north), #2 was to soak in the hot tub and watch the planes and #3 was to be in the lounge at the Top of the Radisson. Well, the spa looked as though it had been in a fierce storm and left abandoned for MONTHS, and the lounge had been closed according to management for 8+ months. NONE of this was told to me at time of reservation. For the $150 I spent for the first night of my trip, I would have had better service at a Motel 6. At least there they have a SPA. The only good thing there was the Palmira restautrant. It was great and service superb! Do not stay here if you are wanting to use any of the 'extras' like the spa or lounge. And do not expect accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: melnatl
Reviews.Content: Radisson has improved with sleep number beds but that is about it. This hotel does offer free internet wireless and 24 hour room service. My room still needed work especially in the bathroom. It was clean but bathtub was peeling and there was a missing part at the bottom of a toilet. Floor lamp switch was damaged and there was part of the ceiling tile that needed to be replaced. If given the choice, I would not stay here. Booked here due to funeral for family member so I had to remember why I was there. Overall just good for a nite.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and great location”
Reviews.Author: Ojodepescado
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be excellent and very accomodating upon check in. You can't beat the location and proximitey to the airport. This hotel is walking distance to Westchester which offers dining and shopping centers if you want to avoid paying a fortune at the hotel bar and restaurants. Overall a good value around $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: PITMASTER
Reviews.Content: To start off they screwed up the reservation, which then took over a hr to fix. Finally get a room, and the room is descent. But of all the nice hotels I have stayed at this one is by far the WORST one ever. My issues are the beds are horrible and wore out and springy, NO HOT WATER (took hrs for them to fix the issue). Small TV with 10 channels that are free. No mini fridge option! Room service prices are just unbelieveable, let alone the restraunt prices alone were bad enough and the food was OK. I have stayed at the Marriot just cross the street before and I really enjoyed it there. I do NOT recommend anyone staying here!!!!!!! Stay at your own risk. ALSO - the wireless internet never works or works properly. Need to upgrade to a "N" router.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a stop over at LAX - Hotwire Deal”
Reviews.Author: MrsC333
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stop over in LA before leaving the next morning for San Fran. I booked the hotel through Hotwire and got a good deal, with a free shuttle bus from & to the Airport, and a clean room we were satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night if you have an hotwire deal”
Reviews.Author: juliancarax31
Reviews.Content: Pros : - location of course, right at the airport - very clean - you almost don't hear the planes which is amazing since you can see them from the window.
