Cons : - Not a surprise but the area around the airport sucks, good for one night but not more - no self parking available when we were there (beginning of January). Had to pay valet or park in another private parking at the corner. - no fridge in the room - I could hear the people from the other room talking and could understand half of the words... Really bad sound isolation between the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room, illogical cost cuts”
Reviews.Author: LALynnie
Reviews.Content: 2x a year, I make an overnight pitstop at an LAX hotel when I fly from the East Coast to spend a week in Palm Springs. As a regular business traveler, I ask the standard 3 things from an airport-based hotel vs a city, business or resort one: simply put, a decent room, functioning equipment in that room and efficient staff. Spa services, attempted fancy steakhouses and such are irrelevant when the purpose is inevitably just crashing after, or before, air travel. On this trip, my older parents also from the East were joining me in the desert. I usually stay at the LAX Marriott but since its rates were suddenly crazy high and the Radisson was reasonable, the 3 of us booked at the latter for 1 night - two rooms, different names. My flight wound up 3 hours late and was difficult; when I arrived at 8:30pm, all I wanted was a room, food, some TV and a chance to get myself together before I left at 7am the next day. Since my former employer had a corporate arrangement with Radisson, I am familiar with their strengths (some) and weaknesses (many). Here's what i experienced: --I believe I was given the missing room from "The Shining." It was missing a large piece of art from the wall - I know this because there was a print hanging over 1 of the 2 beds and 2 large hooks and a blank space over the other. It had a large floor lamp meant to solely light 1/2 the room, specifically where my luggage was meant to be unpacked - which had a burned out bulb in it. The TV had no reception whatsoever. The standard coffee machine was missing. I spent the first hour of my time there dealing with the front desk (when they stopped putting me on hold), housekeeping and the engineers to get these basics. Even with the engineer working on the TV and getting a picture, it came in and out throughout the rest of my stay. (I work in TV so having a functioning one is a basic necessity to me.) I also called the desk to advise them that I had a room with missing framed art, so they didn't accuse me of taking it. The woman I spoke to couldn't dismiss me fast enough. --It's understandable that the hotel has had to cut costs due to the economy. So face washcloths are gone, pens are gone. OK, no problem. But no bathmat for stepping on out of the shower and no rubber shower mat (or nothing attached to the tub floor to prevent slipping)? I had 80-year-old parents with me and I worried about them slipping in the tub. H-ll, I was worried about me slipping in the tub. This might be a cost savings but it's also an insurance risk. --Bookings were all screwed up. While that's normally just a headache to work out, it became extremely problematic when I tried to leave messages for my parents about my flight delay, to tell them to have dinner early without me. For some inexplicable reason, the hotel put both reservations under my name - despite the fact these reservations were booked separately and our confirmation paperwork showed the distinction. I finally instructed the very confused operator just to leave the same message on both rooms so they would be covered with whichever room they were given when they checked in. My parents received no message so they waited. --Let me offer a few good things. While the hotel is probably the closest on that strip to the airport (a plus) and right on a busy road, it's well-soundproofed on the outside. Not so much on the inside; noise carried from the hall including some very loud partiers at 2am. Room service was solid - decent selection, fast service, nice staff - and that's fairly consistent at all Radissons. Ask for a room facing the airport and you'll be entertained by the gorgeous outdoor artwork (giant pillars of changing lights) that greet arrivals at LAX. But there is a general lack of good management at Radissons. With probably 20-30 visits at various Radisson hotels over the past decade, mostly in the west, they are always just a big off: rooms are often missing basics, burned out lightbulbs and dead batteries in tv remote controls are frequent, standard things are not there. two days into a weeklong stay at a Radisson, the housekeeper amazingly threw out my hardcover book on my nightstand...then when I asked them to check their trash area (which turned up nothing) and then reimburse me, they accused me of lying about the book's existence. A few times when I travelled under the corporate arrangement, I found welcome gifts from the manager(s) in the room upon arrival: the fruit plate left for me once had mostly overripe mushy fruit, and when I was sent a bottle of wine the 2-part corkscrew that came with it had only 1 part. These are all symptoms of poor oversight and lack of accountability by staff. So while the Radisson LAX room was clean and the room service was decent, it required more work than should be needed by a guest staying there for a one-nighter. When I'm headed back in a few months, I'll go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good in general, but beware of the so-called Express Check-In”
Reviews.Author: kelly_xan
Reviews.Content: In general, this was a very nice hotel with all the amenities at less than half the price of the surrounding hotels. It was extremely quiet considering I was right next to the airport. It was just a 5-minute walk to the farthest terminal. Very convenient, clean, and affordable. So basically a good experience, BUT: I had checked in online the day before, and printed out my "express check-in" confirmation page. When I finally made it to the front of the line at the concierge desk (where your room key is supposed to be waiting for you if you use this service), he curtly said, "No, it's not here," and pointed me to the very long line at the regular check-in counter. I said that the whole point of using the express check-in was to avoid that experience. He snapped, "There's a difference between 'express check-in' and 'express yourself'", at which point I simply pointed to the "Express Yourself" sign right above his head that matched my confirmation paperwork exactly. He then grumbled and took me to the front of the regular line. Not a good start. Then, on my first day, housekeeping never showed up. I left the sign on the door when I went out at 2:30 pm, but they never came. Calls to housekeeping that night (well, it was New Year's Eve, so...) went unanswered. I did leave them a note and the next day they left me twice as much of everything, so that was nice. I had planned before arrival to spend New Year's Eve at the "Top of the Radisson" lounge, which sounded very nice on the hotel website. There was also a fun page dedicated to it in the guest book in my room. However, it no longer exists! Don't know how long that's been the case, but they should have yanked the advertising. By the way, the Internet access in the Business Center is $6.95 for 15 minutes. Sorry to be such a Debbie Downer, but I wish someone had warned me about all these issues!

Reviews.Title: “A very good alternative for an overnight stay at airport”
Reviews.Author: SouvenirBrussels
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel and ease of access to the airport by complimentary shuttle, yet simple straight drive right downtown. Nice, large and clean rooms. Friendly staff. Bed very comfortable. Shuttle outside the door takes you directly to Manhattan Beach + 2 different shopping areas ($3 return). Slightly worn down. Undergoing refurbishment which accounted for lift problems and closure of penthouse bar/restaurant. Internet/computer cost 7 US dollars per 15 minutes. Concierge not always available. Fitness center very simple.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take your family”
Reviews.Author: coldcanadian58
Reviews.Content: Do NOT take your children here. It claims to be for families but there is no family channels on the television. It will be a long night of entertaining the kids if you want a quiet night in, like we did. You have to pay for any kids shows $2.99 (a one time viewing).

Reviews.Title: “Not a good start”
Reviews.Author: Blackcat2york
Reviews.Content: Things didn't start off very well on our one night stay here, although the room rate was good value. First of all American Airlines lost my luggage on a short trip from San Francisco to LA. Then when we caught the Radisson shuttle bus to the hotel we discovered that it was taking us to Culver City Radisson. So once there we had to come all the way back. Then at the hotel there were two check-in staff (at around 7.30pm) dealing with queues of around twenty people each. After a long wait we got to our room. The bedroom was fine and there were good views of the aircraft landing, but the bathroom was very small for a hotel of this class. It was all clean and comfortable and the bar was convenient for drinks and reasonsbly priced meals, although the rstaurant was exoensive -we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the airport but not without its problems”
Reviews.Author: sueandpauluk
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is comfortable, the rooms fine but my main criticism would be that despite being virtually on the runway, the free bus we waited for was full and by the time we ordered a cab, the second bus arriving was also full. Rooms good, bed exceptionally comfortable, but wireless internet came at a small fee (stingy) and the restaurants were a bit pricey, so we went next door to the Marriott. I get the impression the hotel is a victim of its own success - vastly over crowded and long queues to check in. I'd probably book the Marriott next time, which is 30 seconds walk away but much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “The location more than makes up for the downsides”
Reviews.Author: korokoro
Reviews.Content: Five minutes walk to Terminal One. That pretty much sums up the big advantage of the hotel. The price is good, and the rooms amazingly quiet since they are practically on the runway. The internet was free too. The rooms are OK and the service truly awful; the reception area is woefully understaffed for the surges in arrivals and departures. But for sheer convenience ... can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BagusAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this hotel, great location (could walk to the airport/ departure), friendly staff.(reception) Only valid parking is too expensive (usd.22 per day). The rooms are excellent with great beds (adjustable to soft/hard with a button). Quiet rooms even so close to the airport. There was a party on the higher floors (100-200 people) with loud music , screaming people and full elevators. Had to wait for 30 min. to get the elevator ! Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and friendly. Overnight parking is expensive but if you check out the streets behind the hotel you wll find free parking. Rooms are nice, very clean, and soundproof, they have double windows which keep out the airport noise. There is free internet acess in the rooms. The hotel is the closest to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD OVERNIGHT STOP”
Reviews.Author: AussieMarzy
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Australia approx 5.30pm into LAX airport and after a 14.5 hour flight we were looking forward to a nice evening snack, then bed., We had no problems picking up the shuttle bus outside the terminal and after about 15 mins we pulled up outside The Radisson. Check in was very smooth (we had booked over the Internet on their site). Our room was on one of the top floors and although we overlooked the end of the Airport we could only hear the occassional dull roar (obviously planes taking off). It didnt disturb us though. We decided to check out the restaurant downstairs but found the meals a little expensive so went to their sports bar to check out their "snack menu". As we had our 14 year old with us they wouldnt let us sit and eat in there but explained if we went back to the restaurant there was actually a sit down area near their bar in there and we would be able to order from the snack menu in there,. That was a great find, meals much more reasonable and plenty of choices. Service was reasonably fast. We ate breakfast in the restaurant the next morning prior to our 9.00am flight, but, be aware that service is very much a restaurant standard, therefore we found ourselves running very late to the airport. In restrospect, we would of been better off checking out earlier, going to the Airport via shuttle, checking bags in etc then eating in the Airport. OVerall our experience was a good one and we will definately stay there again for an overnight stop.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out Bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: dip1012
Reviews.Content: When I stayed in that hotel from Jul 23- Jul 25, I saw a lot of bugs crawling in the beds. Hotel staffs said that they were just ordinary bugs, which later turned out "bed bugs." We had to suffer 10 days due to them, entirely ruining our summer vacation. To my complaint, so-called front desk manager sent me an e-mail with "private apology."

Reviews.Title: “Parking RIP-OFF”
Reviews.Author: kellrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night and had to pay $20.00 to park. Nobody ever told us we would have to pay to stay. No parking available. Only valet! Plus, hotel room was dirty and had not been supplied with basics such as: soap or towels.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself the trouble and stay somewhere else !”
Reviews.Author: nellca
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I don’t really have many good things to say about this place expect that the staff were great and friendly. Even though we were staying here for only one night, it was a very uncomfortable night. We paid about $ 80 US for the room, we thought that was ok. Yeah, well it was not. As soon as we walked into the room it gave out a horrible smell. We thought there was old food left in the room as it smelt like something was rotting. We looked everywhere, cupboards, drawers, Bathroom EVERYWHERE. We didn’t find a thing. We had about 24 hours of travel behind us and had not eaten in almost 20 hours so we really didn’t want to wait to get another room. We decided to just get some food and go to sleep. We had another 12 hours of travel the next day. We got changed, had a shower and walked down to get some food. What a shock. The restaurant food is so expensive. Entrées started at 15 USD. Crazy. Main Meals were anywhere from 25-45 USD. We asked at reception and were told that there was another restaurant on one of the higher floors but it was more expensive than the one we were just looking at. I cannot imagine how much more expensive, we just went back to our room and ordered room service. We called down to order, the gentleman taking the order was very nice however he did advise the meal may take 45minutes up to an hour !!!!! Pretty crazy to be honest. But we just said fine. 50 minutes later we got our food and were told the food may be a little cold as the lift’s were not working and only one was in operation so it took the guy a while to get up with the food. Ok we understand the lift is not the guys issue, but the cold food was his issue. I found it pretty wrong that they would openly bring you cold food and admit it and charge you full price and expect a tip !!!!!!! Not on. Keeping in mind that by this stage we had not eaten for about 21 hours and when we asked how long before we could get HOT food, we were told 45 minutes to an hour. At that point I just laughed and ate my cold burger and fries. Unfortunately , during the night the air con broke down. All of a sudden our room was a sauna. It woke both myself and my partner up and we did everything we could to try and turn it back on but it jus didn’t work. It was 3am and we had to get up at 8am we just tried to go back to sleep but it was almost impossible. Unfortunately It was a very bad stay. For 80USD a night, it was just poor. When we got home I received an email asking to rate the hotel and give any feedback. I wrote what I wrote on here and got a standard generic email stating : we are sorry for the inconvenience. Well Radisson, so are we.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay again”
Reviews.Author: Grey28
Reviews.Content: Traveled with two young kids, and booked/prepaid a double bed room a month in advance through Hotwire. Upon arrival was told that my reservation went through as 'single bed'. I showed the front desk person the printed reservation, but was told that it did not matter, as there were availability for a room with two beds. The manager was rude, and told me they would gladly help me to carry my luggage back outside if I do not take the offered room with one bed. I had no choice, as it was close to midnight. When I called customer service to complaint, they told me that according to front desk, "double rooms were available, but the customer requested to change to a single room". Will never set my foot there again.

Reviews.Title: “For $59, quite a find”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: Under renovation, I was able to get a $59 rate. Rooms nice, but need the renovation, breakfast buffet quite good. Quiet, pool alittle bit out of the way but nice. Right across from Terminal one. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: travellerJack
Reviews.Content: I spent a night here between flights. Location is perfect, this must be the closest hotel to the airport. No problem with noise. Check in staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel looks tired, and my room was you run-of-the-mill chain room with nothing special in it. The bed was very comfortable (I'm number 100!) and reasonably clean, and I had a good night's sleep. Free wireless internet. That's basically what you ask from an airport hotel, I suppose. Booked through Priceline for less than $50, I thought it was good value. I wouldn't pay the hotel rates, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: doritam1
Reviews.Content: Arrived a day late as we got stuck in Chicago due to waether. We got the rate from Priceline so it is non-refundable. Doresn't matter. Check in was super fast, super friensdly. The rooms are fairly big, clean and quiet. . Free internet access is such a treat and the Organic coffee in the rooms are quite good No mini bar or fridge - but can't say it mattered to us. Located conveniently close to airport. Overall - would have no problem staying here again and definately recommend for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Short 6 Hours Stay”
Reviews.Author: piggipiggy
Reviews.Content: I can't say too much about this hotel as I only stayed here for 6 hours. It was just a place to crash. For the price we got on priceline for $45/night it was decent enough. We were able to find free street parking about 2 blocks from the hotel. I checked in close to midnight and there was a line to check in. The airport shuttle runs every 15 min 24 hours. It was a convenient way to send my sister in law off to the airport at the crack of dawn. I think it's fine for a transit stay at LAX but it has seen better days. The carpet felt really old and the bath tub was chipping off. All in all, it was fine for a short stay like mine.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for us, but parking is limited”
Reviews.Author: Paul113
Reviews.Content: Perfectly fine airport hotel, but a top tip is pick your hire car up after spending the night here or drop it off before checking in because parking is extremely limited. They could make more of their 'sky lounge' on top floor. Helpful check-in staff.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: shoogal
Reviews.Content: Beware travelers. I stayed at the Radisson LAX on 19 July 2009 with my teenage daughter and toddler. We were traveling from Australia, had a lot of luggage, and were very tired when we arrived. Despite standing there watching us struggle with all our beholongings, the bellboy wouldn't assist us with our luggage until AFTER we checked in and then loitered in our room expecting a tip! Only one of the four elevators were operational (which means there is always a line to get in one - not fun if you are traveling with children in strollers!), the room phone didn't work, and the front desk sent us on a wild goose chase to borrow a scissors when they had one right there at the front desk all along! Our room was musty and smelled like cigars, but the sheets were clean. The towels were threadbare and the water pressure was disappointing, but tolerable. Overall, I'd spend a couple extra bucks to stay at a nicer place. This place is truly a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: stosie
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was literally a 5 minute walk from the airport terminal although it did also have a free shuttle bus. It would be a great base for anyone needing to catch a flight but we also used it to see the city. From the airport there was a free shuttle to the metro (about 10 mins) and from there you could get in to downtown LA very easily. I think it took us about 45 mins door to door, which isn't ideal but for students on a budget it was ideal especially considering the price. We got a good deal on expedia and paid less than half what we would have done in central LA. The hotel was very clean and the beds were comfortable. There was a pool but I can't really comment on it as we were too busy sight seeing. I needed to print some tickets while I was there and the concierge did this for me with no problems and I found all the staff to be very efficient. I didn't eat at the hotel as we mostly ate in LA or at the nearby subway. All in all I found this to be of much better quality than I expected. For the price I was expecting something similar to travel lodge in the UK but the rooms were much bigger and there were more amenities. The best was conditioner in the bathroom, which most hotels seem to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I only stayed one night...”
Reviews.Author: holidaymum41
Reviews.Content: Well as the title says I'm glad I only stayed one night! Having just spent 2 weeks at a 2 star hotel/motel in Camarillo I thought we'd have a night in a 4 star prior to our flight home.... dissappointing. Plus points Cheap Close to LAX (VERY CLOSE!) Free shuttle bus to airport free ice Minus points only cardboard coffee cups poor TV selection - no kids channels Pool closed at night (despite advertised as open til 10pm - no lights out there at 8.30pm) Penthouse bar closed Building works taking place, one elevator out of use, another broke while we were in it! Can't check in until 3pm and need to check out at 12noon No self parking - Valet only and very expensive! noisy trendy electric beds not working properly no breakfast included, and breakfast times very restrictive so overall it was fine for a night if you need to catch a flight, or you've arrived late in LA but I wouldn't stay there for a holiday or even a business weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Worth what you pay if you get a great deal on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: jodi06
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights in July before flying home to Australia. We only stayed one night but paid for the extra night so we could stay in the room until 8.00pm as we had a 11.45 flight. When we check in was ok , I had emailed a request for a fridge in the room months before the stay and is wasn't done so I said not to worry as it would take a while to chill etc. and the room was basic and clean. Only one of the six elevators worked which is just ridiculous in an airport hotel. There was no concierge on duty the first day so I asked the valet parking lady for help and she gave a great directions to restaurants etc down the road. We couldn't access the internet and I went down to check in and they said that they would send someone up - guess what we never saw anyone. The second day we caught the bus from just around teh corner to Santa Monica Pier. There is a free shuttle, coming from the airport is it a hike and you are dropped off after the Crowne Plaza people, but to the airport it is a quick trip. If I had paid the price on their website I would have felt ripped off, but with a Hotwire rate I got exactly what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be GOING HOME!”
Reviews.Author: jetbarginsetter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both stayed at a Radisson for our Honeymoon a while back. So when we had an early flight back home to AZ we decided to book a night at the Radisson LAX. We got a discount rate through a booking site (and I'm glad we didn't pay full price for the sub-par quality). Check in went well, however our room was musty and humid even with the air conditioner on for an hour, after calling the front desk 3 times and waiting an hour we were moved to another room, which had hair on the bed, and "crusted stains" on the bed spread. GROSS! At this point we were tempted to call Southwest and get a flight out that night! We called again and were given new keys by a bellman, the manager wasn't at any of the room changing to "investigate" any of our complaints. We're now in room # 3 which is still "damp" feeling. The switch to the AC was broken off so we had to use a pen/hanger to push the button, wall paper is peeling in bathroom, vents are filthy, and wall plates for light switch are broken off in parts. This was all topped off by the horrible service in the lounge which we requested our check 3 times, and waited 20 minutes total to get finally. I've literally stayed at MOTELS that were nicer. I think the "discount rate" was still too much for the quality or lack of quality at this hotel. It's definitely left a bad taste in our mouths and I feel sorry for those who are tired from traveling and paid full price for the quality they receive. We will not stay at a radisson again. PS You'd think after the SAME COMPLAINTS all over the reviews things would CHANGE! Also we are a fairly young couple so we're pretty flexible when it comes to travel, but we were both very upset about the service that was provided at the Radisson LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Purpose: Served”
Reviews.Author: thetakeover
Reviews.Content: Living about an hour and a half out of Los Angeles, we booked a room at the Raddison because we had plans in the city on a Saturday night, and again on the next Sunday morning. Not having to drive back and forth was worth the stay regardless, but make no mistake, this is primarily a business-type of hotel. Upon arriving, the parking lot was under construction and valet was the only option for hotel parking. Being the starving college students that we are, we opted to park in a near-by lot for airport parking, which worked just fine. Check-in was a breeze. The staff was very friendly and we were allowed into our room a good 45 minutes before the listed check-in time of 3pm. The Saturday we were there was also Final Four day, and we had allotted time to watch both games in the room before going on with our evening. The television reception of CBS 2 was tolerable at best, but thankfully, with the hotel's free internet, we were able to watch both games in high-definition on my laptop. Our plans for the night in Culver City got canceled, so we were left with the frenzied task of finding something to do in the area without a car (parking lot charged more for ins-and-outs). This is no knock on the hotel itself, but there isn't much to do in terms of nightlife in the general vicinity, and that wouldn't be a problem for most guests of the hotel. We opted for a little bit of a cultural experience and wandered LAX for a few hours topping it off with a late dinner at the McDonalds in the international terminal. A real fun experience, to be completely honest. We got back to the hotel around midnight and the lobby was empty. Almost creepy. Again, that comes with the turf. Looking back, The Custom hotel a few miles north would have been a better option had we known our plans were scrapped. PROS - Nice, modern rooms with super comfortable beds and good air conditioning. The view was also great. We requested a runway view and got quite a bit of amusement out of that. The two double bed set-up didn't feel nearly as cramped as i've experienced in other hotels. The biggest pro, hands down, was the sound-proofing of the place. The double-pane windows let NO sound in whatsoever even though planes were coming in constantly a few hundred yards from our room. CONS - The elevator system was laggy and confusing at times. This may have been fixed by now. Also, out of boredom, we tried to locate the stairwell. found one, but it was downright creepy. rusty pipes, dark, and odd stains and splatters on the walls. Again, nothing that was too big of a deal, and the hotel was/is going under construction. One more thing was the pool area. Because of it's vicinity to the airport as well as Sepulveda blvd, the pool and spa area was very noisy (nothing anyone can do about that, obviously), but when we arrived, there was nobody out there midday on a Saturday. That, combined with the 70s, horror film architecture of the pool area and the imposing Eastern-European looking office building in the background, turned us off from taking a dip. Overall, though... it's a great hotel for anyone traveling in or out of LAX... especially the closeness to the airport, the quiet rooms, and great prices. Had our trip gone as planned, the Radisson would have catered to our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jules025
Reviews.Content: The shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel was very convenient. We were able to do a early check-in after a long flight from Aust. The room in general is pretty good, but just looks old. Although it is near the airport, there weren't a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Hootsmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of an early flight home. Check in was easy. We had paid for breakfast, but were leaving before 6am, when breakfast started... luckily when we pressed the issue we were given a voucher to contact room service for a continental breakfast, which we did. Room on 11th floor was lovely, clean and well kept, altho outside windows were pretty dirty. (But who cleans outside windows on the 11th floor?!!) View towards LA included flight path of planes landing - thrilling to watch as we were higher than them as they passed by, and yet triple glazing did a great job. Sleep number beds provided much entertainment!!! We were so looking forward to having a drink in the bar at the top of the hotel, but when we took the lift up, it was closed. There seems to be construction going on, but there were no signs saying it was closed. Very disappointing. We walked along to the LAX Marriott for dinner in the sports bar, as we found the grill in the Radisson a itttle expensive for us by the end of the holiday, but a farewell drink in the Radisson's lobby bar was very nice, good atmosphere. Check out was quiet at 6am, but they tried to charge me for room service breakfast until I explained we'd had vouchers. As it's so close to LAX it seems to be the courtesy shuttle's final stop, meaning that the first shuttle was too full to take us to the airport. But because of the number of people waiting, the driver radioed ahead and within minutes had an empty bus pick us all up.

Reviews.Title: “Hate queuing”
Reviews.Author: fmc208
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel mainly on price and closeness to LAX. The hotel had one quenue for booking in and booking out. So hopefully you are not behind a tour group. There are no safe deposits in the room - so we asked the gentleman behind the desk to use their safe deposits by reception. The clerk was unable to operate the keys to give us access to the boxes - so we had to carry passports, money etc with us all the time. The hotel itself seems to be low on maintenance and upkeep which is sad for a Radisson. Parking is a problem here - so the only way around this is to pay for Valet parking which is definitely worth it - as everytime we came back the hotel parking was totally full.

Reviews.Title: “shuttle from lax, but outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: breephd
Reviews.Content: basically, if you are doing a lay-over (as we were), it's tolerable. but, if you are staying a few days, try crowne plaza hotel or elsewhere. this hotel is in need of tlc. the staff is one that seems very comfortable in their jobs and they are there everyday, and you are not. so, they treat you as a short term guest and they do not care to improve. meanwhile rome crumbles. that is to say, this hotel is in serious need of repair. it seems that they spent all the money on the lobby, b/c the lobby looks great, but the rooms are falling a part. i guess the head office must have some program that figures out when it needs to upgrade things, maybe like a ten year plan. so this hotel is on year 8 or 9, and it is falling apart. for example, in our room, the themrostat on/off button was compeltely missing. and the shower faucet was ancient. the hot and cold were reversed (difficult to discover at 10pm after a long flight and very tired). the concierge and housekeeping never answered the phone - tried 9:45pm to 10:15pm. no answer. mold on walls. drapes with many stains. i kept a list of items, got to number 11, then gave up. i filled out their survey and told them i had this list - but they wrote a form letter reply saying "thanks for your input" we hope to do better next time. BUT, they never asked for my detailed list of items that i wrote. so, do you think they want to improve? NO. they got the location, and they know it. so they're milking the shuttle from the airport and letting things fall apart.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you should get for $80 a night”
Reviews.Author: kritch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a stopover in LA for two nights. everyone we encountered were super helpful, from the valet to the guy at the front desk. we had only booked one night but when we turned up at 7am without a reservation they booked us straight in at the cheap rate we got on the web. very good! pool was adequate, clean and refreshing after a 14 hr trip from Australia. Rooms clean and comfortable. TV was not working but we were only in our room one night so we didn't care. 10 minute walk to the airport. super convenient. would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Silke_1
Reviews.Content: After a long vacation in CA, we ended our trip in this hotel. We brought bach the rental car and went to our room. Great things: Big rooms, heated pool, quiet rooms, friendly staff Bad things: They had forgotten to check us in at the front desk. In the morning we weren't in the computer and the receptionist could not find the reservation. The restaurants are expensive. There was no room service menu of general information folio in the room and it took forever before we received a room service menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but not great”
Reviews.Author: jgr83
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in June. Found a wet towel in our room´s floor as we walked in. Large room, worn out bathroom. The restaurant is expensive and not great. The valet service is quick, but expensive at $20 per day. We were driving the city all day, and this we used just to power nap, so it did the job. HAving researched hotels in LA, this is good value for money. Decent hotel, but not great - and don´t worry about the plane noise, there isn´t any.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location. nice, modern, and clean”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3333333
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the start and end of a California vacation! Right by the airport. Great inside!

Reviews.Title: “multiple room problems and no effort to resolve them”
Reviews.Author: fbullo
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel in early June 2009. First small negative detail: I called ahead of time and was misinformed about the parking rates (it turns out the rate is $20/night instead of the $12/night I was told). Once I got to my room, the television did not turn on and, more annoyingly, late in the evening a cold-aid fan started in the restroom and went on all night long. The personnel in the lobby did not offer any serious apology for the problems when I complained about them in the morning. Then, when I waited for the airport shuttle, I was mislead about where to catch it and I lost the first shuttle. Finally, a few days ago, I filled out a feedback form for the Radisson explaining all these problems. I received a template apology email and after I responded with more comments, the return address did not work. Good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel, BUT beware of elevators & parking!”
Reviews.Author: AH1987
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for 3 days with my girlfriend recently. The hotel was fairly clean, the sleep number beds made for an excellent night of sleep, and the overall ambiance of the hotel was not too bad. The water in the shower was cold, however, on our last day which prompted a call to the front desk. PROS: Sleepnumber beds, check in time, maid service, CONS: $20 per day valet (no self parking unless you park in an airport parking garage and pay $12-17), some plane noise, but then again, not so bad. elevator wait times of upto 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, clean, comfortable and reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: imagumby
Reviews.Content: Booked on Agoda.com and cost was $312 for 4 nights so that was a bargain. We arrived at LAX after long flight from Australia and found free shuttle excellent. Efficient and polite staff at checkin and throughout our stay. Room was very nice and very clean and VERY quiet. Great to watch the planes landing and taking off at LAX but not a sound to be heard due to double glazing.No fridge but we purchased cooler box for our driving holiday and used this with free ice from machines at hotel to keep drinks cold. Parking for rental car was not really issue but did cost us $15 a night for full valet parking service. (They do negotiate the $20 per night fee but I was lazy and took the $15 they offered). No breakfast included was a negative but we worked around it. I will definately stay there on returning to LA before flying back to Oz. This one has a touch of class and we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated - poor service - tobacco smells - poor value”
Reviews.Author: MDavidsonSydney
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked a non smoking room for 3 adults, but the room stunk of stale tobacco, as did the corridors on most floors. After trying 3 other rooms, all resulting in the same stench, management upgraded us to a junior suite a a 'discounted" $199 per night. We could only get a roll-out bed for the third adult. A/C was horrible - either too hot or too cold. Room service was appalling and they add a 20% gratuity to every bill, AND want tips. Three out of the four elevators stopped at EVERY floor. Would not recommend this dump to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult To Rate Due To Construction/Renovation”
Reviews.Author: vinlyn
Reviews.Content: It is difficult, at this time, to rate this hotel. I arrived in a rental car and experienced my first problem -- their parking lot and entrance area was so packed that I had to park on the street. Their parking garage is under construction and not yet available. They apologize. I therefore drove my rental to the drop-off and prepared to call a taxi. The wonderfully friendly people at Hertz said no, they'd be happy to drive me over immediately. Check-in was a bit crazy, too. Believe it or not a Salsa Dance Competition was also arriving and the lobby, front desk, and elevators were all bedlam. They apologize. The room itself was fairly nice. The carpet and walls and furniture were in "okay" condition, the bed extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was good (except for a very noticeably old tub). The television was old and not clear and the cable reception was fair to poor. Internet wi-fi was good, although the higher level of service was for a fee. No room safe, microwave, or fridge. The restaurants in the hotel are expensive. For example, their menu lists a Black Angus Bacon Cheese Burger at $14.95 or a filet mignon at $34.95. And there are no other restaurants close by. I chose to walk over to the Tom Bradley International Terminal at LAX for meals, although the choices were limited, but prices more reasonable. Some hotel features, such as the business center, are not really functioning during renovation, or are on a very limited basis. There are two things that make this hotel exceptional, however. First, customer service. Everyone tried to be extremely helpful. When I needed a letter mailed, it was taken care of for me. The porter was helpful and cheerful. The personnel aimed to please. Second, is location. The hotel is literally within walking distance of LAX airport. I walked over three times to eat and found the walk safe and very do-able. In fact, I saw many airline pilots and stewardesses walking to the hotel with their overnight bags. There are other hotels that are also close to the airport, but the Radisson is the closest.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore LA”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: We wanted a good location to stay in order to see the sights of LA and the Radisson served us well, as it was close to the airport and several car hire places. Valet parking here was expensive and we found out when we got there that was no self parking (it was stll being built!) so worth considering if you have a car. The lobby looked recently refurbished and was pleasant. Service from all the staff was helpful and friendly. Our room was large and clean, if a little dated. After a while, we started to notice the 'ping' of the elevators and a strange rumbling noise, which we worked out was also the elevators creaking. As a light sleeper, I realised this would be a problem, so we went back to recpetion to request a room further from the elevators, which we were given without any problems. Our second room was much smaller, and strangely, most of the pictures on the walls had been removed, leaving the fixtures behind. It was much quieter though, and no noise from the airport due to well insulated if ugly windows. The room was cleaned well, the only problem we had was a persistantly leaking tap. The breakfast buffet was so so, and quite pricy. Overall, I don't have any major complaints about the Radisson, and I would probably stay again, when hopefully, there would be self parking available.

Reviews.Title: “could b better”
Reviews.Author: aucklandflower
Reviews.Content: Very little noise from the planes although the neighbour downstairs played LOUD rock music from 10pm until late, and in the early hours of the morning! Very inconsiderate people! Frequent shuttle and super-close to LAX. Internet - free and works. :-) A little run down with only 2 lifts (which stops randomly at various floors...). Undergoing renovations - so may improve. Rooms are reasonably sized. I would prefer FourPoints LAX compared to Radisson LAX (stayed at both during this trip). Valet parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic one more time!”
Reviews.Author: aussiebuffer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson LAX on many occasions. Yes, it is a heavily trafficked hotel due to its excellent position as the nearest hotel to LAX Airport and therefore it does show some signs of wear and tear from time to time. However, the current Executive Management is totally committed to a customer service initiative which is second to none and recent stays have continued to impress. Raul at the Bell Desk maintains a first class service attitude and nothing is too much trouble. All the other staff show the same positive attitude and the breakfast staff and selections are also first class. Best scrambled eggs in the USA!! My return visits remind me of the warm welcome that use to be common place in American Hotels and under Operation Manager Julio the Radisson LAX staff are doing their best to recreate this old fashion standard. They are not perfect but if you make them aware of the problem it is always fixed quickly. Paul Hughes

Reviews.Title: “Basic one nighter hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iamsuperk
Reviews.Content: I expected more from the Radisson brand. The hotel is pretty run down and has definitely seen better days. Check in was pretty slow, room was bog standard but very tired and bathroom was in dire need of overhaul. There's not much locally either or information at the hotel on where to go for a walk to have drink / food away from the hotel itself. Only good point was a friendly conceierge who helped with suggesting where to go sightseeing for my sole day in LA.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT................”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson LAX on the 5th April, 2009 as I was meeting my son the next day at LAX, after travelling a long way on my own for the first time, I found the complimentry shuttle easily was helped with my bags and driven to the hotel only about 5 mins away. Checked in quickly had a room on the 7th Floor which was large with huge sleep dial bed which was new to me. Windows overlooking the very busy runway with all but no sound due to double glazing. Had a really great sleep after dialling in my prefered mattress numbers......Room was clean, bathroom really well stocked with products and towels, white and soft...When checking out the next morning I had a coffee at the Starbucks cafe in the hotel, and was advised that I need not book out so soon as my checkout wasn't until 12.00NOON, but needed to get to the airport caught shuttle and was taken to the terminal that my son was arriving at and helped off with my bags. Over all a really pleasant first experience in LA. Would definately use the Hotel again, perfect for an overnighter for an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough”
Reviews.Author: Sapphirespook
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport, but not noisey at all. Beds were fantastically comfortable. Staff were unbelievablly helpful with printing a document for me as there was no internet cafe. Shuttle service was excellent, 24 hrs. Couldn't ask for better. Wish my stay had been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: Ok, we missed our nonstop from Fl ,which ended up being 8 hours.Needless to say we were tired and grumpy. this hotel had easy check-in,easygoing staff,and great bedding.The rooms are upscale and price fantastic for under 100.They helped us with our internet. The best thing was the gourmet room service..I ordered onion soup, steak sandwich with fries. The soup was amazing!!.it had no cheese (good for me and the weight) but had a mountainous puff pastry top.it had fennel and leeks! ..totally gourmet ..the steak sandwich was great as well and the fries crispy.After that we were in a good mood! I'll be back as Arnold says.

Reviews.Title: “fine for what its it”
Reviews.Author: trickito
Reviews.Content: this place is a little bit threadbare, seems like half the world was there the saturday night we were. but alas we went to our room and slept and rose very early for a flight. this is a fine place to stay before taking a flight. we picked it only because it shared the location with the Midway rental car company. the rooms were very quiet, they have some incredible double pain window system in place that boggles the mind. there were jets landing right outside our window but we didn't hear a thing. the lobby seems a little bit worn from heavy use, same for the rooms. but they were nice enough, with a nice comfy bed and decent linens. free internet was nice. the bell guy was super nice too. next time i will probably try to priceline a 4* LAX hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Helpless Staff”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: The main problem was a non-working door lock upon checkin which resulted in a comedy(?) of errors and kept me from getting into a room until over an hour after arrival. Because this was probably an isolated incident, I won't go into details and I've tried not to weigh it too heavily in my overall rating. But it did lower my satisfaction level and serves as a potential warning on staff competence. There was also a very large carpet stain in the room I eventually was settled into. I kept my shoes on. Positives: - Excellent exterior sound proofing. The hotel has double wall construction - exactly what you would expect, but often don't find, in an airport hotel. - Excellent temperature controls and performance. - Great location. I turned in my rental car the evening before my flight (ask the shuttle driver to drop you off near the hotel to save going all the way to the airport and back), then walked to Terminal 2 (4 blocks) in the morning. The airport shuttle appeared to work fine, but I saw several flight crews walking like I did. - Excellent value with my company rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and so close to airport”
Reviews.Author: sheebad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights towards the end of a world trip. Staff not the friendliest but location of hotel is great.This is the 2nd time we stayed here. The lifts were being repaired and i think swimming pool was getting remodelled or something. Internet and morning newspaper free of charge which was good. Bed was really comfy , rooms quite large and no airplane noise even though u are looking out over the runway. Rooms are good value and bus to manhattan outside door only 3 dollars

Reviews.Title: “Watch out on Weekends”
Reviews.Author: mainenewengland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and arrived at 1 pm(check in was 3. We were rudely told our rooms would not be ready until 3. Went out by the pool-a short distance from the hotel and the pool was dirty, hot tub was out of commission and filled with brown dirty water.Found out by asking some of the many young adults roaming around that this was the hotel for those going in the coast guard. Every weekend recruits come here for processing. There was only 2 elevators that worked("remodeling")Closest place to get something to eat after 6 was a subway down the street. ON a positive note, this hotel participates in a trolley service that will take you to 3 different areas. It was only $3 roundtrip. We went to Manhattan Beach and walked around the expensive boutiques. The other 2 stops were more traditional mall shops. It was a great day and the best deal we got in California.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast staff”
Reviews.Author: dangerousdave666
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the friendly and efficent service by Jose, Jorge, Martin, Hernandez, Flores and Gutiérrez by the breakfast staff. Check in was average, concierge desk very good.

Reviews.Title: “For us a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sinppu
Reviews.Content: We rented a car and decided to go for an airport hotel in LA. We stayed at the Radisson for two nights. We thought the hotel was excellent value. It's not new or luxurious, but for us a 12th floor king room was more than adequate. Although we could see the landing planes VERY close, there was no noise what so ever! The room was clean and quite spacious. However, for some reason it was not cleaned and the beds were not made up while we were there. We did not really even mind this, but for some it may be more important. The worst part of the hotel are truly the elevators!! They ae being fixed and repaired at the moment, but before they are done, we recommend requesting a low floor... And be careful with the elevator doors!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for LAX stopover”
Reviews.Author: Mysterex
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at the Radisson LAX to stop over before and after long haul flights. We got very good rates through wotif.com. The Hotel is currently being renovated, it looks as if the older rooms are being sold through wotif. The first time we were given an early check in which was fantastic as we had just come off a 12hr flight from New Zealand. The room was your standard hotel room, a bit tired around the edges but we weren't expecting new for the price. Comformtable bed and good room service food. The second time the room was a lot more tired, the bathroom was really small and the air conditioning panel was missing a button so we couldn't adjust the temperature so the room got very stuffy. My usual experience here has been good so I have based my rating more on the first stay.

Reviews.Title: “not so nice staff at the radisson,crap hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladette74
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night at this hotel last october for a day visit to los angeles en-route to vegas.had the most terrible time!booked for a double,non-smoker room and guess what they've given me?a twin,smoking room!Duh!the smell of this hotel!ugh!went back to ask for another room and guess what theyve given me next?a room that hasnt been cleaned yet!when i opened the door,literally,the occupants must've just gone as the ironing board and the flat iron's still in the middle of the room!had to go back down again to change room. by this time, as u could imagine,having had a 3 hour flight,and going up and down the hotel, im really,really,really tired!reason why i've booked an airport hotel!i guess the management cant understand the logic in being an airport hotel!they haven't even apologized for the lack of competence that they have in running hotels and the inconvenience that they've caused and frustrations that their guest suffered having to pay a rip-off amount for such service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel....But....Read on.......”
Reviews.Author: LeeLacey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New Years day after a long flight from Manchester UK. Overall, very pleased with the hotel but very suprised to be charged $218 for an 11 minute phone call. Read on. BOOKING: Booked with Opodo. Please do not book with them. We turned up at the hotel to be told that they did not have the reservation and had not heard of Opodo. The gentleman on reception tried different phone numbers on our reservation sheet but Opodo was closed! However, he was very sympathetic and checked us in to a room. This is something he did not have to do. As a result of this, I cannot thank him enough. I decided to get up at 3.30 am and contact Opodo (time difference). I did not have any change and was not prepard to walk the streets of LA at such a time to look for a shop to get change to use the public phone. As such, I called Opodo from the hotel room. I was informed that they had forgot to pass my reservation on to the hotel. Not good enough! Incidently, Opodo forgot to pass another reservation on to a different hotel. PLEASE DONT BOOK WITH OPODO. LOCATION: the closest hotel to LAX. They operate a free and reliable shuttle. Some other reviews have mentioned that you have to pay for the shuttle. You dont. It's free. ROOM; Big, clean and modern. They appear to have been recently renovated. The pictures on Trip advisor appear to be old ones. The room cannot be faulted and was very comfortable. OVERALL: An excellent 4 star hotel. Closest hotel to LAX. Very friendly hotel with excellent customer service. AND THE BUT: After a good nights sleep and a very pleasent experience, we checked out and were hit with a very hefty $218 charge for the phone call I made to Opodo. This was far too expensive but I suppose I should of checked the charges first. I personally blame Opodo for this and not the hotel! I would reccomend anyone to stay here - just dont use the hotel in room phone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Ritvatuhat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The service really wasn't at the level we're used to expect from Radisson hotels. Especially the concierge staff weren't very helpful. The room was in need of renovation. The elevators didn't work very well - at times there was only one elevator working in the whole hotel... You can surely find better value for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right by LAX”
Reviews.Author: T-Ruckus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my brother. We needed a quick place to stay and they had a pretty good rate. We were a little turned off by the fact that they force you to park in their $20/day valet as their self parking is currently under construction. Of course, there are several other lots in the area, but you have to walk kind of far if you do that. Check in was very easy and the girl at the front was very helpful. Our room was very nice considering the rate. I've stayed at most of the big chains, but never a Radisson before and was pretty impressed. The bedding was so comfy and the furniture was pretty nice as well. I found out that I am not a fan of the sleep number beds, but they are supposed to be great. I just felt like it was either too soft or too hard. I prefer cushy, but with support and I just couldn't find that happy medium. This is just my preference though, so they don't lose points as most people seem to love their sleep number beds. Anyway, it was a very nice, brief stay, but we were very comfortable and satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSkiers
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for its convenience and spent two nights. Accommodation is very comfortable, although decor is dark, and housekeeping is good. We weren't disturbed by aircraft noise. Restaurant facilities are good - 347 does very good steaks. Bar food is also good, as was breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, but no thanks!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingSuperMonkey
Reviews.Content: We waited over an hour for the shuttle. I cold have walked the distance in a few minutes! We arrived at the hotel where I stood in the lobby being ignored at the check-in counter. Apparently the clerk mistakenly thought I was sharing a room with the person I was travelling with--although I was clearly in line. I was disappointed to find that the room reeked of smoke, and the bathroom was really run down. The hotel really needs renovating. Checkout was a disaster because the computers were down. I was told that my receipt would be mailed that afternoon. I waited a week and a half and started calling. Each time was transferred all around the hotel and either someone was out, or they promised they would fax it. Finally I sent a nasty gram to Customer Service on Radisson's website and the situation got resolved--but not before my expense report was submitted really late. Radisson did try to make good once it was reported on the website. If you have issues, don't bother trying to deal with the hotel. My partner's room was charged to someone else's card and it took him forever to fix that as well.

Reviews.Title: “had a great tiime”
Reviews.Author: iheartfriedmacs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here before our am flight to Maui, after his aunt's wedding in san bernardino. Since we are from seattle, we needed a place to stay that was close to the airport just for one night. We weren't expecting luxury but after reading some of the reviews on here we were pleasantly surprised about how NOT bad it was. Sure it was a little outdated but it's not a vacation hotel, its a place to rest before or after a flight. We enjoyed the HUGE olympic style swimming pool (and the sound of the airplanes taking off), the top of the radisson bar, the free shuttle to the airport, and the sleep number beds. If you can ignore that the lighting in the bathroom isnt perfect or that the buttons on the elevator don't light up, etc, then you get what you paid for out of it. We didn't have any problems here and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “was ok”
Reviews.Author: luckymaaa
Reviews.Content: was thinking to have a good deal wit 89$.... room was ok even it was visible that a renewal is needed. Concierge was not so helpful as i forgott to return the 2 rental car key. Fortunatly we could give the key to a rental car bus driver....was expecting more from a hotel like this... but if you have a early connection the location is realy good...

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: YYCTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels but the condition of this hotel was the worst. For the price, the room was not bad, but not clean either. I reserved 3 rooms for my family; 2 kings and 1 room with 2 double beds. When I arrive in the room with double beds it turned out to be a king. Called the front desk who said their computer system said it was a double bed room, but they would send up a cot. Advised I would like to move to another room, which was granted. I also booked a package that included breakfast, but they forgot to give us the vouchers at check-in. I had forgot the room included it until we checked out and so we had to go back to the front desk for a refund to our credit card for the breakfast we purchased. A portion of the receipt was refunded, but the front desk did not notice there was 6 of us, so only refunded half of the $53 check. There is not public parking, only valet for $20 per day and with a back log of guest arriving at the same time, we waited to turn into the entrance for 5 minutes while the valets took each car away in front of us. The bathroom was covered in hair. The air conditioning did not work in one of the rooms and when we called for assistance, no one showed up. The phones seem to be broken because when calling room to room the other party can not hear you. The elevator buttons do not light up when pushed. There were only 2 large towels in the room and no face cloths. The bathtub is only about 1foot high. Great if you are a kid. The only good thing was the sleep number bed and most of the frontline staff was pretty friendly, except the girl answering the front desk phone, however I imagine she is over worked and tired of dealing with all the guest complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: waki
Reviews.Content: Got a special $75 rate. I guess I got what I paid for. Room, bathroom & hallways were very dirty, TV didn't work until a maintainence man worked on it. Close to airport BUT a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBigRed
Reviews.Content: Regardless what rate you can get, do not stay at this dirty and rude hotel. Front office and concierge staff very rude. Room was dirty, bathroom floor was wet from prev guest, and white bed cover had long black hairs all over it. If had been one hair could deal with it but i mean at least a dozen hairs on bed which would lead you to think room was not that clean. When called recept to have complain and have bed remade up was advised that change of staff shift time, and so had to wait two hours for the room to be re done. Amazing when a 24 hour airport hotel. when room re cleaned no phone call or apology from any member of staff. Bathroom was dirty and a sewerage smell. the only thing this prop had going for it was the comp shuttle to LAX, other than that avoid it, crowne plaza and sheraton up road look nice as a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: Jaydee8
Reviews.Content: Perfect location after a 12 hours flight. Shuttle Bus was easy to find at the Hotel Shuttle Transportation area. Shuttle just took a view minutes to arrive. Check in at the Hotel was quick and efficent. Front Desk staff was very friendly and welcomed me very professional. Only the lady at the Concierge desk seemed a little bit annoyed with my question. She must have had a bad day, because everybody else was extrem friendly and nice. Room on the 5th floor was perfect. Good size room with a king bed. Bed was very comfortable and not like most US Hotels had a real blanket not only sheets. Room was clean and furnitures look quite new. The only negative point, the windows have been really dirty. But nevertheless great Airport view and no noise at all. Breakfast Buffet in the morning was excellent. A great variety of fresh fruits and everything else you need for a good start in the morning. Approx 19$ is a reasonable price for a breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “SMOKERS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: 4TH STOOGE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the day before our cruise to mexico. I had booked the room almost 3 month in advance. I had book a smoking room through hotels.com. When we checked in we were informed no smoking rooms were available. They told us that smoking rooms were not guaranteed. We applealed to the manager but were not successful. They suggested we try another hotel. Sure, they already had my money and it was after 6 pm. I also called hotels.com, but they were no help. The room itself was ok, but the employees could have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: MTSF
Reviews.Content: I stayed by LAX because I had to go to Loyola Marymount and the Radisson had some good deals. Why? Because the hotel is undergoing some changes. There is no self-parking, only valet and if it's busy, such as in the morning, call in advance so you don't end up being late as they have to fetch your car. There is only one restaurant, although all the hotel materials tell you there are several. I ended wandering down one hallway, looking for the breakfast buffet and finding the restaurant closed. They don't bother to tell you that at the front desk. As for the much bally-hooed Sleep Number bed - it's like sleeping on an air mattress. I'd rather sleep on a real bed. Everytime I moved, I could hear the plastic squeaking beneath me. The king-sized Sleep Number bed is basically 2 twin beds put together and there is a board in the middle which you can feel if you turn over. I'm glad I stayed elsewhere for my 2nd night in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwimumx1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our trip. The room was your standard hotel room but was very clean. The bed was very comfortable with controls to set the firmness of the bed on either side. We were pleasantly suprised at the lack of Airport noise. The hotel also provide a shuttle to and from the airport which was very handy. We had a car for 2 days and the hotel provided carparking for a reasonable price. Only complaint would be the room service charges. There is a delivery fee plus a 20% service charge and then the delivery person wanted a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: janeypiejesus
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of a California / Nevada road trip. The hotel runs frequent shuttle buses to and from LAX. The rooms are spacious and the beds are unbelievably comfy and had remote controls to adjust them! We didn't notice any airport noise during our stay and quite enjoyed watching the planes take off! The breakfast buffet was impressive and quite reasonable too. There was valet and self parking at the hotel too

Reviews.Title: “Watch for hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: I_Travel_2_Much
Reviews.Content: The hotel, room and service were are all fine. My complaint is that I hate hidden charges. My credit card was billed $5 for shuttle service to the airport. I didn't know about the charge until I received my statement. The account rep was very cordial and offered to credit my account but an ethical hotel would not have charged my card in the first place. It's not about the money. The real catch is that they had no way of knowing if I took the shuttle or not. It is apparent that they charge all guests for the shuttle and rely on the guest to catch it. There is also no notification that the shuttle charges a fee. I don't mind paying small fees like this, just be clear about it up front.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: intrepudtraveller
Reviews.Content: Radisson LAX is ideal for an overnight stay. The room was big and comfy with 2 large beds. The bathroom was minimal but fine, and very clean. Theres a good choice of in-room movies and in-room dining and the Concierge was more than helpful in providing other takeaway options. The TV stations arent the best with poor reception but the hotel did explain that they're currently upgrading their TV's at the moment so its being addressed. It is worth noting that while the shuttle from LAX to the hotel is free, it costs $5 to get it back to the airport which I thought was a bit sneaky. Oh and the room service bill automatically has 20% service charge added on so beware!! But other than that it was a great hotel and one I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: somobr
Reviews.Content: As many of you using trip advisor, I read many reviews about all the hotels before I finally selected one. The reason we stayed at the Radisson LAX is because it was close to the airport, reasonably priced and a brand name... It was perfect in location... we had 3 days in LA and you can't ask for a better location.. 15 mins to Santa Monica & Venice Beach (day 1 of our adventure) Day 2 we headed into LA and did all the sights - approx 30 min drive and very very easy to drive to... Day 3 we headed to Universal Studios... If you are not going to be in the heart of LA for your stay why stay there with their over ex-y prices, expensive car parking etc. The staff at the Radisson were extremely knowledgeable and printed out MapQuest directions for every destination we went to and step by step directions on how to get back to the hotel. They have a huge amount of local knowledge which was great for us, especially as this was the first time we had driven in the US. Car parking at the hotel was $13US per night - but we knew this anyway and was really cheap compared to everywhere else. Other reviews are spot on there is no noise from the airport, it is clean, spacious room. Our shower was the worse thing - it trickled, but when we mentioned it to the Front Desk they offered to move us straight away... Not the friendliest hotel staff, but definitely huge amount of knowledge which is what we needed. Would definitely recommend this as a reasonably priced option $99 p/n compared to all the other hotels, and definitely a good spot if you are doing a similar 3-4 days that we did

Reviews.Title: “Well, They Tried . . .”
Reviews.Author: dsikula
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I'd stayed at the Radisson. My first trip is unmemorable to me now, but it must have been good enough that I decided to try it again. It's not a bad hotel by any means; rooms are very clean and generally comfortable, but on coming into the room, I noticed it was a little warm. I went over to the thermostat -- which was literally disattached from the wall -- and tried to cool things down from the 75 on the readout to a more comfortable 68 or so. The thermostat itself is very similar to the one in my home, so I knew how to adjust the settings, and no matter what I tried, there was no indication that it was working. I left for the evening, hoping it would have kicked in in the interim. When I returned, the room was still in the mid-70s, so I went down to the desk to request either a new room or a repair. After waiting in line (at 11:45 pm! The desk invariably had a line), the clerk assured me that they'd send a maintenance man up to look at it. I went back upstairs, and sure enough, within a few minutes, the maintenance guy appeared. I pointed out the unattached thermostat, which he re-screwed to the wall, then he climbed a ladder to look at the air conditioning's innards. After a few moments examination, he assured me it was broken (I had gotten that much myself) and that they would have to tear it apart to repair it right. He suggested I tell this to the desk and get a new room in the morning. Aftter he left, I did indeed to back to the desk (another line!) and was finally told by the same clerk that they were fully booked (given the crowds in the lobby at that time of night, I believed him), so the room-switch was out. He immediately asked what he could do as a make-good. I said I didn't know, so he offered me a free breakfast. Not a lot, but he was trying; I'll give him that. I went back up to the room, and while it was still about 73. it wasn't awful, and I was able to sleep soundly. The next morning, I told another desk clerk that I wouldn't be needing the breakfast, but that I hoped the room would be repaired. When I returned late that evening, the situation was the same, but again, not to the point where sleep was difficult. Other than that, I have few complaints. The shower is terrible, but I've come to expect that in hotels nowadays. The room was clean and generally well-maintained (air conditioning aside), and all things considered, I'd probably stay there again -- just wary.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT RECCOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: Renate657
Reviews.Content: GOOD. The lobby area is quite nice and coupled with the breeze and it really puts you in a good mood. The rooms are very neat and the beds are awesome! They have sleep number beds that can be adjusted to your preference. THE BAD AND VERY BAD. Trying to figure out how to enter the premises is a task. Leaving and coming back is a nightmare. The elevators are a death trap waiting to happen. If you have fears of elevators, then you'll be taking the stairs here. We got trapped on the elevators 2x's and on many occassions it didnt go all the way down to the lobby as you had to get off the 2nd floor and then walk down the stairs to the lobby. The pool is a mile away. Not physically, but its like walking aways to go for a nice dip. It was also dirty and very few chairs. The front desk girls seem to be jerks as they are quick to tell you "no" or you can't do something. They were very unfriendly. I thought maybe its me, but I talked to different people both male and female and they felt the same way. We called room service and asked for towels, 20 minutes later no towels, went to the front desk and was told we had to call room service.The concierge was unfriendly and and tryed to sell us on tours and packages instead of answering the questions or trying to help If you have children this is not the place. Also the gift shop was awful. I did send an e-mail to the corporate office, lets see what happens.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomnkorea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a night before catching an early morning flight. Overall it was a good experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms have sleep number beds and were very comfortable. The only problem was the elivators were not functioning properly. We had to wait 10 minutes for an elivator to go to dinner. When we were catching the shuttle another couple complained about waiting 15 minutes and finally dragging their lugage down 11 flights of stairs. The hotel also charges $13.00 a dayt to park.

Reviews.Title: “Hope you are a sound sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: Light sleepers should stay away. Yes, the Radisson LAX is very close to the airport - close enough to hear every take off from the nearby runways throughout the night and early morning. The hotel management kindly supplies earplugs, but for the light sleeper only a couple more miles distance from LAX will insure a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “How to loss your money when booking on line at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: taxandrelax
Reviews.Content: In October 2007 my wife and I made reservations online at the Radisson Hotel Los Angeles Airport for November 13, 2007. Will on vacationing Sandals in Jamaica we decided to stay another day so we tried to cancel our reservations for November 13, 2007 with the Radisson Hotel. On November 11, 2007, 48 hours before our arrival at the Radisson Hotel, the following steps were taken: From the Airport reservation form, we tried to call the phone number [--]. It does not work from were we were staying in Jamaica. The form is very clear, that you can either book on-line or call that number. We called the Radisson Hotel Los Angeles Airport directly and they could not cancel their own reservation without a confirmation from Alliance Reservations Network. The only number they had was the one listed above. We called the 800 operator, but they could not help us because they need a city where Alliance Reservations Network. Since we had made the reservation on line, we tried to find a computer to borrow to cancel the reservation on line, but could not find one. We then called American Express operator and explain our problem, they could not cancel our reservation. We then ask the operator to record our problem. All these phone calls cost us over $50. When we got home we asked American Express to reverse the Radisson $162.00 charge. Radisson refused to refund the money claining we did not cancil within the 24 hour period. It is impossible it they don't give you the support or have the employees who can cancil your reservation. They sure know how to take the money before you come. Radisson says they have one goal ..yours. I think they left out a word, "take yours". So be careful when you give up your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view?!”
Reviews.Author: themotorcycleman
Reviews.Content: After a delayed flight, and the lingering smog from the forest fires, the Radisson was just what you need in an airport hotel. Efficient, friendly, clean, comfortable. And the big selling point - the rooftop bar! Excellent selection of international beers, nice atmosphere, good sevice again and even a chance to actually get a view beyond car parks and hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: bepell
Reviews.Content: If our stay was based on looks, then the Radisson is pretty nice. HOWEVER...it's not. The GOOD. The lobby area is quite nice and coupled with the breeze and it really puts you in a good mood. The rooms are very neat and the beds are awesome! They have sleep number beds that can be adjusted to your preference. Also, they have free internet in the rooms and a desk to setup your laptop. The concierge was friendly and helpful. THE BAD. Trying to figure out how to enter the premises is a task. Leaving and coming back is a nightmare as it took us 2 days to figure out an alternative street to go on so that you don't have to go almost 2/3rds of a mile down to street to make a u-turn to enter the premises. The elevators are a death trap waiting to happen. If you have fears of elevators, then you'll be taking the stairs here. We got trapped on the elevators 2x's and on many occassions it didnt go all the way down to the lobby as you had to get off the 2nd floor and then walk down the stairs to the lobby. The pool is a mile away. Not physically, but its like walking aways to go for a nice dip. The front desk girls seem to be jerks as they are quick to tell you "no" or you can't do something. They were very unfriendly. I thought maybe its me, but I talked to different people both male and female and they felt the same way. They got some serious fixing up to do.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: jefftahoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night after a trip to Jamaica and were very sorry we switched from the Hilton LAX. This is an older hotel that severly needs up dating of the rooms. TV had terrible reception with maybe 12 channels. Would not even turn on the morning we left. Towels were soft but had a sour smell to them in the bath. Nice granite counters in the bath, but kind of like "putting perfume on the pig", didn't really make the room nicer. No refer in the room. We have stayed at the Hilton LAX twice before, will definately go back to the Hilton. This place is like a Motel 6 compared to the Hilton LAX.
