Even L Quinta LAX is nicer .Pay the extra money and stay somewhere really nice! Hotwire actually called this a 4 star......maybe the lobby! Rooms were less than 3 star. Staff at check out was very rude and could care less. This is my first bad xperience with a Radisson Hotel. Doubt we will ever stay at another Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay. Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Truckload_Sales
Reviews.Content: We flew into LAX and rented a car. We were in town on business for 4 days. We picked the Radisson because they had the sleep number beds. The first night our room was 80 degrees. Called that next morning and they sent someone to look at it and he said is was broken. Sent us to another room but it was much smaller. Called down and they sent us 2 rooms down from old one. Believe it or not the A/C didn't work in that one also!! Called down next morning and sent someone up. He turned some valves and got it working. The elevators never worked properly the whole time. The morning we left I flew out to Texas before my wife flew out to Colorado. We were on the 7th floor. It took me 10 minutes to get an elevator and 2 hours later my wife had to take the stairs 7 floors down with luggage because none of the 4 elevators were working!!! The sleep number bed did not have a pillow top so it wasn't comfortable. Was very disapointed with hotel. Have stayed in much nicer hotels for half the money!! Radisson Corp needs to take a good look at this hotel. They are trashing their name!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But”
Reviews.Author: Jeep_M5
Reviews.Content: Myself and family stayed at this hotel as the first night stopover on a USA holiday. We arrived at this Hotel after travelling for nearly 24 hours from Sydney Australia. The Hotel shuttle from LAX to the hotel was very good and easy to locate just outside the airport terminal. However once at the hotel, it took over 45 minutes to check in, as a large group arrived at around the same time as we did. Normally this would not be problem for myself, however it would be expected that this hotel should be able to deal with a large number of guests arriving at the same time, as planes arrive and depart on a regular basis. There were several instances of communication problems between ourselves and Hotel employees, including wrong drinks being prepared at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: buddy1997
Reviews.Content: Our company selected the Radisson for its annual conference. The conference agenda allowed little extra time, so the hotel selection was important, since we would be spending so much time at the hotel. I must say the staff of the property was very friendly and highly focused on service. When I requested if I could have a Dr. Pepper delivered to the meeting, the staff was more than accommodating. The concierge and front desk agent were very helpful in responding to my requests, such as printing a boarding pass and arranging a car to take our group back to the airport. However, my biggest surprise was how quite the rooms were given their proximity to the airport. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LVinSEA
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Radisson at LAX. The staff was gracious and very accommodating. Rooms were clean and comfortable and I discovered that my sleep number is 30 on their signature Sleep Number beds. The banquet food at the hotel was artfully arranged and delicious. I did not dine in the restaurants because Manhattan Beach is a quick taxi or trolley ride away where there are nice dining options. The airport location couldn't have been more convenient though you could hardly hear airplane noise at all. There is a convenient rental car company located right in the hotel. I will use this hotel when ever I travel for business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: Julie24k
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson LAX as part of a conference, and it was perfect for our needs! The staff went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect for us. I would highly recommend this hotel, and look forward to visiting again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Ugh. Never stayed at Radisson before, never will again.”
Reviews.Author: thewriterjc
Reviews.Content: Good location, but that's about it. I booked a king bed but got a double. Radisson and Hotels.com (which we booked it thru) insisted they couldn't get us a bigger bed. The internet in the entire building was down. The hall smelled funny and the furniture was dingy and stained. The parking garage machine was broken. The handles were broken off of the stairclimber in the fitness center. There was no breakfast, no fridge, no microwave. Need I go further?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: hanmeng
Reviews.Content: The reception was pleasant. The hotel shows its age in some of the styling, particularly in the elevators, which look to be forty years old. The room was clean but small, the king-sized bed comfortable. Our TV, like those of some other guests, did not have the HBO it was supposed to. The double-glazed windows were great at keeping out the sound of cars and airplanes, but the walls were thin enough to hear conversations next door, and the plumbing was very loud. Our room had no coffee maker. Contrary to the claim on the hotel's website, the outdoor swimming pool is not "olympic-size". However, it is heated enough to swim in. The shuttle to & from the airport was quick & frequent. If you're fond of walking. turn right out of the hotel and go right on Sepulveda. For a free thrill, you find yourself directly under the flight path of landing airplanes. Continue up Sepulveda (about 25 minutes total) to some restaurants and a mall with a supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to AFV”
Reviews.Author: MrC52
Reviews.Content: This is not even close to the worst hotel in America! (Ever heard of the Spinning Wheel in the middle of nowhere Idaho?!) My husband and I headed to LA for a few days during our spring break to take in the taping of a couple of shows. We booked through Hotwire and saved about $100/night. We found everyone to be congenial and we never waited more than 10 or 15 seconds for an elevator going either direction. The room was quite large and surprisingly quiet considering we were next to the airport. Two things that are worth noting: Yes, there is a business centre but it cost $6.95/15 minutes to use the computers. Every hotel of this calibre that we've been to has provided this service for free. Second, we had to pay to park. I guess this was because it's at LAX and they don't want cars left there while people are off on holidays, but we found it surprising. We thought it was going to be $13/day but it was only $13 for our entire 3-day stay, so it wasn't outrageous. It took us about 45 minutes to drive to CBS studios for the taping of "The Price is Right." The next day we went to "America's Funniest Videos" and it's only 10 minutes away, although it took about twice that because of rush hour traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: Scout9803
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest, most run-down, neglected national chain hotel I have stayed in, in years. This hotel is under new ownership reportedly. The carpets are filthy and coming up from the floors. My room carpet has bleach stains. The AC makes noise louder than the TV. The OnCommand TV Movies program is not working at all. Room Service could not get a meal correct in 4 meals!!!!! Most staff struggle to even speak English. Telephone operators are rude, and the phone rings and rings with no one answering. Light switchplates are rusted out, literally. The furniture in my room was visibly dirty with liquids and soil upon my check-in. The front desk is unbelievably incompetent and poor customer service providers. The vending machines on the floors don't even work on 10, 9 and 8th floors. This is no exaggeration--the worst hotel in America. Supervisors are barely competent to handle their jobs. Managers are literally invisible during your entire stay. Food is marginal at best upstairs, downstairs or room service. $129 per night--what are you paying for? Nothing is worth the money at this time. Run as far away as possible from this place, especially when there are so many other good choices in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “hotel good, service not”
Reviews.Author: orgone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty quiet for being right next to the airport. The only problem I had was that the front desk people always look like they can't wait for you to go away even before they help you. They don't yet know about the concept of service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel Nice Place To Stop In”
Reviews.Author: cre8tive921
Reviews.Content: I got the room at an affordable rate through Priceline for a business stay. It was very nice and they have the sleep number mattresses. Which made sleep very pleasant. It is directly near the airport. So I would reccommend crashing there if you had early flight or only popping in for quick stay. Average amenties. Overall very comfortable for business or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “The attitude at the sky bar & unreliable shuttle bus service”
Reviews.Author: love6kies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night & found the experience unpleasant over all. I usually stay Westin & there're stores & restaurants are in the walking distance, but Raddison is very far to any of these. I walked 25 mins to buy a bottle of Perrier water at the nearest gas station & walk back to the hotel that killed my feet. As I got back from a long walk, entered the lobby and the concierge greeted me friendly, so I told him it's not convenient for a shopping for some drink. He told me to have a drink in their sky lounge with a view that's worth watching, so I went straight to the lounge which was totally empty at the time (around 5pm). As I enetered the sky lounge the waiters are nicely greeted me, had a small talk and ordered a drink. The view of the LAX was really nice. :) It could look prettier at night. Anyhows, as I finished my drink, the waiter asked me if I'm ready to order a food. I was there for a drink so asked him a check, then he suddenly gave me a very cold look, goes back to the kitchen entrance are where there were other co-workers and told them I was there just for the drink. They should change the name to Sky restaurant, then any customer will be reluctant to go just for the drinks. This case, I wouldn't have been there w/o the friendly concierge suggested me to check it out. The room is a typical 3 star hotel room with so-so bed comfort. the window has a doulbe shield, and the view was nice with the colorful light objects. The next day was my departure, and since the hotel is literally located right next to the airport, I decided to use their shuttle bus service. I was waited about 25 mins in the morning for the shuttle bus that never arrives. I complained about it at the front desk, but all they say was to wait, so I just used a car service that waiting at the hotel vallet parking. It was $15 what a rip off!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for stopover at Los Angeles LAX”
Reviews.Author: SOB32
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for comfortable stop-over, close to Los Angeles LAX airport. Complimentary airport shuttle bus, which runs frequently. Our room was spacious & very quiet, with extremely comfy beds; just what we needed! Food for dinner was average. Staff were pleasant & efficient. Overall, very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Committed To Customer Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Grandmo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed there prior to going on a cruise ship leaving from San Pedro. I chose this hotel because it offered free shuttle service to & from the airport. Great feature. Having never been to Los Angeles, I asked the hotel Concierge, by the name of Tim, to direct me in the easiest & most economical way to get to the port. Tim was exceptionally friendly & helpful & informed me that there was no shuttle or bus service, that a taxi would cost me $150 & that I was better to take the "Limo/Car' service offered through the hotel for $120, but would give me a deal at $99. As that appeared to be the way to go, I booked the car service to not only take us to the port, but to pick us up when we returned from our cruise as we were staying another night at the Radisson before returning to Canada. Throughout the cruise as we talked with other passengers, we learned that there is indeed a shuttle service from hotels to San Pedro & that the taxis advertise $53 from LAX airport to the port. I was extremely upset over this & felt I had been taken advantage of by the concierge. Due to a delay in the ship clearing customs, we did take a taxi back to the Radisson & it only cost us $57!! To cut a long story short, both Tim & the car service apologised for the misleading information I was given & did not charge me for our initial ride to the port for our cruise. We did hire the car service & a driver for a 3 hour sightseeing tour of LA. This was very expensive at $65 an hour & of course had there been more people to share the vehicle the expense would have been less. But we really enjoyed having a personal tour guide. The rooms in the hotel were large & beds very comfortable. So all in all, I would certainly recommend the hotel & the car service. I have learned through the experience to now check out prices & availability of transportation for a new city, using the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: miscuzi
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to crash at after a late night flight for its convenience to LAX, shuttle service and price ($96 total with corp discount). Parking is not free so we decided to go back to the airport the next morning to catch the shuttle to the car rental. The room and bathroom was very clean. The noise from the airplanes and interior wall plumbing would annoy light sleepers. The breakfast buffet ($13) was delicious and served elegantly in a nice dining room. Desk staff was helpful in giving directions and allowing us to check out late (2pm). Would stay at this hotel again for just a night after getting up for an early flight or getting in late.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: McHenryDad
Reviews.Content: This is the closest hotel to LAX. Many people from my company stay here when traveling in LA because the traffic is so bad you can't count on making a flight otherwise. Some of my coworkers like this hotel, but this is my second stay and both have been crummy. The building was probably nice at some time, but it is quite worn. Plumbing fixtures in the room barely work. Windows are cracked. Room is barely clean. Hotel bar is small. Restaurant is expensive. You have to pay separately to park in the parking garage. First visit I had trouble checking in, but this trip was fine. Alarm clock is confusing. There are other hotels nearby that are better maintained, offer a more comfortable bar and restaurant, just as convenient, and a better value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with some reservations”
Reviews.Author: Jimdanny
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on a 4 day LA Tour Package and the tour company used this hotel as their headquarters. We found the hotel very inviting both from the outside and lobby area. The desk staff was very business like but curteous. The check-in went smoothly and because we drove to the hotel the clerk explained the parking proceedure and daily charge of $13.00. The parking garage( 2 levels) was behind the hotel and quite large. Hotel guests were able to park on the lower floor. With a validation ticket from the front desk you can leave and enter the parking area at no extra charge. Our room,# 901, was on the south side of the building wilth a view of the hightway entrance to the airport and runways. The only problem with viewing the sites was the window was dirty and with the sound material on the window it was hard to see a clear view of the outside. The room, or more accurately, a roomette, was below average size. With one king size bed, a small table and chair, and furniture for the tv, there was not much room left to move around. The bathroom was very small with very little counter space around the sink area. The room and bathroom needed a good cleaning and updating. There was a cigarette smell that was quite noticeable in the room and bedding. There are 6 elevators for the hotel floors. Going up is ok BUT going down from your room can be a 2-3 or 4 minute wait for a going down elevator. Obtaining breakfast and dinner, at a reasonable price, at the hotel was impossible. They have one restaurant, which appears to be their signature restaurant, with very high prices. (one small box of cornflakes = $4.00) Dinner for two without any drinks or dessert was $ 55.00. They had a breakfast/lunch room but it was closed for what ever reason. It appears that management is going after the business traveler with their pricing structure. The gift shop also had very high prices. Staying at this hotel would be good if you drove to L.A to fly out of LAX. The facility appears to be set-up for this business and from what we saw many, many people are using this service. During our stay we saw lots of people at all times of the day and night passing through the hotel. In our opinion this is not a hotel to use if you are traveling the LA area and just need a hotel for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management of a dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRegSC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December 2007. I am a frequent traveler. I travel on a weekly basis both in the US and abroad. This was one of the worst stays I have ever had at a hotel. The stay was filled with one problem after another. When I tried to check into the hotel I was informed that the computers were down and that I would need to wait an hour for the computers to come back up. After waiting for 1 hour in the lobby I proceeded to check in. I went up to my assigned room only to find that when I opened the door there was a female guest screaming. The room had obviously already been assigned to someone else. I returned to the lobby, explained the situation and was assigned a new room number. I entered the new room to see that all of the bedding and curtains were old and very faded. The room was clean however it was not a comfortable room. I pulled out my laptop to connect to the internet received an error stating that there was a problem with the host. I called the front desk to inquire about the problem. They said they would send an engineer to my room to take a look at the problem. The engineer arrived promptly. After performing a few checks he determined that there was a problem with the jack. He explained to me that they often had problems with the internet in certain rooms. He offered to change my room. I agreed. We went to the new room only to find that the Internet did not work in that room either. The engineer told me to stay in my original room. He gave me a phone number to call for their tech support. I called and spoke to the tech support. He told me that he would advise his engineer and then send him to fix the problem. Nobody ever came. After waiting several hours for a response I called the tech support again only to be told that he couldn't help. I then decided to order a pay per view movie. After selecting a movie on the screen and agreeing to payment the screen went black. I called the front desk and explained the problem and they said they would send an engineer. The engineer arrived promptly. He looked at the TV briefly before offering to change my room. I explained that I would move only if they could ensure that the pay per view would work in the new room. I did not want to move all of my luggage again. The engineer said he would go test the system in the new room and then call be back with the info. I never heard anything back. Another troublesome fact about this hotel was that everytime I went to take the elevator it would take literally 10 minutes before the elevator arrived. I do not understand why. I was at the hotel for 3 days and this happened every day! In summary, this is an old hotel that offers an uncomfortable room, and an incompetent staff with zero accountability. If you have a problem they will keep refering you to someone else until you are told they will get back to you. After reading other reviews, this hotel looked promising. It is my understanding that they have recently changed management and things certainly seem to have gone downhill.

Reviews.Title: “aircraft spotter delight”
Reviews.Author: ashcan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after flight from UK. Chosen for price, $136 incl taxes etc , free 5-10 minute shuttle bus from terminal. Check in efficient and quick, but as we were so tired , body clock on 0300 we went upto bed, having played with the number bed thing, ie changing firmness of mattress all had a good nights sleep. The room was good 2 queen beds tv etc, slighty worn appearance of bathroom. The soundproofing was excellant only a dull roar of engines could be heard next day and great views of the aircraft/runways. As we were late getting off to collect our hire car we didn't eat there. Overall a very good place to stay after a long late flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, right next to airport”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel ahead of flying out to atlanta at 6am, so needed to be near LAX. As others have said this is just so convienent for early morning flights, with the shuttle bus running through the night. Stayed in Room 554. Large room, efficent checkin, with a complimentary USA Today. Coffee making facilities in room. Overlooking airport, but it was quiet. Good TV with in room movies if waiting for flight. Bar on top of hotel overlooking runways opens at 530pm. Also does food. I was impressed, and would fully recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Double Check Your Reservations”
Reviews.Author: puravida2
Reviews.Content: Just a cautionary tale to let people know that if you book your room through a third party at this hotel, ALWAYS confirm your reservation. We had booked this hotel with Priceline using the Name Your Price feature. I called the hotel the day before our arrival to let them know we would be arriving very late and they could not find our reservation. After numerous calls back and forth between me, Priceline and the hotel, the bottom line was the hotel would not honor the price I received on Priceline, even though we had confirmed reservations. According to the "Revenue Manager", it was my fault for booking through a 3rd party and that he would happily give me a room at full price ($189.00). I would like to point out that Priceline was VERY helpful on their end and as upset about it as I was. I could not have imagined what would have happened had we arrived at the hotel at midnight as planned - we would have slept in the lobby, I guess. We did the Priceline thing again and got a room at the LAX Hilton for my original offer and were pleased - I have already written a positive review for them. To be fair, I did call Radisson Corporate Customer Service to complain, as I was pretty appalled by the whole experience. They offered to intervene on my behalf, since I had already gotten the room at the Hilton I told them there was no need, but that they should indeed look into it to avoid future problems. After over an hour of international long distance charges, not to mention the lost time and hassle involved the day before our trip and I don't have good feelings about the Radisson LAX. I would triple check your reservations with them, unless of course, you paid full price!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: autumnwomble
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Radisoon LAX before flying to Mexico. The hotel provided a free bus service between the airport and the hotel, the trip takes around 5 mins. Our room was large and clean, if slightly worn, especially the bathroom. The room was well sound proofed - we could barely hear the planes taking off and landing just across the road! Provided were iron and board, coffee maker, tv, alarm radio, toiletries and individually controlled air conditioning. The hotel has two reasonably priced restaurants which provide a good standard of food and a lounge which provides drinks and snacks. A drink in the penthouse bar over looking the LA skyline is recommended. The buffet breakfast is a good option which includes hot meats, porridge, cereal, fruit and bakery. There is a local free trolley service provided to Manhattan beach and a local shopping mall, this stops just outside the hotel, an ideal way to spend a lazy day. The concierge was very helpful with good advice for onward travel arrangements. The hotel has an outdoor pool which didn't seem to be heated, it can be very noisy due to its proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: suscar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between getting a late flight to LAX and an early one out the next morning! We arrived about 9pm and the shuttle brought us directly to the hotel. We were checked in in a matter of minutes and after leaving luggage to our room we decided to venture to their 'penthouse' where they have a restaurant and bar! I highly recommend this, prices were average for LA and the food was gorgeous. At check-in, they advertised the views of the city from the penthouse, although we failed to see the amazing views we did confirm a story we heard about LA. You cannot see any stars in LA, those which you consider to be stars actually turn out to be planes landing at LAX. We had a great time trying to convince one another that we had found stars! This hotels is very clean and, I believe, to a very high standard! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: 4hersheybear
Reviews.Content: We decided to book near the airport on our last night in LA to avoid any traffic delays, and I'm glad we did. The Radisson was clean, comfortable, and affordable at $109/night plus $13 for convenient in-and-out parking. The furnishings were newer, with a decent sized bathroom. Our Sleep-number bed was comfortable if a bit squeaky when rolling over. There are plenty of eating establishments within the hotel as well as a gift shop with the basic necessities (extremely marked-up prices - $6 for 4 tampons!! - sorry, guys).

Reviews.Title: “proberbley the best you will get in this area”
Reviews.Author: bosshog1
Reviews.Content: having arived fairley late on a delayed flight from heathrow we were quite supprised how quick and efficient the shuttle bus was in taking us to this hotel,the staff were curteous and very helpful.The highlight of the evening was dining in the rooftop resturant watching the planes landing allthough the waiters were very disorganised not knowing who had ordered what food and which table to deliver orders too.Next morning we walked to the budget car rental which is only two blocks away.We would certanly stay here again as we felt safe in this area

Reviews.Title: “great hotel excellent to move arround”
Reviews.Author: michifus_39
Reviews.Content: our experience was very good. We arrive early and they let us do an early checking without problems, we had to wait only 40 minutes for the room to be ready. The hotel is very clean friendly management, very good restaurant on ground floor, prices are very normal and good food and service.Room was very clean, lift were fast, only thing could be there was not fridge in room. Hotel is very good to move arround LA if you have a car. I would highly recomended. We made reservation through Hotwire and really got very good price. We will go back when ever we are at LA

Reviews.Title: “the rudest staff in the world, disgusting service”
Reviews.Author: nickthebritusa
Reviews.Content: This is worst hotel experience ever.....I am a frequent traveller, and I am used to many many hotels, I have never written a bad review before,but my stay in this hotel is the worst I have ever had. The room was OK to be fair,but the bar you cannot even add onto your room, My main issues were in the first morning, I ordered my breakfast, I was horrified to find that the Jam/jelly when i opened it, it was already used, half empty and aged, I ordered a large pot of tea, the hotel sent me a flask of hot water, but it had always had coffee in it, so the water tasted horrible. This was the same for every day (6) i was here. The TV remote and video on demand did not work, so I had to move rooms. What had infuriated me the most was that not once would the hotel even apologise for the jam and the tea/coffee incidents, even to the point that the managers and supervisors even said tea and coffee mixed would taste nice, they has no answer what soever for the Jam, on 2 occassions when i was complaining, politely but angryily, they surrounded me with security officers to intimidate me. I am an ex policeman, and I have never been or caused trouble in my life.... All we were asking for was a simple apology, and credit for the the disgusting breakfast and Tea/Coffee incidents, ($15 for a tea.) I am Emirates Gold, BA gold, and travel the world every week, I have never never met such rude, arrogant, argumentitive staff, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, unless you are ready to be abused at, when justifued thngs go wrong, We checked out early, went to Holiday Inn, where the service and friendliness was perfect. there is a old saying, doing something wrong is not a problem, it is how you correct it that solves the problem. Be warned fellow travellers,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: MBarr
Reviews.Content: This was a short stay waiting for another flight. The location to the airport is the closest of the hotels. The front desk can get very busy but once attended to the process is quick and painless. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The price was good also. The bonus was the bar and restaurant on the upper floors. Priced reasonably and the food was excellent. Worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Coulda found a nicer place for the price...”
Reviews.Author: MzShowStoppa
Reviews.Content: The carpet was old and dirty. The furniture and bed comforter needs to be updated. The bathroom looked old and the lighting was terrible. The plastic runner at the bottom of the room door was torn and dragged the floor. I have stayed in 2 star hotels much nicer than this one..... Customers should be warned that they have to pay for parking! This automatically increased my total cost by 17 dollars. It's 13 for non-hotel parking (as the hotel doesn't even have it's own lot!) or 17 for valet in the front of the hotel! I feel that not including this additional charge is essentially false advertising for the cost of the "hotel stay"!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: 84chevelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just as a layover. Got there late at night, hotel was very busy. Valet parking guy was rude cause we weren't paying for valet, we were just dropping off our luggage so we could return car to rental company but he had a problem with that. Reception desk was nice. Rooms need to be updated. One of the walls was almost falling apart. Yet the room was clean and offered a comfortable night stay. I would not recommend for staying more than a night. Their aiport shuttle service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Radisson Standards”
Reviews.Author: TennisGuy27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Radisson's - in faact our company uses Radisson's in Toronto to house clients - as the standard is excellent - and has always been so - until I stayed at the LAX Radisson. The room was smelly, the TV had 8 TV channels, the matresses were lumpy (all the Radisson's I have stayed at have duvets with fantastic matresses - one of the reasons for choosing Radisson). Spend the $20 per night more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury last night”
Reviews.Author: flying_jockman
Reviews.Content: For our last night in the States after 3 weeks travelling we opted for a conveniant hotel, with a good review rating and comfortable beds. The Radisson didnt dissapoint and we were delighted with the service, convenience and facilities available to us. We opted for the fancier beds with the adjustable number rating thing, sounded good at the time but didnt know what my sleep number was so pretty much just left it alone. The 8th floor view of 747's taking off and landing was amazing, made even better by not being able to hear any of it. The pool is great, fitness facilities are fine but whoever uses them anyway? The rooms are clean and what you would expect at this level. The resteraunt and bar food is excellent and to be honest some of the best Mexican food I had in California was served at the bar in the Radisson for $7. A great range of premium world lagers washes it all down. Downsides? not many except the airport bus is very oversubscribed and although frequent be prepared to miss a couple due to the incredible amount of luggage people carry and volume of passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: azjoe35
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Raddison LAX for 4 nights in August 2007. The hotel is located pretty much between the 4 runways at LAX. The lobby and common areas were extremely clean and decorated very nicely. The check-in desk was run very professionally and efficiently. Our room was on the 9th floor facing to the north and was very comfortable. We had two “Sleep-number Beds”, a chair, nice desk with high-speed internet. Bathroom was always well equipped with quality soaps and towels and the shower had a shower-head that would prevent you from being scalded. The door was made of heavy wood with good working locks. The room was very quiet as was the nicely decorated hallways. Obviously being next to LAX it was impossible not to hear jets taking-off, but it was never loud enough to disturb us thanks to multi-pane, thick windows which also had thick drapes. A copy of the “USA TODAY” was always at the door in the morning. The pool was nice but not heated. The only item of slight disappointment was being charged to park (about $13 a day—but you could come and go as much as you liked once the ticket was validated). I guess charging is the norm at a nice hotel...at least it was nicely secured so I consider it worth it. One issue of importance was security, which was completely met. I had returned to my room once while the maid was inside and she, rightfully, would not allow me to enter until I provided a key that worked to prove it was my room. She was very gracious in dealing with me at the time and I give the hotel and the maid high marks for security. I would have no issues at all staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: H_ILChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great option if you have a night between flights. I've stayed there twice in the last month and both times this place has been an oasis from the busy airport. The shuttle bus comes past the terminals regularly and the drivers are really helpful with luggage. Front desk staff and concierge were excellent too. I had a great meal here (roomservice) and they have free wireless internet. There is a bus station right behind the hotel and I was easily able to get a bus to Santa Monica Pier for the afternoon when I had a flight departing late at night. I hired a bike at Santa Monica Pier and rode around the waterfront. Perfect for jetlag! The concierge was particularly helpful with the instructions for the bus. At the end of the day I headed back to the Radisson where my bags were in storage and took the short shuttle ride to to the terminal for my next flight. Really easy and convenient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: BritTraveller68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last month, before returning to Europe. I've read all the other reviews and it would seem that others have missed what made my all but brief stay at what would otherwise just be an "another" airport hotel, something to remember....the ground floor restaurant. Excellent friendly service, a wide-ranging menu with well presented dishes and an excellent wine list. Very few people were in there when I was there, which is a shame...so I would recommend arriving earlier and starting (or ending) your trip with a first-rate meal. And I'm well aware that the other guests who were dining at the same time as me also had a good time, judging by the comments they made amongst themselves and directly to the staff. The Scandinavian (I think) lady at check-in did process my arrival in quite a robotic fashion, which was the only disappointing element of my stay. The rooms were average size, but comfortable. The bathroom was small, but more than sufficient for a brief stay. Leave time to get downstairs though....the lifts are slow, so don't leave your departure till the last minute. I would add an extra 10 minutes, which is how long I had to wait once to go down from the 9th floor to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, good value”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: LAX hotels can be HIGH! This hotel is very reasonable and offers on-site dining with a couple of restaurants and a lounge that all are adequate. Parking is extra but that is the norm for this area. Room was a little worn but functional. A/C was a little noisy. Sleep number beds in rooms if you get excited by that. Convenience to the airport can't be beat. Set up for the business traveler. Staff was nice. This might not be the quality of property I would normally want to stay, but for LAX, it fits the bill, or lack of bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Dingy”
Reviews.Author: miniyoshie
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice when you enter the lobby. The concierge is very friendly and check-in took no time. My room was poorly lit, several lamps were unplugged. Overall the room was raggedy and dingy. There's nothing worse than old bedding, GROSS. Don't you love plopping into bed exhausted to find yourself nestled between yellowing, thin sheets? Or maybe it's the stray hairs in the bed too. Love em! Anyways, not the greatest, needs a better maid as well as some furniture/bedding updates. My wake up call was also 4 minutes late.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesyp1976
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel just outside the airport near all the hire car places. Billed as a 4* hotel, I personally think it needs a bit of modernising. We enjoyed our stay there, and fortunately the windows are sound-proofed to keep out the aircraft noise! All-in-all a good hotel, all though quite a journey from all the main attractions in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Smoking in non smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ca_hols1
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on a non smoking floor and it smelled of cigarettes and had ash trays in the room and bathroom. When we called the front desk to inquire how this could be - we were told that occasionally they used non smoking rooms as smoking when they had more smokers staying then smoking rooms! This horrified us and represents a mockery of calling rooms "non smoking". Otherwise, the rooms were nice, the hotel was quiet and we would highly recommend it compare to other LAX hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TranspaciFlyer
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at the hotel 3 years ago. Boy, what a difference time makes. LAX is now a nightmare. Just getting on the shuttle was a chore. The shuttle serves the Crowne Plaza as well and was packed each time I used it. (Amazing, since I arrived at 10pm and left at 7am). I can't blame the hotel for the number of clients using the shuttle, but in consideration of the number of clients and the time it takes to transit the terminals now, an additional shuttle bus should be considered. Check-in was fine, but that's because I was first off the bus. I'm sure the 10 other guests would not have agreed, considering that there was only one person doing check-ins. The hotel now has new carpets, but that's where the upkeep seems to have stopped. My matress was worn out, and I was surprised to see that the sheets had major holes in them. As the hotel uses low quality institutional grade polyester blend sheets, the holes were quite evident. The purported internet access in the room was not available and the TV internet option was useless. (speed and accuracy of the infrared device was poor.) So much for this being a "business" type hotel. In fairness to Radisson though, the room was fairly clean and there were decent sized soaps and shampoos etc. in the bathroom. As well, the room rate fairly reflected the low end aspect of the hotel. This is not a hotel where you go for a vacation. It is suitable for a quick transit overnight and that's it. I only stayed 9 hours and it was good enough for that.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like a pack of cigarettes!”
Reviews.Author: julienjay
Reviews.Content: I booked on Priceline ($80) so wasn't given the choice of smoking or non-smoking. They assigned me to a smoking floor (which normally wouldn't bother me). But the second I walked down the hall, it reeked of cigarettes! It was worse than any casino I've ever been in. I complained to the bellman and he said, 'Yeah, it always smells like this.' The room smelled a LITTLE BIT better, but when I called to request another room (explaining I had 2 small kids with me), they said there were no non-smoking rooms available. I was coughing all night! After a while, the room itself began to reek. The worst part is--the next day we flew to Hawaii, and when I opened up my suitcase, my pajamas I'd worn the night before at the Radisson REEKED of cigarette smoke! And of course we weren't smoking in our rooms, so this was all secondhand smoke. Very poor venilation. I will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: maaydaay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the LAX airport with frequent shuttle service and good service for the shuttles. I used the hotel as a base for my 2-day stay to explore the Los Angeles city area. The car rental agency, Midway is right in the hotel, making it easy to rent a car straight off. Midway offers one of the lowest rates in the LAX and I have used it with no problems. The two double-bed room I got was spacious and clean. It was a great value for the priceline value I paid ($55). There is free wired internet. Free parking can be got on 98th St. 2-hr free parking during the day and free from 6pm-8am. The parking at the hotel will set you back $14 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad considering”
Reviews.Author: TommyD2
Reviews.Content: It's a hotel at LAX, and for the price in this area ($109 internet rate) it could be worse. If you're expecting a 5-star hotel, you'll be dissapointed. But I wasn't expecting that, and had a good experience with checkin, and the only other part of the hotel I really saw was the upstairs lounge. The food was decent, the views nice, and the service staff was actually exceptional up there. I think that you get what you pay for, and it is a good value for the price. I'm staying here because I've got a flight to the east coast tomorrow, and didn't want to take a red-eye. It's close/convenient, and I stay here again. TD

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: puteryaker
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible experience! We were greeted with cold service! When we got to our room we found we had only 2 double beds. We went down and asked to be moved to a room with a king bed as we were started a romantic vacation. We were told that because we booked it through Expedia the rooms with King beds were held for people who booked directly through Radisson. In other words, since we booked through Expedia we weren't worth a king bed and were not a "real" Radisson customer. The manager was rude and point blank MEAN to us and other guests. He spent most of his time shooting dirty looks at his employess and being rude to them if they were kind. It was a scene I have NEVER seen in the travel industry. The next morning when we asked where to catch the shuttle we didn't even get eye contact, the girl at the desk pointed around the corner and made some grunting noise. THIS WAS AN ODD PLACE WITH ODD PEOPLE!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one night stand”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: My travel schedule required a one night stand (haha - I wish) at LAX so I shopped around. Radisson was about the cheapest in my quick survey. It's OK for this purpose. The room is clean and very functional, except for a broken desk chair. The bed is a little hard. Free internet access. The sound proofing is very good. I am overlooking the corner of Sepulveda and Century, and two active runways, and can't hear a thing. Maybe I'm becoming hard of hearing. However, the heater makes loud clicks when it goes on so you probably want to turn it off at night. The restaurant downstairs is very pleasant and surprisingly good. It does not seem like an airport establishment at all, more credit to them. I recommend this if you are stuck at LAX for one night - good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value, airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveChicago
Reviews.Content: The area around LAX would not be my first choice for a location when visiting Los Angeles as a tourist but this was close to where I needed to be. This was my second stay here and both times I bid Priceline, for a 3* at LAX, the most recent $55 per night plus taxes. The Radisson is the closest hotel to LAX although there are many other options in the area that are almost as convenient. They run a free shuttle to/from the airport. The check in process was quick and pleasant, the only service glitch was the alarm clock that went off at 4 am. The room was spacious and clean, the beds reasonably comfortable and the rooms appeared to be updated since our 2005 visit with warmer colors and updated bathrooms with granite and marble. I requested two double beds ahead of time and they accomodated my request. There was a TV with a very limited number of stations including HBO, iron and ironing board. No in-room safe or refrigerator. I believe there was also wireless internet. The bathroom shower was fine although it took a bit of work to get the hot water on, toiletries included shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soap. There was a hair dryer and coffee maker in the bathroom. There was an outdoor pool and a small health club that was located outside the building that had treadmills, a stationary bike, ski machine and some weight equipment. There are a couple of bars, a casual restaurant and a nicer restaurant. Parking, as with most of the LAX hotels, is an extra $13 per day with in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Billy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Very handy for the airport and the freeway. If you have a car then this is a great location for getting about LA. Parking is extra though ($12.00 when I was there).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikkiD
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt one of the best airport hotels I've stayed in for the price. The staff beyond friendly and met every one of my needs with pleasure. The room was spotless and decent in size. Very delightful, pleasing decor and the sleep number bed was to DIE FOR!!! There wasn't any air traffic noise that disturbed us, being right across from LAX. The view from the 9th floor window was a kick, watching the planes take off and land. The only issue in this area is parking. Fee's are little high $13 public, $17 valet/ overnight. However I used the valet service and couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay with a few bumps in the road!”
Reviews.Author: STLGlobal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after missing a connection after arriving into LAX from Hong Kong. Locating the hotel shuttle was not a problem and the driver was very helpful with bags. Check-in went smooth and the front desk attendant was very pleasant, but seemed unsure how to process the hotel and food vouchers that were issued to me by my airline because of the missed connection. We were given a nice room, comfortable bed, but had to call the 'Guest Services' about the internet service. They sent some engineers up to work on it and they got it working - with my ethernet cable I travel with, not the cable provided by the hotel. We chose to use our 2 dinner vouchers in the hotel restaurant downstairs (Palmira Bar and Grille) and was very, very displeased with the level of service we received. The watier was impatient and dissapeared after taking our order. The food tasted great, but upon requesting the check, the waiter then decided to bus the table (very aggresively and noisily) right in front of us as we finished the last of our drinks. I had notified of the food voucher before ordering and told the waiter I would like to charge the remaining (i.e. tax & tip) to my room. We finally got it settled when he opened another tab on the room for $0.02 and then I added the tip (I was just flying in from overseas and didn't have cash). The breakfast vouchers specifically said they could not be applied toward room service purchases. However, breakfast didn't start in the hotel until 6:00am, and our flight was departing at 6:27am. I called the 'Guest Services' to see what could be done about this, and they authorized for use of the vouchers for room service. So we attempted to order room service at 2:30am (we were still on Asia time). It said the service was 24 hours, but we called 5 times over a period of 20 minutes before we finally reached someone. Order was taken promptly and delivered in just the same manner. It was well prepared and tasted good. The vouchers were presented to the attendant and the remaining balance was paid for in cash, not charged to the room. Upon check-out early that morning at 4:00am, the front desk manager told me their computer systems were down and they wouldn't be able to finalize bills. He told me there was a balance of around $40 for room service remaining and I told him about the food vouchers we had used for room service. He assured me it would be no problem and when they system was up and running it would all be worked out and they would email me a copy of the itemized invoice after that. Four days later I still have not received anything from the hotel, and they still charged my card for an amount I have no idea what it relates to (i.e. no itemized invoice to detail). Nonetheless, what was supposed to be a simple stay after a missed connection turned into more of a hassle for the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable...Once again...”
Reviews.Author: managirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last year after a long flight, and did the same before an early flight this time. Shuttle service has changed since last year & it was pretty much a let down, waited for over a half an hour for a shuttle that was supposed to come every 10-15 minutes. Shuttle wasnt marked correctly..."Radisson" marked shuttle was for mid-town or downtown Radisson not LAX Rad. My correct shuttle is for Crown Plaza and Rad, really irritating after waiting 30 minutes and stopping at every terminal AND Crown Plaza to get to my room- whole process took an hour. Shuttle driver was RUDE too. Don't get me wrong, I actually like this hotel & will mostly likely stay here again, but this was a let down compared to last year. Also our "non-smoking" room/floor reeked of cigarettes. Its a beautiful hotel. the room service menu was really pricey but came proply as ordered at 6am next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: redsquid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights and found the room,dining room and staff all OK. Our only complaint was that one of the waiters was dishonest as he added extra tips to the bill after we had signed the docket. We took the matter up with the front desk and received a refund.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, hard to get to”
Reviews.Author: gwwyjjliu
Reviews.Content: The first night of our two-night stay was a nightmare. We were one floor above a banquet room, where a wedding party was going on and the constant thumping from the dance music kept us up until 2:00 AM. We asked for a change of room but the teenaged desk attendant on duty couldn't help us. Also, the hotel is extremely hard to find as the roads around LAX are quite a maze. Even with a nav system in our car we got lost several times at night and had to make a loop of the LAX terminals to get to the hotel. The parking structure is terribly designed with no elevator, so on the top floor you must haul your luggage down an extremely narrow set of stairs that are only 1 person wide - very inconvenient if other people are coming the opposite direction! Other than that the Radisson LAX is a decent hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated and insulated well from aircraft noise. Airplanes literally fly right past your window but you can barely hear them. Plus, there is a nice observation lounge on the top floor with panoramic views of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place”
Reviews.Author: jayne47
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in L.A. in June and stayed at the Raddisson by the Airport. Upon arriving, we paid for our 1 week parking in full but after 2 days, we where called to the front counter and told we hadn't paid. After they contacted the lady who took our money the night we checked in, it was then she confessed to taking our money and then it was taken care of. I was told on the plane by a resident of L.A. TO NOT TRUST ANYBODY while we where there. That was so true. She was still working there the morning we checked out 5 days later. I wouldn't trust to stay there again. The hotel was nice but the housekeeping ladies spoke no English and getting towels and etc. was a nightmare as well as getting our room cleaned (even when the sign was on our door to clean). L.A. is an okay place to visit but, I 'll stick to my good ole country life in Kentucky!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Transportation from Airport”
Reviews.Author: Conchal
Reviews.Content: The night before we left for Honolulu, we stayed at the Raddisson at LAX. The wait for an available shuttle from the airport to the hotel was over an hour! Three totally full shuttles passed since the Raddisson shuttle serves multiple hotels. One driver was surly and said, "Complain to the company or hotel. I am overworked." I called the hotel three times since it was after 10:30 PM and we were leaving early in the AM. We arrived at LAX at 9:15 PM and did not check into this nearby hotel until 11 PM. To the front desk's credit, they upgraded our room; however, the entire pre-arrival experience was so distasteful that we cancelled our stay on the return and booked at the Marriott. The upgraded room while larger was also defective. The batteries on the TV remote were dead and the telephone wasn't turned on or didn't work. Who knows! By this time it was almost midnight and we needed to get up at 5 AM, so we just crashed. All in all, it was a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “No Welcome Here!”
Reviews.Author: guyinca
Reviews.Content: Our check-in experience here was the most dismal I have experienced in a long while. Arrivng at 240 pm, we were told that no rooms were ready yet and were lectured that check-in didn't start until 3 pm. Even so, rooms would not be available then either! (Just what were the maids doing all day???) No offer was made to store our luggage, so we hauled it back out to the car. I had the guy hold a double room for us and went about our stay in LA. Returning about 10 pm, we went to the desk and dealt with yet another clerk who didn't seem at all happy to be working there. He gave us our keys without so much as a welcome. We then entered room 732 where we were about bowled over by the reeking smell. On top of that, it was a single bed. We returned to checkout and dealt with yet a third employee who deemed to us to be wishing he was elsewhere.. Not a smile, not a sorry for the mistake. So I finally asked him why all of the clerks were so cold and unwelcoming and he just looked at me with a shrug. The new room was better, but the remote on the tv didn't work. My note to housekeeping was left prominently in the room where it remained a day later with no new remote appearing. The chances of us staying here again are ...pretty remote!

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to Star rating”
Reviews.Author: BonesCentralCoastNSW
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for a business meeting stopover in LA. Although renovated and looking really good on the web, it just doesn't live up to expectations. The place really smells, I suspect because of very old carpet and years of smokers. I was originally given a smoking room and walked straight back to reception to get a non-smoker. After some time I was given a new room, which didn't smell a lot better. The shower curtain over the bath made the shower very narrow. The internet keyboard didn't work. The airbed gadget is useless. Shuttle was OK - it's free apart from a tip, so you can't complain. The steak in the Hotel restaurant was the only good thing at the Hotel. I got an early flight back home to Australia so I didn't have to spend a second night in the Radisson. Basically just a tourist trap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Great Location, Very Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the airport. Large soundproofed clean comfortable room on the 10th floor. Bathroom was in excellent condition. Internet access available in lobby & rooms (TV etc). Breakfast was a very good choice buffet or menu option. Coffee bar with muffins, fruit etc available in the lobby. Lunch & dinner choices available very good. Lounge bar area. Free regular shuttle to ALL the airport terminals. Gym and pool available. Easy access to Santa Monica etc. City & region day tours depot is nearby with hotel pickups. Safe area to go for an early morning walk.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of booking at radisson.com”
Reviews.Author: Differs
Reviews.Content: Beware of booking at Radisson.com site as they have a fraudulent guarantee of 'best rates online guaranteed'. I didn't bother to look at any other sites becuase of this guarantee and booked the lowest rate for the night of my stay. I then looked at another site and they had the same room for significantly less. I submitted a claim under the Radisson 'guarantee' and they informed me that they had found the lower rate on the other site and accept it is lower, but because the tax rate wasn't split out clearly on the other website, they would not be honouring the claim (even though the totals included tax on both rates). Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel, however if you can get a good rate i.e less the $70 then it is bearable. Here are a list of the negatives: Positives 1) Close to the airport, and rooms were quiet. Its a lottery if you get a clean room. Negatives 1) Shuttle Bus is frequent, but it stops at two other hotels and it can get crowded. The bus takes upto 15 mins to the hotel although it is probably only 5 mins away. 2) Initial check in was friendly(lots of jokes), and there was no long wait. Rooms are not great. We were given a room on the 10th floor (it was supposed to be a non-smoking floor) but as soon as we came out of the lifts there was a heavy smell of smoke. We then went into the room, it was small and in poor condition. I then informed the same check in person and all jokes stopped. He gave me another room, which i went to only to find another couple were moving to look to another room because of a fault in the bathroom! I then informed the same check in person and he gave me a room which was on average o.k but there was still a strange odour in the room ! 3) Hotel staff were not flexible at all. I was initally staying 3 nights in the hotel, then flying to Vancouver for 3 nights and back to the Raddison for 1 night. I asked the hotel after my first check out if it was possible to leave 1 small suitcase in the hotel for 3 nights for collection on my return. The guest realations person said this was o.k, but when I went to the Bellman he asked who had said yes. I mentioned it was a person on guest relations who had a name similar to a manager on the front desk and the Bellman said it was not a problem, he had done it many times before. However, the Front Desk Manager came out and he said he was not aware of saying yes. I pointed out that I had spoken to his namesake in guest relations and thats when I was told it was not company policy to store luggage for more then 24hrs and then started quoting me rates of $10 per day for storage. Whether at this time I was supposed to pay some sort of tip to either one I don't know but I expect some consistency in the hotel staff. He mentioned that some staff were on training but this sounded rubbish. 4) Food choice is poor, especially if you are a vegetarian.

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX, That's all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It´s close to the LAX airport, that´s all. It´s a basic hotel, with nothing else. The price is good if you have a low rate, regular rate is expensive. That´s all folks.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sammy1999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for the airport and quiet. It also has a wonderful rooftop bar if you enjoy watching the planes. However, I agree that the service there is very slow. It did not bother me as it meant I couldn't spend too much! My problem with the hotel is the dated decor. Our room was desperate for a makeover, especially the bathroom, where the tiles had been patched with ones that didn't match. In fact, nothing matched. It was the worst I have seen in a hotel of that grade. I was also astounded to see a coffee machine in the bathroom. Surely that's unhygienic, or am I over fussy? Also I didn't feel that the breakfast was really up to scratch. I didn't really expect tinned fruit for breakfast in California.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but rooftop bar needs help”
Reviews.Author: sprintf32768
Reviews.Content: Ok, basics first. The room was fine, there was an ironing board, which was very handy. I think the rooms are perfectly adequate. The lobby was very nice and spacious. The surroundings are very lovely, with palm trees and a great view of the multicoloured cylinders that form the entryway to LAX. The rooftop bar? Awful service. We were there and it was not packed, but the three guys they had working there were __BUSY__ the entire time, and we could not get a drink. Eventually we got a round and some food, but then, we couldn't get the bill! I mean, seriously, this place is a great location with fine decor, we would have blown tons of cash drinking at the hotel bar if only they had any service. We ended up walking down to the Sheraton and enjoying the ambience there. Those guys can run a hotel bar, know what I'm sayin? Oh, the $12 martinis we had that night. How wonderful they were. So that really ticked us off, I mean we're buying $13 martinis and we can't even get service. For someone from Minnesota, you think $13 martini might mean decent service, but no, not anything like it. The breakfast was adequate to mediocre. Satisfactory. Your basic hot-trays of scrambled eggs and bacon, unartistically presented, yawn, with a few attendants running about trying to get everyone coffee. Ho hum. When getting off the elevator, you know the little sign that says "201-221 -->" and indicates which way your room is? Well, the numbers were falling off and you had to use trial and error to find your room. The hotel is very close to LAX, but there is no point in walking there. Even at midnight the little bus was running. And it would have been a pretty hazardous walk. So, it's pretty obvious that our ridiculous experience at the hotel bar pretty much ruined our stay at the hotel. That might seem petty, but sometimes a single detail, like non-existent service at the hotel bar, can just blow a whole stay. And it did, for us. Would never stay there again. The Sheraton is nearly as close, and those guys have a bar AND a sushi restaurant. That said, if you are a conventioneer, don't stay at LAX unless you are already renting a car. There is a mandatory taxi fee that you will incur, anytime you go to/from your hotel. It makes getting to the convention center a much bigger expense than it needs to be.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly fine for a brief stay/layover”
Reviews.Author: radio71
Reviews.Content: This is the closest hotel to the LAX terminal; you can't miss it as you enter/exit LAX. I called them and explained I had an unexpected layover and needed a room for just 6-7 hours, and asked if they had a special rate for that length of stay. The polite desk clerk offered me $65, which I took in an instant. The room was more than adequate; good shower, good beds, nice and clean, and SILENT. The bar/restaurant at the top of the hotel had great views and pretty good food. Get a deal like I got and you'll be most pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: jennitilly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on March 5, 2006, and we were extremely happy with the hotel. We were driving around the area looking for a hotel for one night, before returning to Toronto, and stumbled upon the Radisson. For $109 American a night, we got much more than we expected. We had a single, non-smoking king room, and it was very very spacious. The free internet in the room was very useful, the sleep number bed is very fun to play with (and very comfortable!). Our room was facing the airport and we could hardly hear the planes, however we got a lovely view of the airport. This was the last stop on our vacation and we are very glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated in pretty good shape”
Reviews.Author: WITWIL
Reviews.Content: Very Very close to airport and good shuttle service. Hotel has be renovated. Oddly bath tub and it's fixtures were not changed. Tub was OLD but shower had good pressure and hot water. Sink, toilet, floor and counter were new. The room had been fully renovated. Odd Beds! These sleep number air beds aren't great. Sorta an air mattress inside a regular bed. I generally like a soft bed but these just got floppy with a low number. I found firm was better than a bed with a trough in the middle. Rooms had double windows to block the aircraft noise. This worked well. Bar at penthouse was nice. Overall a good place to overnight before a flight so you can avoid the 405 in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,useless fancy air beds”
Reviews.Author: diceburner
Reviews.Content: They have just renovated their rooms here and now they look really nice,clean ad modern. The staff is great and they will do anything to make your stay pleasant.I was upgraded to a room with one of their "air beds" so much advertised.That was a really bad night.Your are basically sleeping on one of those inflatable camping beds,nothing more than that.It was either to soft or too hard.It really sucked. The hotel face directly LAX's runaway but rooms are totally soundproof. I will go back again,but I will ask for a regular bed

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel next to LAX, some cleaning problems”
Reviews.Author: Chiqui
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to LAX but we didn't notice any noise. The carpet at the foot of one of the beds was soaking wet but we had unpacked before we noticed so just threw towels over it. The room didn't seem very clean: hairs inside the pillow cases, icky plastic shower curtain, etc, though you would probably find this sort of thing at many hotels. I felt like wearing shoes the whole time. I've stayed at the Westin LAX where the AC vent fell off and the shower was small enough for the curtain to stick to me too, so it seems to be slim pickings at LAX. Both hotels gave the impression of being very high traffic. The front desk people at the Radisson were clearly there to process us as soon as possible and get rid of us, while at the Westin they were very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one nite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - but it will take a while to get there via their shuttle. It took us two phone calls before the shuttle arrived. The check in was courteous and quick. Room service was prompt, food was good, and not outrageously priced (for a big city hotel) as was reported earlier. The room - the room was warm; forget working with the thermostat, they must have it preset and you can't tamper with it. The water temperature in the shower was warm only -- forget about taking a nice hot shower, because they have a scald guard on it, and the best we could get was warm. If you are staying here just for one nite, it would be ok. Any longer, and I would definitely go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: biscotti
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 night at Radisson LAX. We were lucky that the receptionist who helped us on Oct 30 late afternoon was fine and courteous, however we noted that the other guy who worked later that night had rather unpleasant attitude toward guests. Courtesy van was OK, although need to have more frequent pick-up services at the airport as other LAX hotels did better in this area. The hotel rooms are basic but still OK in terms of cleanliness, bathroom seems a bit old. Be ready to order hotel room's service for meal as it's not convenient to find nearby restaurant within walking distance. Room service was fast and efficient, food quality was fine. Nothing fancy about the hotel but we could say it's still acceptable for an overnight transit place for further destination.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, easy to catch early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was nicely furnished and clean. Hotel staff was polite and competent. One night of parking was $12 and the garage is a little tight. High speed internet for $9.95. Room charge through hotels.com was $132. I would definitely stay here again if I have to fly out of LAX the next morning. You can walk about 10 minutes and get a tasty meal at In & Out Burger!

Reviews.Title: “No more Radissons for me”
Reviews.Author: mazzyk
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd paid more attention to the review from Sept 25 - it's pretty much spot on and seems to be what to expect from a stay at this hotel. I got a really cheap rate through Octopus Travel on the web - perhaps I should have taken this as a warning! Rate was great but that's where the positive side ends... Although we did get a very helpful courtesy coach driver to the airport on our morning of departure. Arrived at the hotel - not that easy to get the turn-off either - watch out for the signs - at 5.20pm. Drove into the car park and was asked if we were staying overnight. I'd decided that we would unpack and take the hire car back that night and pop into the airport as I wanted to check something with Delta re our transatlantic flights, then get the courtesy coach back. He said it was fine to let the Front Desk know as we would only be using the car park for a couple of hours (max.). Checked-in - non-descript - not even sure if I received a smile from the disinterested staff (I know it's an airport hotel and therefore a huge turnover of guests but please try and be cheery?! I've worked in airport hotels and my staff were never like this thankfully...) After unpacking and changing, went down to get my parking ticket sorted by Front Desk and was told I was being charged $12 - this was 7.30pm. Around $6 an hour. I explained that it had only been 2 hours etc, was leaving the car back to the airport etc but to no avail. So I decided to vote with my feet - I shall never again stay in a Radisson. Quite simple really.... Didn't use any other facilities really except for Room Service which was relatively fast, quite good quality food and the politest member of staff we found at the property. Rooms weren't too small and were clean - pretty anonymous airport hotel rooms - you could have been anywhere... Nothing wrong with that though.... Check-out was again lacking any friendliness - the Front Desk just did not have any interest in their jobs I guess?

Reviews.Title: “What about jet lag?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times on our journey between England and New Zealand. The location is excellent; the rooms quiet and comfortable; airport shuttle is reliable; most of the staff are pleasant and the large heated outdoor pool and gym help to ward off DVT. But, when many of the guests must, like us, arrive when their body clocks are confused, does the hotel only offer food that accords with California time? It would be a great improvement if the room service menu offered poached eggs or even a plain omelette - Mexican food when your stomach thinks it's 3am is not exactly appetising!

Reviews.Title: “A very unpleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Want Motel 6 service and aesthetics at Hilton prices? Than this hotel is for you. The Radisson is very close to LAX, and the bar on the top floor is very nice. Otherwise... The front desk staff are smug and unhelpful, the rooms are very plain (although mine came with an unpleasant odor). The airport can be clearly heard, although it's not bad. The noise from other guests however is very annoying, since as someone said, all the soundproofing seems to have been spent on the exterior. Did I mention how smug the staff is? Overall, the hotel is just a factory cranking out tired travellers from a pretty unpleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, small rooms, painful parking”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: This hotel sounded great from the other tripadvisor.com reviews, but in reality it's a disappointment. I don't like to complain much, and I'm certainly not the kind of traveler who needs every whim catered to, but I've stayed at most of the hotels near LAX and among the major players, this is one of the worst. Even if you get a good deal! 1) Room service charges applied to my bill when I ordered room service. The front desk clerk accused me of lying, then took 20 minutes (literally) to resolve the problem during check-out. No apology or acknowledgement of the delays that this caused, even though it was clearly the hotel's fault. 2) Small rooms: the rooms at the nearby Sheraton, Hilton and Marriott are all much larger and better equipped for business travelers or families. 3) The pool is outdoors, not indoors. The gym had been turned into an airline lounge, and the new exercise room is small, hot and crowded. 4) The "covered" airport parking is only the ground floor of the parking structure, which is almost always full, day or night. You'll likely end up paying $12/day to park on the roof of the garage, which isn't covered and where security isn't as good. Locals like to skateboard in that area, which causes damage to cars and also potential pedestrian accidents. (Also, note that the roof of the parking garage isn't wheelchair accessible.) Again, I'm not usually a picky traveler. But this hotel was not a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cm1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Radisson at LAX for 5 nights while in LA for a family vacation. We found the room to be nice and clean, loved the shower. Do not order the goat milk pizza for room service, my 16 year old son still talks about how gross!! The hotel is in a great location for first time vacationers to LA. It is right on a main road and we found it easy to get to all of the sights on our list. The only problem we had was the price for parking. We were told it was $5.00 per day when we checked in, upon check out we were charged $12.00. When we asked the "manager" on duty why we were overcharged, she simply stated that the cost for someone staying at an event is $5.00, regular overnight is $12.00. She told us she would have the clerk who checked us in call us, that was a month ago, still no phone call. I even wrote the corp office, they forwarded it to the hotel manager. Still no one word. We are going back again next year, but if they do not clear up their parking charges we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gillyvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel July 24th and August 11th each for just the one night. Courtesy shuttle to and from the airport was fast and efficent, check in on both occasions was flawless with polite and cheerful clerks. The rooms were more than adequate for two adult and two children and clean. Even though the hotel was close to the airport you heard no aircraft noise. A must visit whilst at this hotel is the lounge on the roof as you get a panoramic view of the whole of the airport able to watch planes landing and taking off on all the runways. If flying into LAX in the future would have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again as clean and pleasent hotel and extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great for travellers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 12 hour flight from New Zealand. We requested an early check in and our room was ready at noon when we arrived (via the very handy free airport shuttle). Would highly recommend the express check in as it takes a minute or two at the most. Our room was on the 10th floor and over looked LAX but was very quiet thanks to the double glazing. Room was clean and tidy, a good size and nicely decorated. Could not get the shower to work though. Spent a bit of time stretching out by the pool area after our flight. The pool is great but kind of niosy given that it's right next to the airport runway. Had an excellent steak dinner at the restaurant downstairs. Found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All.”
Reviews.Author: Daveman
Reviews.Content: We stay here each Dec. 31 to catch a flight home to Iowa. we have never had the problems some of these people have and have never talked to anyone upset with the hotel. True we walk someplace to eat and enjoy the last night in California outside but this place is clean, easy to deal with from the airport, and quiet. If you get $53.00 on priceline and have a nasty comment about this place you have to be the prima donna of the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night over”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 2 nights, 1 on my way from sydney to orlando and on the way back. The 1st night was excellent, just got off a 16 hour flight and only had to way 10 min for the shuttle and got to the hotel in about 2 min, great staff and the rooms where excellent with a good view, room services where great and the chiken strips where perfect, Beds where comfertable and room was a decent size. On the way back from orlando, the service was not as good as the first time, staff where great but the room was differnt, was old, and didnt look as nice as the first one.... would and will stay again for a 1 nighter on a stop over, but no more than 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth recommending if staying in the area...”
Reviews.Author: JandJDC
