Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there overnight after our trip from Australia on our way home to Washington, DC... and I enjoyed it enough that I chose to stay there again for a business trip later in Santa Monica. The rooms were clean, well-furnished and spacious. The restaurant is EXCELLENT, which was a very pleasant surprise to us (in fact, it was some of the best food we had during our entire vacation). The exercise room is basic, consisting largely of a few cardio machines and some add'l machines. The nice perks are the complimentary shuttle, internet access, and very close access to public transportation which takes you to Santa Monica for 25 cents. Overall, this hotel is worth recommending, esp. if you are flying into/out of LAX (as it is the nearest hotel to the airport, and has a shuttle to boot).

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Miami for our honeymoon and spend the night there for a early flight. Room service was terrible....it was cold and extremely expensive. ALL THE THINGS THAT MADE IT THE WORST HOTEL -BAD ROOM SERVICE, SLOW, EXPENSIVE, COLD FOOD -we pillows were really hard and uncomfortable. -The AC unit was extremely loud -they forgot to do a wake up call for us the next morning, we almost missed our flight.. -Front dest would not pick up calls..... It was just ridiculous........you are better off in motel 6, at least its cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: ABtrip
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay at the LAX. My wife and I crashed here the night of our arrival at LAX. Its a great place because it is so close to the airport. Maybe the closest property. So as soon as you leave the terminal your shuttle is just a quick ride. Front desk was great, and quick. Rooms were very clean, comfortable bed and pillows and dead quiet, considering we could see many planes landing, but no noise. The best part was the room service. We were tired and hungry...we each ordered salads and some side dishes. The food was excellent, not just your normal basic hotel food. We were really impressed. We also stayed at the doubletree down the road on our way out of LA. Also a great hotel with ultracomfortable beds. Both are great hotels. I wouldnt stay at Radisson for our whole trip because of proximity to LAX. We stayed at the doubletree for most of our trip, since it is just far enough away from LAX in el segundo that you actually feel like you're in a city, not airport. Both are great. But the Radisson is best for quick in/out airport access.

Reviews.Title: “Wretching experience with room service food!!!”
Reviews.Author: coando
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Raddison on an overnight layover the night of June 29th 2005. We got the property for a $53 Priceline bid. The shuttle service to and from the airport was great and the rooms were pretty with a great view. However, because of the soundproofing on the windows there was no air circulation and our air conditioner kept freezing up and turning itself off so that the room would become hot and stuffy. The food situation was the absolute worst! There is not a single vending machine onsite to get a little snack, so having arrived at midnight we were completely dependant on room service. We ordered up some steak and eggs for $21.50 a plate and when they finally arrived about 45 minutes later (Thank God Taxicab Confessions was on TV to help pass the time!) the food was cold and pathetic, with burnt fried eggs topping teeny tiny dry looking steaks, sans the promised breakfast potatoes. We called up to inquire about the potatoes, and they simply said they were out and there would be no substitutions., We told them we wanted to send the steaks back and order something else and they agreed, so we got 2 pasta primaveras, which was so foul tasting my husband didn't eat his. About 2 hours later I began to get sick and had to fly back from LA to Denver with, without going into sickening detail, what I suspect was a fairly raging case of food poisoning which has lasted 2 days. To add injury to insult, we were charged the prices for the original meals, which were almost twice as much, and the front desk refused to give us a breakdown of the food bill so we could see what we were actually being charged for!!! We will NEVER stay at this property again!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: linahad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days after we landed in LA two-and-a-half weeksk ago. The hotel is fine, but very basic for its price. We got the impression that the hotel staff don't really care enough about their guests to make the rooms look nice. They are just basic. I wouldn't stay here again. We also stayed at the Radisson in San Diego and, although we had a fabulous view from the 21st floor, we again did not feel all that comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for 1 night as we had an early flight back to ATL and wanted the closest hotel to the terminal. Checkin went smooth. The room was clean and decorated nicely, but that was it. The A/C was mimimal and of course, you could not open a window. There was not a pillow top as described on the website, but the bed was comfortable. The problem was the shower. The water pressure was very low and the shower curtain was almost in the middle of the shower area. No washcloths, so I used a hand towel. Running a bath would have been quicker than taking a shower. This was for one night and I paid a good rate ($69 inclusive). This would not be our choice for more than 1 night. Stay here again? No, but if the rate is low again, maybe. Fyi, I have never found a good LAX airport hotel as we visit here frequently. The Radisson was probably the best, though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good price, enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am also puzzled by some of the negative commentary. The location is convenient enough. The airport area has its quirks in terms of exits from the freeways, but its doable. The major freeways get you where you want to go. The concierges knew their stuff. Victor took the time to point out a couple of good restaurants as well as shopping and helped out with some directions. The check in took a little while, but there were a lot of folks. My room was clean. I was on the fouth floor of the hotel. The channel selection on the tube isn't the greatest, but I don't visit LA to watch TV. A nice touch is the road map on the room key envelope. You dont want to be fiddling with a map driving on those roads. Can't complain folks. Got a great price and a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “good value and over all good service”
Reviews.Author: westcotesgirl
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most of the comments in these reviews. We started off our two week holiday at the raddison, and after a long flight and harrowing journey to get to the hotel, check in was smooth and effiecent. Room facilities and the comfy bed spot on - all up to expectations of raddison. I would agree that most of the staff were very friendly and warm, especially the resturant staff. The only exception being one of the desk staff - who appeared a little off hand / dis-interested (although not impolite in any way) and also a security guard for a conference that tried to stop me leaving the hotel after we had checked out! as I was leaving by the side door - and he wanted to see an ID tag - I have the impression that business customers may well be priotised by some of the staff - rather than average tourists in average holiday clothes, who are paying a similar rate per night!!!!! however this small niggle would not stop me returning! On the whole a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stressfree stopover before or after a flight”
Reviews.Author: worldtrundler
Reviews.Content: After reading comments on Tripadvisor.com before we left on our vacation (seems as though there are better reviews now) I was a little hesitant about staying at this hotel. It was better than expected.Our adjoining room request was fulfilled and the rooms decor was quite nice. The pool area was beautiful and great for our children. The only thing it was missing was a toddler wading area, but given the age of the hotel I can understand why it is not there. The laundry room was clean and functional. There is one washer and one dryer at each of two locations (3rd and 12th fl). The restaurant food was excellent. Slightly pricey for the average family. but the servers were exceptional with the entire family, my 2 and 6yr old included. The bellhop staff were exceptionally friendly, especially Dwayne who comandeered two luggage carts by himself so that 6 of us could leave at the same time. There is also a business center with internet and printers and a givt shop that has souvenirs and a bit of everything. Note to parents: they do not have diapers or wipes but it's a 5 minute cab rid to the drugstore/grocery store. The only constructive critisism that I would make is that the front desk clerk could be a little more warm, when I asked them on what floors I could find the laundry, they gave my the information, but nothing else. The woman seemed as though she was wishing herself to be somewhere else. However, overall our stay was very stressfree and enjoyable. Both of our parties would choose the Radisson Airport again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radison”
Reviews.Author: GMDHDA
Reviews.Content: It is two years since i stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend, we both have very fond memories. The staff and facilities are superb and i would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody. Next time we are in LA we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after a late cross country flight. The room was clean and comfortable. The shuttle to and from the airport was quick and the shuttle drivers were extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk clerk was a little snooty. I got a great rate on Priceline and the hotel was worth every penny. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the "Four-Star" I Used Before!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a good Priceline deal on a 4-star hotel on my way into LA, and was a bit disappointed that I only got the Radisson, a 3-star on my way out. As it turned out, the Thursday night stay at the Radisson was much more satisfactory than my stay at the "ritzier" place. Very friendly and convenient check-in - no waiting, smiling faces. Immediately took a shower in the very clean bedroom and sank down to a deep sleep in the big, clean, comfy bed. I coudn't hear a sound from the airplane traffic. In the morning, a newspaper was waiting by my door and the shuttle was waiting at the door (at 6 a.m.) to drive me to the airport - again, no waiting or problems. Driver was friendly and courteous. The only glitch was that I had requested a wake-up call that didn't come. Fortunately, I was up anyway... but since I'm never sure how ever alarm clock model works, the wake-up call would be nice. All in all, a very nice stay at a very reasonable price. I'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Shuttle from the airport was good and driver helpful. Checkin efficient and helpful. Room looked a bit tired in places and some things could do with being replaced, but clean anyway. Breakfast was reasonable and coffee service good. All in all a reasonable hotel for a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: valmont
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel many years ago when it was a Hyatt. It’s been a few different hotels since but I was very impressed by my stay under its latest incarnation, the Radisson. For an airport property, it was amazing. Service was fast and friendly, the f&b outlets outstanding. Rooms were well-sized and well-appointed and comfortable. Rates are well below something like the Westin LAX which isn’t half as good a hotel. A great advantage with this hotel is that it’s a block-and-a-half from the Santa Monica Big Blue Bus depot. For 75 cents, you get a one-way fare to the Third Avenue Promenade, the social hub of Santa Monica. From there, other BBB routes service Century City, Beverly Hills and Downtown LA. The Radisson LAX is great value, a great hotel and I’ll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson LAX for one night after a long overseas flight. For an airport hotel it was clean, comfortable and affordable. It was also super convenient being probably the closest hotel to LAX. I would not hesitate to recommend it. Now if one wants something for a longer stay, I'm sure there are as good if not better properties further from the airport and more convenient to other So. Cal. attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, super location”
Reviews.Author: CED1245
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Priceline and got this hotel for a one night stay prior to a 6 AM departure from LAX. I had read the reviews prior to arriving at the hotel and was a little concerned. My concern was unfounded. The hotel was very clean, well maintained. The room had two beds, a desk, TV, decent size bathroom. We had room service the night we arrived for dinner and it wasn't badly priced (as room services goes) and the food was good. The room service waiter was very accommodating and even asked if there was anything else we needed for the baby (my granddaughter). The next morning as we left for our flight it was only 5 AM but the man who came for our baggage was more than helpful. We had so much stuff, four suitcases, a couple carryons, car seat and stroller. He took everything down and waited until the hotel van came. By the time the van arrived, there were at least 30 people waiting to board. He made sure that my daughter, the baby and I got on first and that all of our items were on the van too. Some of the people waiting to board the van were less than tolerant with the small child and all her stuff. Would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and convenient...”
Reviews.Author: robinson62
Reviews.Content: Just popped into town to be in the audience for a talk show. I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg, nor did I want to jeopardize my safety. The Radisson was clean, convenient, safe...staff was accomodating and helped me to get around to tourist attractions on the metro. Courtesy Shuttle was convenient and always available. No one...and I mean no one was nasty or discourteous to me. Room service and the restaurant was alittle expensive but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Yankdo
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to add a few comments about the Radisson LAX. We stayed one night Feb 27th and found the hotel to be OK nothing exciting but we were just looking for a place to crash before catching an early AM flight back to Boston. When we arrived at the hotel the "self" check in was full and as I had 2 kids and 88 yr old Mom with me I found this very inconvenient. The valet guy was not particularly helpful at first (who wants to wait on a middle age Mom when there are limos lined up everywhere) as it was Oscar night but he valet parked my car for an hour so we could check in before returning the car to Hertz. On check out they wanted to charge me for valet parking (something like $14) until I reminded them that the "self" was full and I didn't have any options. Check in was somewhat of a nightmare as the system had "crashed". It seemed as though the system must frequently crash as they had a system worked out with walkie talkies and paper cards to determine who got what room. Truly bizarre! We had to wait about 40 mins to be given a room. There were 4 of us so no we couldn't snuggle into a king bed room!! I had booked at the Radisson for the pool & hot tub for the kids but we had a hard time finding it and it was so dark and scary that they wouldn't go near it. The room was quite small though it had a good view of LA from the 9th floor with a little airport noise but not bad. They did quickly bring a rollaway once I reminded them about it. Come to think of it I don't think they charged me for the rollaway. We didn't pay much for the room $69 so that was a plus and we used room service which came pretty quickly and was fairly reasonable and tasty. They had a very big room service menu with lots of casual choices which was great for the teenage kids. I didn't frankly feel safe enough in the area around the hotel to walk outside with an older person and kids to find somewhere else to eat and besides we wanted to watch the Oscars on TV! The shuttle worked out well and the staff was generally friendly. I was surprised that they did not offer express check out though. If you can get the room at a cheap rate then I wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “A MUst Place to Stayt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Radisson has the absolute friendliest staff of any hotel in Los Angeles. The Palmira restaurant had the best food in West Los Angeles. You must eat in this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good exprience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Raddison for a night in January, 2005. The shuttle bypassed me the first time at the airport but the Century City Raddison bus picked me up and took me to the hotel. The check in staff was a little strange (a bit familiar) but efficient. Though the exterior was beat, the lobby was cheerful and newly decorated and my room was very nice. I had a panoramic view of the city, the Hollywood sign and the hiils! The room was quite and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was really quite good. I picked my rental car up the am after arrival. When I came back the car parking staff let me park and pack and check out without a charge. Thje guy was a doll! I am wondering if it is the same place as some of the bad reviews here. I was was a priceline customer and recieved no discrimination. Stayed for $52.00/ night. DK

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: vulk
Reviews.Content: We were extremely dissapoinited in our stay at Radisson Hotel near LAX. Despite having a guranteed late night arrival, our reserved non-smoking room was given away, so we had no choice but to accept a smoking room. Tried to get some rest after a long flight, but it was impossible, because of very loud and drunk next door neighboors who talked loudly in the hallway all night long. At 3am we could't take it any more and called the hotel security. The security guard asked them to settle down, but to no avail. At some point we fell asleep only to be awaken at 7 am by the sound of a vacuum sweeper and the room service staff who started their early day's work. The whole experience was unbelievable and the hotel performed miserably in the most basic element of service, such as providing a reliable, secure and quiet place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment plus!!”
Reviews.Author: VICanada
Reviews.Content: Dec 14, 2004 -- Hot, noisy rooms, polite but, grumpy staff, dark (evening swim) and questionably-clean pool. We would not stay here again. I researched this hotel using this site. We wanted a nice place to stay to get a good night's sleep before our 8am flight. We did not. The room is very hot and air conditioner noisier than you would expect. Lots of hallway and adjacent room noise. No coffee available in the room and restaurant desk girl could not find the cream or change for me. It is close to airport but, you'd be better off finding another hotel for your money.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Raddison Stay”
Reviews.Author: nd83cheg
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at the Raddison at LAX on October 19, 2004. The hotel can certainly claim its proximity to the airport, and the price wasn't bad. However overall there was nothing about the Raddison that stood out as exceptional. The shuttle that picks you up at the airport was adequate; the lobby of the hotel was very nice. The checkin process was efficient given the number of people checking in at once. The room however was adequate at best. The furniture and the carpeting looked like they were ready to be replaced. The bathroom was rather small and standard. One major drawback was the lack of a coffee pot in the room. It seems that most hotels now do include a coffee pot in the room, even the Super-8 style motels, yet the Radisson didn't. Checkout process was relatively quick also, although I was surprised that express checkout wasn't a standard option. For the price and convenience to LAX, the Radisson was ok, but certainly not somewhere where I would stay for more than a few hours overnight.

Reviews.Title: “review of our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radission Hotel @LAX on Nov.6-7. ck. in @ 1130 pm The first room we checked into had a dirty babies diaper in the bathroom trash can!!! We called the front desk and they moved us to the 4th floor, above a dance floor which was very noisy!! 12:15 am we got moved again to the 10th floor!! it was better then the other 2 rooms! we complained and got NOTHING!!!! not even a I am SORRY!!!! We travel alot and stay at many hotels but this was the first time we stayed at Radission@ LAX and the LAST TIME!!!! SGT. Chow

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: The_curious_limper
Reviews.Content: Nothing special - a pretty average airport hotel. Bathroom seemed a bit dated and I was waiting for what seemed an age for the shuttle to collect me from the airport. The TV in the room didn't work properly - it looked like their system had crashed. Breakfast was expensive for what it was. Ok for one night but n ot much more.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel at Los Angeles Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 6225 W. Century Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90045
